original: svadhāṃ pitṛbhya āśāṃ manuṣyebhyas tṛṇodakaṃ paśubhyaḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ yajamānāyānnam ātmana āgāyānīty etāni manasā dhyāyann apramattaḥ stuvīta
analyzed: svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ āśām manuṣyebhyaḥ tṛṇa udakam paśubhyaḥ svargam lokam yajamānāya annam ātmane āgāyāni iti etāni manasā dhyāyan apramattaḥ stuvīta
translated: He should sing, thinking, 'I will bring the sacrificial essence to the fathers, hope to men, grass and water to the cattle, heaven to the sacrificer, food to myself.' He should praise, meditating on these things in his mind, without being heedless.

analyzed: amṛta tvam devebhyaḥ āgāyāni sādhayāni
translated: He should sing, 'I will bring immortality to the gods, I will accomplish it.

original: svadhāṃ pitṛbhya āgāyānyāśāṃ manuṣyebhya āśāṃ prārthanāṃ prārthitamityetat /
analyzed: svadhām pitṛbhyaḥ āgāya ani āśām manuṣyebhyaḥ āśām prārthanām prārthitam iti etat
translated: He should sing, 'I will bring the sacrificial essence to the fathers, hope to men, hope means prayer, that which is prayed for.

original: tṛṇodakaṃ paśubhyaḥ svargaṃ lokaṃ yajamānāyānnamātmane mahyamāgāyānītyetāni manasā cintayandhyāyannapramattaḥ svaroṣmavyañjanādibhyaḥ stuvīta
analyzed: tṛṇa udakam paśubhyaḥ svargam lokam yajamānāya annam ātmane mahyam āgāyāni iti etāni manasā cintayan dhyāyan apramattaḥ svara ūṣma vyañjana ādibhyaḥ stuvīta
translated: He should sing, 'I will bring grass and water to the cattle, heaven to the sacrificer, food to myself.' Meditating on these things in his mind, he should praise, without being heedless of the tones, the sibilants, the consonants, etc.

analyzed: sarve svarāḥ indrasya ātmānaḥ
translated: All the vowels are the self of Indra.

analyzed: sarve ūṣmāṇaḥ prajāpateḥ ātmānaḥ
translated: All the sibilants are the self of Prajāpati.

analyzed: sarve sparśāḥ mṛtyoḥ ātmānaḥ
translated: All the consonants are the self of Death.

analyzed: tam yadi svareṣu upālabheta
translated: If he should be reproached about the vowels,

original: indraṃ śaraṇaṃ prapanno 'bhūvaṃ sa tvā prati vakṣyatīty enaṃ brūyāt //
analyzed: indram śaraṇam prapannaḥ bhūvam sa tvā prati vakṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: he should say to him, 'I have gone for refuge to Indra, he will answer you back.'

original: sarve svarā akārādaya indrasya balakarmaṇaḥ prāṇasyā'tmāno dehāvayavasthānīyāḥ sarva ūṣmāṇaḥ śaṣasahādayaḥ prajāpatervirājaḥ
analyzed: sarve svarāḥ akāra ādayaḥ indrasya bala karmaṇaḥ prāṇasya ātmānaḥ deha avayava sthānīyāḥ sarve ūṣmāṇaḥ śa ṣa saha ādayaḥ prajāpateḥ virājaḥ
translated: All vowels beginning with 'a' are the self of Indra, the powerful one, the vital breath, like parts of the body. All sibilants beginning with 'śa' are the self of Prajāpati, Virāj,

analyzed: kaśyapasya vā ātmānaḥ
translated: or of Kaśyapa.

original: sarve sparśāḥ kādayo vyañjanāni mṛtyorātmānastamevaṃvidamudgātāraṃ yadi kaścitsvareṣūpālabheta🔽svarastvayā duṣṭaḥ prayukta ityevamupālabdha indraṃ prāṇamīśvaraṃ śaraṇamāśrayaṃ
analyzed: sarve sparśāḥ ka ādayaḥ vyañjanāni mṛtyoḥ ātmānaḥ tam evaṃvidam udgātāram yadi kaścid svareṣu upālabheta  svaraḥ tvayā duṣṭaḥ prayuktaḥ iti evam upālabdhaḥ indram prāṇam īśvaram śaraṇam āśrayam
translated: All consonants beginning with 'ka' are the self of Death. If someone were to reproach the Udgātṛ who knows this thus,🔽saying You have used a faulty vowel, having been thus reproached, he should say to him, I have taken refuge in Indra, the vital breath, the lord,

original: prapanno 'bhūvaṃ svarān prayuñjāno 'haṃ sa indro yattava vaktavyaṃ tvā tvāṃ prati
analyzed: prapannaḥ bhūvam svarān prayuñjānaḥ ham saḥ indraḥ yat tava vaktavyam tvā tvām prati
translated: while using the vowels. He, Indra, will speak to you, to you.

original: vakṣyati sa eva deva uttaraṃ dāsyatītyenaṃ brūyāt //
analyzed: vakṣyati saḥ eva devaḥ uttaram dāsyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: He, the god, will give you an answer.

analyzed: atha yadi enam ūṣmāsu upālabheta
translated: If he were to reproach him regarding the sibilants,

original: prajāpatiṃ śaraṇaṃ prapanno 'bhūvaṃ sa tvā prati pekṣyatīty enaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: prajāpatim śaraṇam prapannaḥ bhūvam sa tvā prati pekṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: he should say to him, I have taken refuge in Prajāpati. He will look at you.

analyzed: atha yadi enam sparśeṣu upālabheta
translated: If he were to reproach him regarding the consonants,

original: mṛtyuṃ śaraṇaṃ prapanno 'bhūvaṃ sa tvā prati dhakṣyatīty enaṃ brūyāt //
analyzed: mṛtyum śaraṇam prapannaḥ bhūvam sa tvā prati dhakṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: he should say to him, I have taken refuge in Death. He will burn you.

original: atha yadyenamūṣmasu tathaivopālabheta prajāpatiṃ śaraṇaṃ prapanno 'bhūvaṃ sa tvā pratipekṣyati sañcūrṇayiṣyatītyenaṃ brūyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi enam ūṣmasu tathā eva upālabheta prajāpatim śaraṇam prapannaḥ bhūvam sa tvā pratipekṣyati sañcūrṇayiṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: Now if he should be reproached in the same way in the vowels, he should say to him, 'I have taken refuge in Prajapati. He will take care of you and crush you to dust.'

original: atha yadyenaṃ sparśeṣūpālabheta mṛtyuṃ śaraṇaṃ prapanno 'bhūvaṃ sa tvā prati dhakṣyati bhasmīkariṣyatītyenaṃ brūyāt //
analyzed: atha yadi enam sparśeṣu upālabheta mṛtyum śaraṇam prapannaḥ bhūvam sa tvā prati dhakṣyati bhasmīkariṣyati iti enam brūyāt
translated: Now if he should be reproached in the semi-vowels, he should say to him, 'I have taken refuge in Death. He will burn you up and reduce you to ashes.'

original: sarve svarā ghoṣavanto balavanto vaktavyā indre balaṃ dadānīti /
analyzed: sarve svarāḥ ghoṣavantaḥ balavantaḥ vaktavyāḥ indre balam dadāni iti
translated: All the vowels should be pronounced with sound, with strength, with the thought, 'I bestow strength in Indra.'

original: sarva ūṣmāṇo 'grastā anirastā vivṛtā vaktavyāḥ prajāpater ātmānaṃ paridadānīti /
analyzed: sarve ūṣmāṇaḥ grastāḥ a nirastāḥ vivṛtāḥ vaktavyāḥ prajāpateḥ ātmānam paridadāni iti
translated: All the sibilants should be pronounced without being swallowed, without being suppressed, open, with the thought, 'I give myself over to Prajapati.'

original: sarve sparśā leśenānabhinihitā vaktavyā mṛtyor ātmānaṃ pariharāṇīti //🔽yata indrādyātmānaḥ svarādayo 'taḥ sarve svarā ghoṣavanto balavanto vaktavyāḥ /
analyzed: sarve sparśāḥ leśena anabhinihitāḥ vaktavyāḥ mṛtyoḥ ātmānam pariharāṇi iti  yatas indra ādi ātmānaḥ svara ādayaḥ tasmāt sarve svarāḥ ghoṣavantaḥ balavantaḥ vaktavyāḥ
translated: All the semi-vowels should be pronounced with a trace, without being fully pronounced, with the thought, 'I keep myself away from Death.'🔽Since the vowels and the rest are the Self of Indra and the rest, therefore all the vowels should be pronounced with sound, with strength,

analyzed: tathā aham indre balam dadāni balam ādadhāni iti
translated: with the thought, 'I bestow strength in Indra,' 'I add strength.'

original: tathā sarva ūṣmāṇo 'grastā antarapraveśitā anirastā bahiraprakṣiptā vivṛtā vivṛtaprayatnopetāḥ prajāpaterātmānaṃ paridadāni prayacchānīti
analyzed: tathā sarve ūṣmāṇaḥ grastāḥ antara praveśitāḥ a nirastāḥ bahis a prakṣiptāḥ vivṛtāḥ vivṛta prayatna upetāḥ prajāpateḥ ātmānam paridadāni prayacchāni iti
translated: Similarly, all the sibilants, not swallowed, not taken inside, not ejected, not thrown outside, open, accompanied by the open effort, I should give, I should offer, the self of Prajapati.

original: sarve sparśā leśena śanakairanabhinihitā anabhinikṣiptā vaktavyā mṛtyorātmānaṃ bālāniva śanakaiḥ pariharan mṛtyorātmānaṃ pariharāṇīti //
analyzed: sarve sparśāḥ leśena śanakais anabhinihitāḥ anabhinikṣiptāḥ vaktavyāḥ mṛtyoḥ ātmānam bālān iva śanakais pariharan mṛtyoḥ ātmānam pariharāṇi iti
translated: All the touches should be spoken of as slowly and slightly not pressed, not thrown down, avoiding the self of Death, as if slowly avoiding children, I should avoid the self of Death.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi dvitīya adhyāyasya dvāviṃśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twenty-second section in the second chapter of the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

analyzed: trayaḥ dharma skandhāḥ
translated: There are three branches of dharma.

analyzed: yajñaḥ dhī ayanam dānam iti prathamaḥ
translated: Sacrifice, study, and charity - this is the first.

analyzed: tapaḥ eva dvitīyaḥ
translated: Austerity alone is the second.

analyzed: brahmacārī ācārya kula vāsī ātmānam ācārya kule vasādayan
translated: The celibate student living in the teacher's house, the third, completely dedicating himself to the teacher's house.

analyzed: sarve ete puṇya lokāḥ bhavanti
translated: All of these become people of meritorious worlds.

analyzed: brahma saṃsthaḥ mṛta tvam eti
translated: One who is established in Brahman attains immortality.

analyzed: oṅkārasya upāsana vidhi artham trayaḥ dharma skandhāḥ ityādi ārabhyate
translated: For the purpose of the injunction to meditate on the syllable Om, the three branches of dharma are begun with this.

analyzed: na evam manatavyam sāma avayava bhūtasya eva udgītha ādi lakṣaṇasya oṅkārasya upāsanāt phalam prāpyate iti
translated: One should not think that the result is attained by the meditation on the syllable Om, which is characterized by the Udgītha etc., which is a part of the Sāman.

original: kiṃ tarhi /yatsarvairapi sāmopāsanaiḥ karmabhiścāprāpyaṃ tatphalamamṛtatvaṃ kevalādoṅkāropāsanātprāpyata iti /
analyzed: kim tarhi yat sarvaiḥ api sāma upāsanaiḥ karmabhiḥ ca a prāpyam tat phalam amṛta tvam kevalāt oṅkāra upāsanāt prāpyate iti
translated: What then? That fruit, immortality, which is unattainable even by all the Sāma meditations and actions, is attained by the meditation on the syllable Om alone.

analyzed: tad stuti artham sāma prakaraṇe tad upanyāsaḥ
translated: The mention of that [meditation] is for the purpose of praising it in the context of the Sāma.

original: trayasrisaṃkhyākā dharmasya skandhā dharmaskandhāḥ dharmavibāgā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: trayasri saṃkhyākāḥ dharmasya skandhāḥ dharma skandhāḥ dharma vibāgāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The three groups of Dharma are the groups of Dharma. The meaning is the divisions of Dharma.

analyzed: ke te iti āha yajñaḥ gnihotra ādiḥ
translated: What are they? He says: Sacrifice is the Agnihotra and so on.

analyzed: adhyayanam sa niyamasya ṛk ādeḥ abhyāsaḥ
translated: Study is the repetition of the Ṛg and other [Vedas] with rules.

analyzed: dānam bahirvedi yathāśakti dravya saṃvibhāgaḥ bhikṣamāṇebhyaḥ
translated: Giving is the distribution of wealth according to one's ability to those who beg outside the altar.

analyzed: iti eṣa prathamaḥ dharma skandhaḥ
translated: This is the first group of Dharma.

original: gṛhasthasamavetatvāttannirvartakena gṛhasthena nirdiśyate prathama eka ityartho dvitīyatṛtīyaśravaṇānnā'dyārthaḥ /
analyzed: gṛhastha samaveta tvāt tad nirvartakena gṛhasthena nirdiśyate prathamaḥ ekaḥ iti arthaḥ dvitīya tṛtīya śravaṇa annādya arthaḥ
translated: Because it is related to the householder, it is indicated by the householder who performs it. The meaning is the first one. The meaning of the first is not from hearing the second and third.

original: tapa eva dvitīyastapa iti kṛcchracāndrāyaṇādi tadvāṃstāpasaḥ parivrāḍvā na brahmasaṃstha āśramadharmamātrasaṃstho /
analyzed: tapaḥ eva dvitīyaḥ tapaḥ iti kṛcchra cāndrāyaṇa ādi tadvān tāpasaḥ parivrāj vā na brahma saṃsthaḥ āśrama dharma mātra saṃsthaḥ
translated: Austerity itself is the second. Austerity is the Kṛcchra, Cāndrāyaṇa and so on. He who has that is an ascetic or a wandering mendicant, not one who abides in Brahman, but one who abides in the Dharma of the stages of life.

analyzed: brahma saṃsthasya tu amṛta tva śravaṇāt
translated: But for one who abides in Brahman, immortality is heard.

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ dharma skandhaḥ
translated: The second group of Dharma.

analyzed: brahmacārī ācārya kule vastum śīlam asya iti ācārya kula vāsī
translated: He who has the habit of living in the house of the teacher is one who lives in the house of the teacher.

analyzed: atyantam yāvajjīvam ātmānam niyamaiḥ ācārya kule vasādayan kṣapayan deham tṛtīyaḥ dharma skandhaḥ
translated: The third category of Dharma is one who lives in the house of the teacher, exhausting his body by restraining himself with rules for life to the utmost, i.e., for life.

analyzed: atyantam ityādi viśeṣaṇāt naiṣṭhikaḥ iti gamyate
translated: From the specification to the utmost, etc., it is understood that he is a lifelong student.

analyzed: upakurvāṇasya svādhyāya grahaṇa artha tvāt na puṇya loka tvam brahmacaryeṇa
translated: For the student, because he lives in the house of the teacher for the purpose of learning, he does not attain the world of merit by celibacy.

original: sarva ete trayo 'pyāśramiṇo yathoktairdharmaiḥ puṇyalokā bhavanti /
analyzed: sarve ete trayaḥ pi āśramiṇaḥ yathā uktaiḥ dharmaiḥ puṇya lokāḥ bhavanti
translated: All these three stages of life become the world of merit by the Dharmas as stated.

original: puṇyo loko yeṣāṃ ta ime puṇyalokā āśramiṇo bhavanti /
analyzed: puṇyaḥ lokaḥ yeṣām te ime puṇya lokāḥ āśramiṇaḥ bhavanti
translated: Those for whom the world is meritorious, they become the world of merit, the stages of life.

original: avaśiṣṭastvanuktaḥ parivrāḍbrahmasaṃstho brahmaṇi samyaksthitaḥ so 'mṛtatvaṃ puṇyalokavilakṣaṇamamaraṇabhāvamātyantikameti nā'pekṣikaṃ devādyamṛtatvavat
analyzed: avaśiṣṭaḥ tu anuktaḥ parivrāj brahma saṃsthaḥ brahmaṇi samyak sthitaḥ saḥ mṛta tvam puṇya loka vilakṣaṇam amaraṇa bhāvam ātyantikam eti na āpekṣikam deva ādi amṛta tva vat
translated: But the remaining one, the wandering mendicant, who is not mentioned, who is established in Brahman, who is well-established in Brahman, he attains immortality, a state of non-death that is eternal, not temporary like the immortality of the gods, etc.

analyzed: puṇya lokāt pṛyak amṛta tvasya vibhāga karaṇāt
translated: Because immortality is distinguished from the world of merit.

analyzed: yadi ca pumya loka atiśaya mātram amṛta tvam abhaviṣyat tatas puṇya loka tvāt vibhaktam na avakṣyat
translated: And if immortality were merely a superior world of merit, then it would not have been distinguished from the world of merit.

analyzed: vibhakta īpadeśāt ca ātyantikam amṛta tvam iti gamyate
translated: And from the declaration of the division, it is understood that the immortality is absolute.

analyzed: atra ca āśrama dharma phala upanyāsaḥ praṇava sevā stuti artham na tad phala vidhi artham
translated: And here, the mention of the fruits of the duties of the stages of life is for the purpose of praising the service of the Praṇava, not for the purpose of enjoining its fruits.

original: stutaye ca pravamasevāyā āśramadharmaphalavidhaye ceti hi bhidyeta vākyam /
analyzed: stutaye ca pravama sevāyāḥ āśrama dharma phala vidhaye ca iti hi bhidyeta vākyam
translated: And the sentence would be split if it were for the praise of the service of the Praṇava and for the injunction of the fruits of the duties of the stages of life.

analyzed: tasmāt smṛti siddha āśrama phala anuvādena praṇava sevā phalam amṛta tvam bruvan praṇava sevām stauti
translated: Therefore, by referring to the fruits of the stages of life established by Smṛti, by speaking of immortality as the fruit of the service of the Praṇava, it praises the service of the Praṇava.

original: yathā pūrṇavarmaṇaḥ sevā bhaktaparidhānamātraphalā rājavarmaṇastu sevā rājyatulyaphaleti tadvat /
analyzed: yathā pūrṇavarmaṇaḥ sevā bhakta paridhāna mātra phalā rājavarmaṇaḥ tu sevā rājya tulya phalā iti tadvat
translated: Just as the service of Pūrṇavarman has only the fruit of food and clothing, while the service of Rājavarman has fruits equal to kingship, so is it here.

analyzed: praṇavaḥ ca tat satyam param brahma tad pratīka tvāt
translated: And the Praṇava is that truth, the supreme Brahman, because it is its symbol.

original: etaddhyevākṣaraṃ brahma etaddhyevākṣaraṃ param ityādyāmnāyātkāṭhake yuktaṃ tatsevāto 'mṛtatvam /
analyzed: etat hi eva akṣaram brahma etat hi eva akṣaram param iti ādi āmnāyāt kāṭhake yuktam tad sevātaḥ mṛta tvam
translated: Because of such Vedic statements as This syllable is Brahman, This syllable is supreme, it is proper in the Kāṭhaka that immortality comes from its service.

analyzed: caturṇām adhikṛta tva aviśeṣāt  brahma saṃstha tve pratiṣedhāt ca
translated: Because there is no difference in the qualification of the four.🔽And because there is no prohibition in the state of resting in Brahman.

analyzed: sva karma chidre ca brahma saṃstha tāyām sāmardhya upapatteḥ
translated: And because capability is possible in the state of resting in Brahman when one's own duties are unobstructed.

analyzed: na ca yava varāha ādi śabda vat brahma saṃstha śabdaḥ parivrājake rūḍhaḥ
translated: And the word 'brahmasaṁstha' is not established in the sense of a wandering ascetic, like the words 'yava' and 'varāha'.

analyzed: brahmaṇi saṃsthiti nimittam upādāya pravṛtta tvāt
translated: Because it is used with reference to the cause of abiding in Brahman.

analyzed: na hi rūḍhi śabdāḥ nimittam upādadate
translated: For words that are established do not take a cause.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca brahmaṇi sthitiḥ upapadyate
translated: And abiding in Brahman is possible for all.

original: yatra yatra nimittamasti brahmaṇi saṃsthitistasya tasya nimittavato vācakaṃ santaṃ brahmasaṃsthaśabdaṃ parivrāḍekaviṣaye saṃkoca kāraṇābhāvānniroddhuma🔽yuktam /
analyzed: yatra yatra nimittam asti brahmaṇi saṃsthitiḥ tasya tasya nimittavataḥ vācakam santam brahmasaṃstha śabdam parivrāj eka viṣaye saṃkoca kāraṇa abhāvāt niroddhum  yuktam
translated: And it is not proper to restrict the word 'brahmasaṁstha', which is applicable to one who has the cause of abiding in Brahman, to the wandering ascetic alone, in the absence of any reason for restriction.

analyzed: na ca pārivrājya āśrama dharma mātreṇa amṛta tvam
translated: And immortality is not attained merely by the duty of the stage of wandering asceticism.

analyzed: jñāna ānarthakya prasaṅgāt
translated: Because that would lead to the absurdity of knowledge being useless.

analyzed: pārivrājya dharma yuktam eva jñānam amṛta tva sādhanam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that knowledge combined with the duty of wandering asceticism is the means of attaining immortality, that is not so.

analyzed: āśrama dharma tva aviśeṣāt
translated: Because there is no difference in the duties of the stages of life.

analyzed: dharmaḥ vā jñāna viśiṣṭaḥ mṛta tva sādhanam iti etat api sarva āśrama dharmāṇām aviśiṣṭam
translated: Or, it may be that the duty qualified by knowledge is the means of attaining immortality. This also is not different for the duties of all the stages of life.

original: na ca vacanamasti parivrājakasyaiva brahmasaṃsthasya mokṣo nānyeṣāmiti /
analyzed: na ca vacanam asti parivrājakasya eva brahma saṃsthasya mokṣaḥ na anyeṣām iti
translated: And there is no statement that liberation is for the wandering ascetic alone who is abiding in Brahman, not for others.

original: jñānānmokṣa iti ca sarvopaniṣadāṃ siddhāntaḥ tasmādya eva brahmasaṃsthaḥ svāśramavihitakarmavatāṃ so 'mṛtatvametīti /
analyzed: jñānāt mokṣaḥ iti ca sarva upaniṣadām siddhāntaḥ tasmāt yaḥ eva brahma saṃsthaḥ sva āśrama vihita karmavatām saḥ mṛta tvam eti iti
translated: And the conclusion of all the Upanishads is that liberation is through knowledge. Therefore, he alone who is established in Brahman attains immortality among those who perform the duties prescribed for their own stage of life.

analyzed: kuru idam mā kārṣīḥ iti karma vidhayaḥ pravṛttāḥ
translated: The injunctions to perform actions such as Do this, do not do that are engaged.

analyzed: tat ca nimittam na śāsra kṛtam
translated: And that cause is not created by the scriptures,

analyzed: sarva prāṇiṣu darśanāt
translated: because it is seen in all living beings.🔽The idea produced by the scriptures,

analyzed: sat ekam eva advitīyam ātmā eva idam sarvam brahmā eva idam sarvam iti śāsra janyaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: that existence is one without a second, the self is all this, Brahman is all this,

original: vidyārūpaḥ svābhāvikaṃ kriyākārakaphalabhedapratyayaṃ karmavidhinimittamanupamṛdya na jāyate /
analyzed: vidyā rūpaḥ svābhāvikam kriyā kāraka phala bheda pratyayam karma vidhi nimittam an upamṛdya na jāyate
translated: does not arise without destroying the natural idea of the difference between action, agent, and result, which is the basis for the injunctions to perform actions.

analyzed: bheda abheda pratyayayoḥ virodhāt
translated: Because the ideas of difference and non-difference are contradictory.

analyzed: na hi taimirika dvi candra ādi bheda pratyayam an upamṛdya timira apagame candra ādi eka tva pratyayaḥ upajāyate
translated: For when the cataract is removed, the idea of the oneness of the moon, etc. does not arise without destroying the idea of the difference of the two moons, etc. seen by the person with the cataract.

analyzed: vidyā avidyā pratyayayoḥ virodhāt
translated: Because the ideas of knowledge and ignorance are contradictory.

original: tatraivaṃ sati yaṃ bhedapratyayamupādāya karmavidhayaḥ pravṛtāḥ sa yasyopamarditaḥ
analyzed: tatra evam sati yam bheda pratyayam upādāya karma vidhayaḥ pravṛtāḥ sa yasya upamarditaḥ
translated: In that case, the idea of difference on the basis of which the injunctions to perform actions operate is destroyed by that.

analyzed: sat ekam eva advitīyam tat satyam vikāra bhedaḥ iti etad vākya pramāṇa janitena ekatva pratyayena
translated: That is the truth, the modifications and distinctions are false. By the cognition of oneness produced by the authoritative statement of this,

analyzed: sa sarva karmabhyaḥ nivṛttaḥ nimitta nivṛtte
translated: he turns away from all actions, when the cause has ceased.

analyzed: sa ca nivṛtta karmā brahma saṃsthaḥ ucyate
translated: And he who has turned away from actions is said to be resting in Brahman.

analyzed: sa ca parivrāj eva anyasya asambhavāt
translated: And he is a wandering mendicant, because it is impossible for anyone else.

original: anyo hyanivṛttabhedapratyayaḥ so 'nyatpaśyañśṛṇvanmanvāno vijānannidaṃ kṛtvedaṃ prāpnuyāmiti hi manyate /
analyzed: anyaḥ hi anivṛtta bheda pratyayaḥ saḥ nyat paśyan śṛṇvan manvānaḥ vijānan idam kṛtvā idam prāpnuyām iti hi manyate
translated: For another, whose cognition of distinction has not ceased, thinking By doing this, I shall attain that, thinks I shall see, hear, reflect, and know this.

analyzed: tasya evam kurvataḥ na brahma saṃstha tā
translated: For him, acting thus, there is no resting in Brahman.

analyzed: vācā ārambhaṇa mātra vikāra anṛta abhisandhi pratyaya tvāt
translated: Because his cognition is based on the untruth of modifications which are mere verbal expressions.

original: na cāsatyamityupardite bhedapratyaye satyamidamanena kartavyaṃ mayeti pramāṇaprameyabuddhirupapadyate /
analyzed: na ca asatyam iti upardite bheda pratyaye satyam idam anena kartavyam mayā iti pramāṇa prameya buddhiḥ upapadyate
translated: And when the cognition of distinction, which is false, is suppressed, the cognition of the means of knowledge and the objects of knowledge, This should be done by this, by me, is not possible.

analyzed: ākāśaḥ iva tala mala buddhiḥ vivekinaḥ
translated: For the wise, like the cognition of dirt on the sky.

original: upamardite 'pi bhedapratyaye karmabhyo na nivartate cetprāgiva bhedapratyayopamardanādekatvapratyayavidhāyakaṃ vākyamapramāṇīkṛtaṃ syāt /
analyzed: upamardite pi bheda pratyaye karmabhyaḥ na nivartate ced prāk iva bheda pratyaya upamardanāt ekatva pratyaya vidhāyakam vākyam apramāṇīkṛtam syāt
translated: Even if the cognition of distinction is suppressed, if one does not turn away from actions, then, as before the suppression of the cognition of distinction, the statement enjoining the cognition of oneness would be discredited.

analyzed: abhakṣya bhakṣaṇa ādi pratiṣedha vākyānām prāmāṇya vat yuktam ekatva vākyasya api prāmāṇyam
translated: Just as the sentences prohibiting the eating of forbidden food etc. are authoritative, so is the sentence about oneness authoritative.

analyzed: sarva upaniṣadām tad para tvāt
translated: Because all the Upaniṣads are devoted to that.

analyzed: karma vidhīnām aprāmāṇaḥ aya prasaṅgaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that it would lead to the non-authoritativeness of the injunctions of rituals, it is not so.

analyzed: an upamardita bheda pratyayavat puruṣa viṣaye prāmāṇya upapatteḥ svapna ādi pratyayaḥ iva prāk prabodhāt
translated: Because authoritativeness is possible in the case of a person whose difference is not annulled, like the cognition in a dream etc. before awakening.

analyzed: vivekinām akaraṇāt karma vidhi prāmāṇya ucchedaḥ iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that the authoritativeness of the injunctions of rituals is destroyed because they are not performed by the discerning, it is not so.

analyzed: kāmya vidhi anuccheda darśanāt
translated: Because the non-destruction of the injunctions of optional rituals is seen.

original: na hi kāmātmatā na praśastetyevaṃvijñānavadbhiḥ kāmyāni karmāṇi nānuṣṭhīyanta iti kāmyakarmavidhaya ucchidyante 'nuṣṭhīyanta eva kāmibhiriti
analyzed: na hi kāma ātma tā na praśastā iti evaṃvijñānavadbhiḥ kāmyāni karmāṇi na anuṣṭhīyante iti kāmya karma vidhayaḥ ucchidyante nuṣṭhīyante eva kāmibhiḥ iti
translated: For those who know that being devoted to desires is not praiseworthy, do not perform optional rituals, so the injunctions of optional rituals are not destroyed. They are performed only by those who desire.

original: tathā brahmasaṃsthairbrahmavidbhirnānuṣṭhīyante karmāṇīti na tadvidhaya ucchidyante 'brahmavidbhiranuṣṭhīyanta eveti /
analyzed: tathā brahma saṃsthaiḥ brahma vidbhiḥ na anuṣṭhīyante karmāṇi iti na tad vidhayaḥ ucchidyante brahma vidbhiḥ anuṣṭhīyante eva iti
translated: Similarly, the injunctions are not destroyed because rituals are not performed by those who abide in Brahman and know Brahman. They are performed only by those who do not know Brahman.

analyzed: parivrādakānām bhikṣā caraṇa ādi vat utpanna eka tva pratyayānām api gṛhastha ādīnām agnihotra ādi karma anivṛttiḥ iti ced na
translated: If it be said that, even for householders, etc., who have once had the notion of unity produced in them, by the practice of begging, etc., the performance of the agnihotra, etc., does not cease; we reply: No.

analyzed: prāmāṇya cintāyām puruṣa pravṛtteḥ adṛṣṭānta tvāt
translated: For in the discussion of the validity of the Veda, the activity of man is not a parallel case.

original: na hi nābhicarediti pratiṣiddhamapyabhicaramaṃ kaścitkurvandṛṣṭa iti śatrau dveṣarahitenāpi vivekinābhicaraṇaṃ kriyate /
analyzed: na hi na abhicaret iti pratiṣiddham api abhicaramam kaścid kurvan dṛṣṭaḥ iti śatrau dveṣa rahitena api vivekinā abhicaraṇam kriyate
translated: For no one is seen to perform the abhicāra rite, though it is forbidden, “Let no man perform the abhicāra rite.” Therefore the abhicāra rite is performed by a discriminating man, even though he be free from hatred towards his enemy.

original: na ca karmavidhipravṛttinimitte bhedapratyaye bādhite 'gnihotrādau pravartakaṃ nimittamasti /
analyzed: na ca karma vidhi pravṛtti nimitte bheda pratyaye bādhite gnihotra ādau pravartakam nimittam asti
translated: And when the notion of difference, which is the motive for the performance of the agnihotra, etc., is set aside, there is no motive to impel to the performance of the agnihotra, etc.

analyzed: parivrājakasya iva bhikṣā caraṇa ādau bubhukṣā ādi pravartakam
translated: As in the case of the wandering ascetic, hunger, etc., are the motive for the performance of begging, etc.

analyzed: iha api akaraṇe pratyavāya bhayam pravartakam iti ced na
translated: If it be said that here also the fear of the evil consequences of non-performance is the motive, we reply: No.

analyzed: bheda pratyayavataḥ dhi kṛta tvāt
translated: Because he who has the notion of difference is entitled to the performance.

analyzed: bheda pratyayavān anupamardita bheda buddhiḥ vidyayā yaḥ sa karmaṇi adhikṛtaḥ iti avocāma
translated: We have said that he who has the notion of difference, whose notion of difference is not set aside, is entitled to the performance of the agnihotra, etc., by the knowledge.

original: yo hyadhikṛtaḥ karmaṇi tasya tadakarame pratyavāyo na nivṛttādhikārasya gṛhasthasyeva brahmacāriṇo viśeṣadharmānanuṣṭhāne /
analyzed: yaḥ hi adhikṛtaḥ karmaṇi tasya tad akarame pratyavāyaḥ na nivṛtta adhikārasya gṛhasthasya iva brahmacāriṇaḥ viśeṣa dharma ananuṣṭhāne
translated: For one who is entitled to action, there is a transgression in not performing that action, not for one who has ceased to be entitled, like a householder who is no longer a student in not performing the special duties.

original: evaṃ tarhi sarvaḥ svāśramastha utpannekatvapratyayaḥ parivrāḍiti cet / na /
analyzed: evam tarhi sarvaḥ sva āśrama sthaḥ utpanna ekatva pratyayaḥ parivrāj iti ced na
translated: If it is argued that in that case everyone in their own stage of life, upon attaining the notion of oneness, becomes a wandering renunciant, it is not so.

analyzed: sva svāmi tva bheda buddhi anivṛtteḥ
translated: Because the notion of difference between self and owner has not ceased.

analyzed: karma artha tvāt ca itara āśramāṇām
translated: And because the other stages of life are for the sake of action.

analyzed: atha karma kurvīya iti śruteḥ
translated: And because of the Vedic text So that I may perform action.

analyzed: tasmāt sva svāmi tva abhāvāt bhikṣuḥ ekaḥ eva parivrāj
translated: Therefore, because there is no self and owner, only the mendicant is a wandering renunciant.

original: na gṛhasthādiḥ /🔽ekatvapratyayavidhijanitena pratyayena vidhinimittabhedapratyayasyopamarditatvādyamaniyamādyanupapattiḥ parivrājakasyeti cet / na /
analyzed: na gṛhastha ādiḥ  eka tva pratyaya vidhi janitena pratyayena vidhi nimitta bheda pratyayasya upamardita tvāt yama niyama ādi anupapattiḥ parivrājakasya iti ced na
translated: Not the householder and others.🔽If it is argued that for the wandering renunciant, the performance of self-restraint and other duties is not possible, because the notion of difference that is the basis for injunctions is suppressed by the notion produced by the injunction of the notion of oneness, it is not so.

analyzed: bubhukṣā ādinā eka tva pratyayāt prā cyāvitasya upapatteḥ nivṛtti artha tvāt
translated: Because it is possible for one whose notion of difference has been removed by the notion of oneness, which is for the purpose of cessation.

analyzed: na ca pratiṣiddha sevā aprāptiḥ
translated: And there is no possibility of serving the prohibited.

analyzed: eka tva pratyaya utpatteḥ prāk eva pratiṣiddha tvāt
translated: Because it is prohibited even before the notion of oneness arises.

original: na hi rātrau kūpe kaṇṭake vā patita udite 'pi savitari patati tasminneva /
analyzed: na hi rātrau kūpe kaṇṭake vā patite udite savitari patati tasmin eva
translated: For one who falls into a well or a thorn bush at night does not fall again even when the sun rises.

original: tasmātsiddhaṃ nivṛttakarmā bhikṣuka eva brahmasaṃstha iti /
analyzed: tasmāt siddham nivṛtta karmā bhikṣukaḥ eva brahma saṃsthaḥ iti
translated: Therefore it is established that only the mendicant who has ceased ritual action is one who has attained Brahman.

analyzed: yat punar uktam sarveṣām jñāna varjitānām puṇya loka tā iti
translated: As for what was said that all those devoid of knowledge go to the world of the meritorious,

analyzed: satyam etat
translated: that is true.

analyzed: yat ca uktam tapaḥ śabdena parivrāj api uktaḥ iti
translated: And what was said that the wandering ascetic is also referred to by the word austerity,

analyzed: etat asat
translated: that is not so.

analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why?

analyzed: parivrājakasya eva brahma saṃstha tā asambhavāt
translated: Because only the wandering ascetic can attain Brahman.

analyzed: saḥ eva hi avaśeṣitaḥ iti avocāma
translated: We have already said that he alone is the remainder.

analyzed: ekatva vijñānavataḥ gnihotra ādi vat tapaḥ nivṛtteḥ ca
translated: And because of the cessation of austerity for one who knows the identity with Brahman, like the Agnihotra and other [rituals].

analyzed: bheda buddhimataḥ eva hi tapaḥ kartavya tā syāt
translated: For austerity is to be performed only by one who has the notion of difference.

analyzed: etena karma chidre brahma saṃstha tā sāmarthyam apratiṣedhaḥ ca pratyuktaḥ
translated: By this [argument], the ability of one who has attained Brahman to close the gap in ritual action and the non-prohibition [of ritual action for one who has attained Brahman] are answered.

original: tathā jñānavāneva nivṛttakarmā parivrāḍiti jñānavaiyarthyaṃ pratyuktam /
analyzed: tathā jñānavān eva nivṛtta karmā parivrāj iti jñāna vaiyarthyam pratyuktam
translated: Similarly, the uselessness of knowledge is answered by the fact that only one who has knowledge and has ceased ritual action is a wandering ascetic.

original: yatpunaruktaṃ yavavarāhādiśabdavatparivrājake na rūḍho brahmasaṃsthaśabda iti tatparihṛtam /
analyzed: yat punar uktam yava varāha ādi śabda vat parivrājake na rūḍhaḥ brahma saṃstha śabdaḥ iti tat parihṛtam
translated: As for what was said that the word one who has attained Brahman is not established in the wandering ascetic like the words barley, pig, etc., that has been refuted.

analyzed: tasya eva brahma saṃstha tā sambhavāt na anyasya iti
translated: Because only he can be said to be resting in Brahman, not anyone else.

analyzed: yat punar uktam rūḍha śabdāḥ nimittam na upādadate iti
translated: As for the statement that words in common usage do not take into account the reason [for the usage],

analyzed: tat na
translated: that is not so.

analyzed: gṛhastha takṣa parivrājaka ādi śabda darśanāt
translated: Because we see words like householder, carpenter, wandering ascetic, etc.

original: gṛhasthitipārivrājyatakṣaṇādinimittopādānā api gṛhasthaparivrājakāśramiviśeṣe viśiṣṭajātimati ca takṣeti rūḍhā dṛśyante śabdāḥ /
analyzed: gṛha sthiti pārivrājya takṣaṇa ādi nimitta upādānāḥ api gṛhastha parivrājaka āśrami viśeṣe viśiṣṭa jātimati ca takṣā iti rūḍhāḥ dṛśyante śabdāḥ
translated: Words are seen to be in common usage for a particular stage of life, such as the householder or the wandering ascetic, and for a particular caste, such as the carpenter, even though they take into account the reasons for being a householder, a wandering ascetic, or a carpenter.

original: na yatra yatra tāni nimittāni tatra tatra vartante /
analyzed: na yatra yatra tāni nimittāni tatra tatra vartante
translated: They do not occur wherever those reasons are present.

analyzed: prasiddhi abhāvāt
translated: Because of lack of recognition.

original: tathehāpi brahmasaṃsthaśabdo nivṛttasarvakarmatatsādhanaparivrāḍekaviṣaye 'tyāśramiṇi paramahaṃsākhye vṛtta iha bhavitumarhati /
analyzed: tathā iha api brahma saṃstha śabdaḥ nivṛtta sarva karma tad sādhana parivrāj eka viṣaye tya āśramiṇi paramahaṃsa ākhye vṛtte iha bhavitum arhati
translated: In the same way, here too, the word resting in Brahman should be used for one who has renounced all actions and their means, who is a wandering ascetic, who is in the highest stage of life called the paramahamsa.

analyzed: mukhya amṛta tva phala śravaṇāt
translated: Because the fruit of immortality is heard to be primary.

analyzed: atas ca idam eva ekam veda uktam pārivrājyam
translated: And for this reason, this alone is the wandering asceticism taught in the Vedas.

analyzed: na yajñopavīta tridaṇḍa kamaṇḍalu ādi parigrahe iti
translated: Not the acceptance of the sacred thread, the triple staff, the water pot, etc.

original: muṇḍo 'parigraho 'saṅgaiti śrutiḥatyākṣamibyaḥ paramaṃ pavitram ityādi ca śvetāśvatarīye /
analyzed: muṇḍaḥ parigrahaḥ saṅga iti śrutiḥ atyākṣamibyaḥ paramam pavitram ityādi ca śvetāśvatarīye
translated: The scripture says shaven-headed, without possessions, unattached, and so on in the Śvetāśvatara Upaniṣad.

analyzed: niḥstutiḥ nirnamaskāra etyādi smṛtibhyaḥ ca
translated: And also from the Smṛti texts beginning with, 'Without praise, without salutations.'

analyzed: tasmāt karma na kurvanti yatayaḥ pāra darśinaḥ
translated: Therefore, the ascetics who see the other side do not perform actions.

analyzed: tasmāt aliṅgaḥ dharma jñaḥ vyakta liṅga etyādi smṛtibhyaḥ ca
translated: And also from the Smṛti texts beginning with, 'The one without the outward signs, knowing Dharma, with the unmanifest sign.'

analyzed: yat tu sāṃkhyaiḥ karma tyāgaḥ abhyupagamyate
translated: As for the renunciation of action accepted by the Sāṅkhyas,

analyzed: kriyā kāraka phala bheda buddheḥ satya tva abhyupagamāt tat mṛṣā
translated: that is false, because they accept the reality of the distinction between action, agent, and result.

analyzed: yat ca bauddhaiḥ śūnyatā abhyupagamāt akartṛ tvam abhyupagamyate
translated: And as for the acceptance of non-agency by the Buddhists due to their acceptance of emptiness,

analyzed: tat api asat
translated: that is also false.

analyzed: tad abhyupagantuḥ sattva abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the one who accepts that accepts existence.

analyzed: yat ca ajñaiḥ alasa tayā akartṛ tva abhyupagamaḥ saḥ u pi asan
translated: And the acceptance of non-agency by the ignorant out of laziness is also false.

analyzed: kāraka buddheḥ a nivarta tatvāt pramāṇena
translated: Because the cognition of the agent is not reversed by valid means of knowledge.

original: tasmādvedāntapramāṇajanitaikatvapratyayavata eva karmanivṛttilakṣaṇaṃ pārivrājyaṃ brahmasaṃsthatvaṃ ceti siddham /
analyzed: tasmāt vedānta pramāṇa janita ekatva pratyayavataḥ eva karma nivṛtti lakṣaṇam pārivrājyam brahma saṃstha tvam ca iti siddham
translated: Therefore, it is established that only one who has the notion of non-duality produced by the valid means of knowledge of the Vedānta is entitled to the state of a wandering ascetic characterized by the cessation of action and to the state of resting in Brahman.

analyzed: etena gṛhasthasya eka tva vijñāne sati pārivrājyam artha siddham
translated: By this, it is established that for a householder who knows non-duality, wandering asceticism is implied.

analyzed: nanu agni utsādana doṣa bhāj syāt parivrajan
translated: If he wanders, will he not incur the fault of destroying the sacred fires?

original: vīrahā vā eṣa devānāṃ yo 'gnimudvāsayateiti śruteḥ / na /
analyzed: vīra hā vai eṣa devānām yaḥ gnim udvāsayate iti śruteḥ na
translated: For it is heard: He who removes the fire is indeed the slayer of the heroes of the gods. No.

original: vedenaivotsāditatvāt utsanna eva hi sa ekatvadarśane jāte /
analyzed: vedena eva utsādita tvāt utsanne eva hi saḥ eka tva darśane jāte
translated: because it has already been destroyed by the Veda. For it is indeed destroyed when the vision of unity arises.

analyzed: apāgāt agneḥ agni tvam iti śruteḥ
translated: For it is heard: The fireness of fire has departed.

analyzed: atas na doṣa bhāj gṛhasthaḥ parivrajan iti
translated: Therefore, the householder does not incur sin by becoming a wandering ascetic.

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ lokān abhyatapat
translated: Prajapati heated the worlds.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ bhitaptebhyaḥ trayī vidyā saṃprāsravat
translated: From them, when heated, the three Vedas flowed out.

analyzed: tām abhyatapat
translated: He heated that.

original: tasyā abhitaptāyā etāny akṣarāṇi saṃprasrvanta bhūr bhuvaḥ svar iti //
analyzed: tasyāḥ abhitaptāyāḥ etāni akṣarāṇi saṃprasrvanta bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar iti
translated: From that, when heated, these syllables flowed out: bhūr bhuvaḥ svar.

original: yatsaṃstho 'mṛtatvameti tannirūpaṇārthamāha prajāpatirvirāṭ kaśyapo vā lokānuddiśya teṣu sārajighṛkṣayābhyata padabhitāpaṃ kṛtavāndhyānaṃ
analyzed: yad saṃsthaḥ mṛta tvam eti tad nirūpaṇa artham āha prajāpatiḥ virāj kaśyapaḥ vā lokān uddiśya teṣu sāra jighṛkṣayā abhyata pad abhitāpam kṛtavān dhyānam
translated: The purpose of this is to determine what state one attains immortality in. He says: Prajapati, the Virata, or Kashyapa, with reference to the worlds, desiring to extract the essence from them, heated them, performed meditation.

analyzed: tapaḥ kṛtavān iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: he performed austerity.

original: tebhyo 'bhitaptebhyaḥ sārabhūtā trayī vidyā samprāsravatprajāpatermanasi pratyabhādityarthaḥ /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ bhitaptebhyaḥ sāra bhūtā trayī vidyā samprāsravat prajāpateḥ manasi pratyabhāt iti arthaḥ
translated: From them, when heated, the three Vedas, which are the essence, flowed out. The meaning is: they appeared in Prajapati's mind.

analyzed: tām abhyatapat
translated: He heated that.

analyzed: pūrvavat
translated: As before.

original: tasyā abhitaptāyā etānyakṣarāṇi samprāsravanta bhūrbhuvaḥ svaritivyāhṛtayaḥ //
analyzed: tasyāḥ abhitaptāyāḥ etāni akṣarāṇi samprāsravanta bhūḥ bhuvaḥ svar iti vyāhṛtayaḥ
translated: From that heated (element) these syllables flowed out, the Vyāhṛtis Bhūḥ, Bhuvaḥ, Svaḥ.

analyzed: tāni abhyatapat
translated: He heated them.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ bhitaptebhyaḥ oṃkāraḥ saṃprāsravat
translated: From them, when heated, the syllable Om flowed out.

original: tad yathā śaṅkunā sarvāṇi parṇāni saṃtṛṇṇāny evam oṃkāreṇa sarvā vāk saṃtṛṇṇā /
analyzed: tat yathā śaṅkunā sarvāṇi parṇāni saṃtṛṇṇāni evam oṃkāreṇa sarvā vāc saṃtṛṇṇā
translated: Just as all leaves are pierced by a peg, so is all speech pierced by the syllable Om.

analyzed: akāraḥ vai sarvā vāc iti ādi śruteḥ
translated: Because of the Vedic text beginning The letter A is indeed all speech, etc.

analyzed: paramātma vikāraḥ ca nāmadheya mātram iti atas oṅkāraḥ eva idam sarvam iti

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi dvitīya adhyāyasya trayoviṃśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ

analyzed: rudrāṇām mādhyaṃdinam savanam

translated: and having exalted it, the teacher, wishing to teach the Sāman, Homa, and Mantra-recitation, which are the limbs of the very same sacrifice that is the subject matter, says: The expounders of Brahman say:

original: kathaṃ madhutvamityāhatasya madhuno dyaureva bhrāmarasyeva madhunastiraścīnaścāsau vaṃśaśceti tiraścīnavaṃśaḥ /
analyzed: katham madhu tvam iti āhatasya madhunaḥ dyauḥ eva bhrāmarasya iva madhunaḥ tiraścīnaḥ ca asau vaṃśaḥ ca iti tiraścīna vaṃśaḥ
translated: How is it honey? It is said: The sky itself is the honeycomb of that honey, just as the sky is the honeycomb of the honey of bees. And that sun is a slanting beam, hence it is a slanting beam.

analyzed: tiryak gatā iva hi dyauḥ lakṣyate
translated: For the sky is indeed seen as if slanting.

original: antarikṣaṃ ca madhvapūpo dyuvaṃśe lagnaḥ sallaṃmbata ivāto madhvapūpasāmānyādantarikṣaṃ madhvapūpo madhunaḥ saviturāśrayatvācca /
analyzed: antarikṣam ca madhu apūpaḥ dyu vaṃśe lagnaḥ san laṃmbate iva atas madhu apūpa sāmānyāt antarikṣam madhu apūpaḥ madhunaḥ savituḥ āśraya tvāt ca
translated: And the atmosphere is the honey-cake, attached to the sky-beam, as if hanging on it. Therefore, because of the similarity to the honey-cake, the atmosphere is the honey-cake. And because it is the support of the honey, the sun.

original: marīcayo raśmayo raśmisthā āpo bhaumāḥ savitrākṛṣṭāḥetā vā āpaḥ svarājo yanmarīcayaiti iti hi vijñāyate /
analyzed: marīcayaḥ raśmayaḥ raśmi sthāḥ āpaḥ bhaumāḥ savitrā ākṛṣṭāḥ etāḥ vai āpaḥ sva rājaḥ yat marīcayā eti iti hi vijñāyate
translated: The rays are the sun's rays. The waters in the rays are the earthly waters drawn by the sun. These waters are the self-ruling ones, for the rays are said to be so.

original: tā antarikṣamadhvapūpastharaśmyantargatatvādbhramarabījabhūtāḥ putrā iva hitā lakṣyanta iti putrā iva putrā madhvapūpanāḍyantargatā hi bhramaraputrāḥ
analyzed: tāḥ antarikṣa madhu apūpa stha raśmi antargata tvāt bhramara bīja bhūtāḥ putrāḥ iva hitāḥ lakṣyante iti putrāḥ iva putrāḥ madhu apūpa nāḍī antargatāḥ hi bhramara putrāḥ
translated: Those waters, being in the sky, in the rays of the sun, appear as beneficial like sons, like bees in the cells of honey.

original: tasya ye prāñco raśmayas tā evāsya prācyo madhunāḍyaḥ /🔽ṛca eva madhukṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ye prāñcaḥ raśmayaḥ tāḥ eva asya prācyaḥ madhunāḍyaḥ  ṛcaḥ eva madhukṛtaḥ
translated: His rays that go to the east are his eastern honey-cells.🔽The Ṛc verses are the honey-makers.

analyzed: ṛgvedaḥ eva puṣpam
translated: The Ṛg Veda itself is the flower.

analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ
translated: Those are the immortal waters.

analyzed: tāḥ vai etāḥ ṛcaḥ
translated: And those are the Ṛc verses.

original: tasya saviturmadhvāśrayasya madhuno ye prāñcaḥ prācyāṃ diśi gatā raśmayastā evāsya prācyaḥ prāgañcanānmadhuno nāḍyo madhunāḍya
analyzed: tasya savituḥ madhu āśrayasya madhunaḥ ye prāñcaḥ prācyām diśi gatāḥ raśmayaḥ tāḥ eva asya prācyaḥ prāc añcanāt madhunaḥ nāḍyaḥ madhunāḍya
translated: The rays of that Savita, the support of honey, that go to the east, to the eastern direction, are his eastern honey-cells, going to the east, like the cells of honey.

analyzed: iva madhu ādhāra chidrāṇi iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is: they are like the holes for holding honey.

original: tatra ṛca eva madhukṛto lohitarūpaṃ savitrāśrayaṃ madhu kurvantīti madhukṛto bhramarā iva yato rasānādāya madhu kurvanti /
analyzed: tatra ṛcaḥ eva madhukṛtaḥ lohita rūpam savitṛ āśrayam madhu kurvanti iti madhukṛtaḥ bhramarāḥ iva yatas rasān ādāya madhu kurvanti
translated: There, the Ṛc verses are the honey-makers, producing the honey that is supported by Savita and has the form of blood. They are like bees, because they collect juices and make honey.

analyzed: tat puṣpam iva puṣpam ṛgvedaḥ eva
translated: That is like a flower, the flower is the Ṛg Veda itself.

analyzed: tatra ṛk brāhmaṇa samudāyasya ṛgveda ākhya tvāt śabda mātrāt ca bhogya rūpa rasa nisrāva asambhavāt ṛgveda śabdena atra ṛgveda vihitam karma
translated: There, since the collection of Ṛk and Brāhmaṇa is called Ṛgveda, and since nectar cannot flow from mere words, the word Ṛgveda here refers to the rites prescribed in the Ṛgveda.

analyzed: tatas hi karma phala bhūta madhu rasa nisrāva sambhavāt
translated: For from that, the rites prescribed in the Ṛgveda, nectar can flow, which is the fruit of those rites.

analyzed: madhukaraiḥ iva puṣpa sthānīyāt ṛgveda vihitāt karmaṇaḥ u pa ādāya ṛgbhiḥ madhu nirvartyate
translated: Just as bees collect nectar from flowers, in the same way, the Ṛk verses collect nectar from the rites prescribed in the Ṛgveda, and nectar is produced.

original: kāstā āpa ityāhatāḥ karmaṇi prayuktāḥ somājyapayorūpā agnau prakṣiptāstatpākābhinirvṛttā amṛtā amṛtārthatvādatyanta rasavatya āpo bhavanti
analyzed: kāḥ tāḥ āpaḥ iti āhatāḥ karmaṇi prayuktāḥ soma ājya payaḥ rūpāḥ agnau prakṣiptāḥ tad pāka abhinirvṛttāḥ amṛtāḥ amṛta artha tvāt atyanta rasavatyaḥ āpaḥ bhavanti
translated: What are those waters? He says: those employed in the rite, in the form of Soma, clarified butter, and milk, thrown into the fire, become nectar, which is extremely sweet, because of being the essence of immortality.

original: tadrasānādāya tā vā etā ṝcaḥ puṣpebhyo rasamādadānā eva bhramarāḥ ṛcaḥ //
analyzed: tat rasān ādāya tāḥ vai etāḥ ṝcaḥ puṣpebhyaḥ rasam ādadānāḥ eva bhramarāḥ ṛcaḥ
translated: Taking that essence, those Ṛk verses, like bees taking nectar from flowers, are the Ṛk verses.

analyzed: etam ṛgvedam abhyatapan
translated: They heated this Ṛgveda.

original: tasyābhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyaṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyam vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata
translated: From that heated, the essence, the food, arose - glory, splendor, power, strength, and nourishment.

original: etamṛgvedamṛgvedavihitaṃ karma puṣpasthānīyamabhyatapannabhitāpaṃ kṛtavatya ivaitā ṛcaḥ karmaṇi prayuktāḥ /
analyzed: etam ṛgvedam ṛgveda vihitam karma puṣpa sthānīyam abhyatapan abhitāpam kṛtavatyaḥ iva etāḥ ṛcaḥ karmaṇi prayuktāḥ
translated: As if they have heated the Ṛgveda, the rites prescribed in the Ṛgveda, which are like flowers, the Ṛk verses employed in the rite.

original: ṝgbhirhi mantraiḥ śasrādyaṅgabhāvamupagataiḥ kriyamāṇaṃ karma madhunirvartakaṃ rasaṃ muñcatītyupapadyate puṣpāṇīva bhramarairācūṣyamāṇāni /
analyzed: ṝgbhiḥ hi mantraiḥ śasra ādi aṅga bhāvam upagataiḥ kriyamāṇam karma madhu nirvartakam rasam muñcati iti upapadyate puṣpāṇi iva bhramaraiḥ ācūṣyamāṇāni
translated: For it is proper that the rite performed with the Ṛk Mantras which have become parts of the Sāma and other limbs should release the essence that produces honey, just as the flowers are sucked by the bees.

analyzed: tat etat āhatasya ṛgvedasya abhitaptasya
translated: This is what is said here: Of that Ṛg Veda, which is pressed by the Ṛk bees.

analyzed: kaḥ sau rasaḥ yaḥ ṛk madhukara abhitāpa niḥsṛtaḥ iti ucyate
translated: What is that essence which is produced by the pressing of the Ṛk bees? It is said:

original: yaśo viśrutatvaṃ tejo dehagatā dīptirindriyaṃ sāmarthyopetairindriyairavaikalyaṃ vīryaṃ sāmarthyaṃ balamityarthaḥ /
analyzed: yaśaḥ viśruta tvam tejaḥ deha gatā dīptiḥ indriyam sāmarthya upetaiḥ indriyaiḥ avaikalyam vīryam sāmarthyam balam iti arthaḥ
translated: Glory is fame, brilliance is the radiance in the body, the sense organs are the faculties endowed with capacity, the absence of deficiency in the sense organs is vigor, which means capacity.

original: annādyamannaṃ ca tadādyaṃ ca yenopayujyamānenāhanyahani devānāṃ sthitiḥ syāttadannādyameṣa raso 'jāyata yāgādilakṣaṇātkarmaṇaḥ //
analyzed: annādyam annam ca tat ādyam ca yena upayujyamānena ahani ahani devānām sthitiḥ syāt tat annādyam eṣa rasaḥ jāyata yāga ādi lakṣaṇāt karmaṇaḥ
translated: Food and that which is preceded by food, by which the gods would remain day after day when used, that food was born from the rite characterized by sacrifice and other acts.

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat
translated: That came forth.

original: tad ādityam abhito 'śrayat /🔽tad vā etad yad etad ādityasya rohitaṃ rūpam //
analyzed: tat ādityam abhitas śrayat  tat vai etat yat etat ādityasya rohitam rūpam
translated: That settled around the sun.🔽That indeed is what is of the nature of that red form of the sun.

analyzed: yaśaḥ ādi annādya paryantam tat vyakṣarat viśeṣeṇa akṣarat agamat
translated: That came forth in particular, in the form of glory beginning with food and ending with food.

original: gatvā ca tadādityamabhitaḥ pārśvataḥ pūrvabhāgaṃ savituraśrayadāśritavadityarthaḥ /🔽amuṣminnāditye sañcitaṃ karmaphalākhyaṃ madhu bhokṣyāmaha ityevaṃ hi yaśaādilakṣaṇaphalaprāptaye karmāṇi kriyante manuṣyaiḥ kedāraniṣpādanamiva
analyzed: gatvā ca tat ādityam abhitas pārśvatas pūrva bhāgam savituḥ aśrayat āśrita vat iti arthaḥ  amuṣmin āditye sañcitam karma phala ākhyam madhu bhokṣyāmahe iti evam hi yaśaḥ ādi lakṣaṇa phala prāptaye karmāṇi kriyante manuṣyaiḥ kedāra niṣpādanam iva
translated: And having gone there, it resorted to the eastern side, the vicinity, of that sun.

analyzed: karṣakaiḥ
translated: In that sun, we will enjoy the honey called the fruits of accumulated actions. Thus, by men, actions are performed for the attainment of fruits characterized by fame etc., just as farmers cultivate fields.

analyzed: tat pratyakṣam pradarśyate śraddhā hetoḥ tat vai etat
translated: That is directly shown for the sake of faith. That is this.

analyzed: kim tat yat etat ādityasya udyataḥ dṛśyate rohitam rūpam
translated: What is that? It is that red form which is seen rising of the sun.

analyzed: iti chāndogya upaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya prathamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the first section of the third chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: atha ye 'sya dakṣiṇā raśmayas tā evāsya dakṣiṇā madhunāḍyaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye sya dakṣiṇāḥ raśmayaḥ tāḥ eva asya dakṣiṇāḥ madhunāḍyaḥ
translated: Now, those southern rays of his are indeed his southern honeycombs.

analyzed: yajūṃṣi eva madhukṛtaḥ
translated: The Yajus formulas are indeed the honeymakers.

analyzed: yajurvedaḥ eva puṣpam
translated: The Yajur Veda itself is the flower.

analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ
translated: Those are the immortal waters.

original: atha ye 'sya dakṣiṇā raśmaya ityādi samānam /
analyzed: atha ye sya dakṣiṇāḥ raśmayaḥ ityādi samānam
translated: Now, those southern rays of his, etc. are the same as before.

analyzed: yajūṃyā iva madhukṛtaḥ yajurveda vihite karmaṇi prayuktāni
translated: The Yajus formulas are indeed the honeymakers, employed in the rites prescribed in the Yajur Veda.

analyzed: pūrvavat madhukṛtaḥ iva
translated: Like honeymakers as before.

analyzed: yajurveda vihitam karma puṣpa sthānīyam puṣpam iti ucyate
translated: The ritual enjoined by the Yajur Veda is said to be like a flower, hence it is called a flower.

analyzed: tāḥ eva soma ādyāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ
translated: Those same Soma and other nectars are indeed waters.

original: tāni vā etāni yajūṃṣy etaṃ yajurvedam abhyatapan /
analyzed: tāni vai etāni yajūṃṣi etam yajurvedam abhyatapan
translated: Those very Yajuṣ mantras heated this Yajur Veda.

original: tasya abhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyaṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyam vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata
translated: From that heated [Veda], splendor, brilliance, power, strength, and food, the essence, was born.

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat
translated: That [essence] flowed out.

analyzed: tat ādityam abhitas śrayat
translated: It settled around the sun.

original: tad vā etad yad etad ādityasya śuklaṃ rūpam //
analyzed: tat vai etat yat etat ādityasya śuklam rūpam
translated: That is indeed what is seen as the white form of the sun.

original: tāni vā etāni yajūṃṣyetaṃ yajurvedamabhyatapannityevamādi sarvaṃ samānam /
analyzed: tāni vai etāni yajūṃṣi etam yajurvedam abhyatapan iti evamādi sarvam samānam
translated: The same is said for the other Vedas: Those very Sāman chants heated this Sāma Veda... and so on.

analyzed: madhu etat ādityasya dṛśyate śuklam rūpam
translated: This is indeed the honey seen as the white form of the sun.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya dvitīyaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the second section of the third chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: atha ye 'sya pratyañco raśmāyas tā evāsya pratīcyo madhunāḍyaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye sya pratyañcaḥ raśmāyaḥ tāḥ eva asya pratīcyaḥ madhunāḍyaḥ
translated: Now, those rays of his that go to the west are indeed his western honeycombs.

analyzed: sāmāni eva madhukṛtaḥ
translated: The Sāmans are indeed the honey-makers.

analyzed: sāmavedaḥ eva puṣpam
translated: The Sāma Veda itself is the flower.

analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ
translated: Those are indeed the immortal waters.

original: tāni vā etāni sāmāny etaṃ sāmavedam abhyatapan /
analyzed: tāni vai etāni sāmāni etam sāmavedam abhyatapan
translated: Those very Sāmans heated this Sāma Veda...

original: tasyābhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyaṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyam vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata
translated: From that heated (sun) was born the essence, the splendour, the power, the energy, the food, the sap of that (world).

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat
translated: That (sap) flowed out.

analyzed: tat ādityam abhitas śrayat
translated: It settled around the sun.

original: tad vā etad yad etad ādityasya kṛṣṇaṃ rūpam //
analyzed: tat vai etat yat etat ādityasya kṛṣṇam rūpam
translated: That is what is the dark form of that sun.

original: atha ye 'sya pratyaśco raśmaya ityādi samānam /
analyzed: atha ye sya pratyaścaḥ raśmayaḥ ityādi samānam
translated: Then those rays of his which rise upwards, etc. is the same as before.

analyzed: tathā sāmnām madhu
translated: Similarly, the honey of the Sāmans.

analyzed: etat ādityasya kṛṣṇam rūpam
translated: This is the dark form of the sun.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya tṛtīyaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Third Section of the Third Chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: atha ye 'syodañco raśmayas tā evāsyodīcyo madhunāḍyaḥ /
analyzed: atha ye sya udañcaḥ raśmayaḥ tāḥ eva asya udīcyaḥ madhunāḍyaḥ
translated: Now those rays of his which rise upwards are his northern honey-tubes.

analyzed: atharva aṅgirasaḥ eva madhukṛtaḥ
translated: The Atharva-Aṅgiras are the honey-makers.

analyzed: itihāsa purāṇam puṣpam
translated: The Itihāsa-Purāṇa is the flower.

original: tā amṛtā āpaḥ //🔽te vā ete 'tharvāṅgirasa etad itihāsapūrāṇam abhyatapan /
analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ  te vai ete tharva aṅgirasaḥ etat itihāsa pūrāṇam abhyatapan
translated: Those are the immortal waters.🔽Those Atharva-Aṅgiras heated that Itihāsa-Purāṇa.

original: tasyābhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyāṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyām vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata
translated: From that heated (text), the essence, the splendour, the power, the energy, the food, the sap was born.

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat
translated: That flowed out.

original: tad ādityam abhito 'śrayat /🔽tad vā etad yad etad ādityasya paraḥkṛṣṇaṃ rūpam //
analyzed: tat ādityam abhitas śrayat  tat vai etat yat etat ādityasya paraḥkṛṣṇam rūpam
translated: It settled around the sun.🔽That is what is the very dark form of that sun.

analyzed: atha ye sya udañcaḥ raśmayaḥ ityādi samānam
translated: Then those rays of his which rise upwards, etc. is the same as before.

original: atharvāṅgiraso 'tharvaṇāṅgirasā ca dṛṣṭā mantrā atharvāṅgirasaḥ karmaṇi prayuktā madhukṛtaḥ /
analyzed: atharva aṅgirasaḥ tharvaṇā aṅgirasā ca dṛṣṭāḥ mantrāḥ atharva aṅgirasaḥ karmaṇi prayuktāḥ madhu kṛtaḥ
translated: The Atharva-Angirasa mantras are seen by Atharvan and Angiras. The Atharva-Angirasa mantras are employed in rituals as the honey-makers.

analyzed: itihāsa purāṇam puṣpam
translated: The Itihasa-Purana is the flower.

original: tayoścetihāsapurāṇayoraśvamedhe pāriplavāsu rātriṣu karmāṅgatvena viniyogaḥ siddhaḥ /
analyzed: tayoḥ ca itihāsa purāṇayoḥ aśvamedhe pāriplavāsu rātriṣu karma aṅga tvena viniyogaḥ siddhaḥ
translated: And the employment of the Itihasa-Purana as an auxiliary to the ritual in the Aśvamedha and Pariplāva nights is established.

analyzed: madhu etat ādityasya paras kṛṣṇam rūpam atiśayena kṛṣṇam iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the honey of the sun, the black form beyond, extremely black, is the meaning.

original: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīyādhyāyasya caturthaḥ khaṇḍaḥ🔽atha ye 'syordhvā raśmayas tā evāsyordhvā madhunāḍyaḥ /
analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya caturthaḥ khaṇḍaḥ  atha ye sya ūrdhvāḥ raśmayaḥ tāḥ eva asya ūrdhvāḥ madhunāḍyaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourth section of the third chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.🔽Now, those upward rays of his are indeed his upward honey-tubes.

analyzed: guhyāḥ eva ādeśāḥ madhukṛtaḥ
translated: The secret directions are indeed the honey-makers.

analyzed: brahma eva puṣpam
translated: Brahman itself is the flower.

analyzed: tāḥ amṛtāḥ āpaḥ
translated: Those are the immortal waters.

original: te vā ete guhyā ādeśā etad brahmābhyatapan /
analyzed: te vai ete guhyāḥ ādeśāḥ etat brahma abhyatapan
translated: Those secret directions indeed meditated on that Brahman.

original: tasyābhitaptasya yaśas teja indriyaṃ vīryam annādyaṃ raso 'jāyata //
analyzed: tasya abhitaptasya yaśaḥ tejaḥ indriyam vīryam annādyam rasaḥ jāyata
translated: From that being meditated upon, its glory, splendor, power, strength, and food were born as the essence.

analyzed: tat vyakṣarat
translated: That flowed out.

original: tad ādityam abhito 'śrayat /🔽tad vā etad yad etad ādityasya madhye kṣobhata iva //
analyzed: tat ādityam abhitas śrayat  tat vai etat yat etat ādityasya madhye kṣobhate iva
translated: That settled around the sun.🔽That indeed is what shines in the middle of the sun as if agitated.

analyzed: atha ye sya ūrdhvāḥ raśmayaḥ ityādi pūrvavat
translated: Now, those upward rays of his, etc., as before.

original: guhyā gopyā rahasyā evā'deśā lokadvārīyādividhaya upāsanāni ca karmāṅgaviṣayāṇi madhukṛto brahmaiva śabdādhikārātprāṇavākhyaṃ puṣpam /
analyzed: guhyāḥ gopyāḥ rahasyāḥ eva ādeśāḥ lokadvārīya ādi vidhayaḥ upāsanāni ca karma aṅga viṣayāṇi madhukṛtaḥ brahmā eva śabda adhikārāt prāṇava ākhyam puṣpam
translated: The secret, hidden, and esoteric injunctions, the rules regarding the doors of the world, and the meditations related to the limbs of action, are the honey. The flower called the Pranava is Brahman itself, because of the authority of the word.

analyzed: samānam anyat
translated: The rest is the same.

original: madhvetadādityasya madhye kṣobhata iva samāhitadṛṣṭerdṛśyate sañcalatīva //
analyzed: madhu etat ādityasya madhye kṣobhataḥ iva samāhita dṛṣṭeḥ dṛśyate sañcalati iva
translated: That honey appears to be moving, as if agitated in the middle of the sun, to one who sees with concentrated vision.

analyzed: te vai ete rasānām rasāḥ
translated: These are the nectars of the nectars.

analyzed: vedāḥ hi rasāḥ
translated: For the Vedas are the nectars.

analyzed: teṣām ete rasāḥ
translated: They are the nectars of those.

analyzed: tāni vai etāni amṛtānām amṛtāni
translated: Or these are the ambrosias of the ambrosias.

analyzed: vedāḥ hi amṛtāḥ
translated: For the Vedas are the ambrosias.

analyzed: teṣām etāni amṛtāni
translated: They are the ambrosias of those.

original: te vā ete yathoktā rohitādirūpaviśeṣā rasānāṃ rasāḥ /
analyzed: te vai ete yathā uktāḥ rohita ādi rūpa viśeṣāḥ rasānām rasāḥ
translated: These mentioned, having the specific forms of red etc., are the nectars of the nectars.

original: keṣāṃ rasānāmityāhavedā hi yasmāllokaniṣyandatvātsārā iti rasāsteṣāṃ rasānāṃ karmabhāvamāpannānāmapyete rohitādiviśeṣā rasā ityantasārabhūtā
analyzed: keṣām rasānām iti āha vedāḥ hi yasmāt loka nisyanda tvāt sārāḥ iti rasāḥ teṣām rasānām karma bhāvam āpannānām api ete rohita ādi viśeṣāḥ rasāḥ iti anta sāra bhūtā
translated: Of which nectars? He says: for the Vedas are the essences because of being the outflow of the worlds, they are the nectars. Of those nectars, even though they have attained the state of action, these specific forms like red are the nectars, the ultimate essence.

analyzed: iti arthaḥ
translated: This is the meaning.

original: tathāmṛtānāmamṛtāni vedā hyamṛtā nityatvāteṣāmetāni rohitādīni rūpāṇyamṛtāni /
analyzed: tathā amṛtānām amṛtāni vedāḥ hi amṛtāḥ nitya tvāt eṣām etāni rohita ādīni rūpāṇi amṛtāni
translated: Similarly, the forms like red etc. are the ambrosias of the ambrosias. For the Vedas are the ambrosias because of their eternality. They are the ambrosias of those.

analyzed: rasānām rasāḥ ityādi karma stutiḥ eṣā
translated: The statement the nectars of the nectars etc. is a praise of action.

analyzed: yasya evam viśiṣṭāni amṛtāni phalam iti
translated: For him, these are the fruits of immortality of such a special kind.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya pañcamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the Fifth Section in the Third Chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: tad yat prathamam amṛtaṃ tad vasava upajīvanty agninā mukhena /
analyzed: tat yat prathamam amṛtam tat vasavaḥ upajīvanti agninā mukhena
translated: That first immortality, the Vasus live on it with Agni as their mouth.

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti
translated: They are satisfied just by seeing this nectar.

analyzed: rūpasya iti na  yaśaḥ ādīnām śrotra ādi gamya tvāt
translated: No, it is not so.🔽Because fame and others are perceived by the ear etc.

analyzed: śrotra grāhyam yaśaḥ
translated: Fame is audible.

analyzed: tejaḥ rūpam cākṣuṣam
translated: Radiance is visible.

analyzed: indriyam viṣaya grahaṇa kārya anumeyam karaṇa sāmarthyam
translated: The capacity of the sense organ is inferred from the function of grasping the object.

analyzed: vīryam balam deha gataḥ utsāhaḥ prāṇavat tā
translated: Valour is strength, the enthusiasm present in the body, the vitality of life.

original: annādyaṃ pratyahamupajīvyamānaṃ śarīrasthitikaraṃ yadbhavati raso hyevamātmakaḥ sarvaḥ /
analyzed: annādyam pratyaham upajīvyamānam śarīra sthiti karam yat bhavati rasaḥ hi evamātmakaḥ sarvaḥ
translated: Food is what is daily used for sustenance, which maintains the body. All rasa (essence) is of this nature.

analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti sarve devāḥ
translated: Seeing it, all the gods are satisfied.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti iti etat sarvam sva karaṇaiḥ anubhūya tṛpyanti iti arthaḥ
translated: Seeing and being satisfied - this means they experience it through their own senses and are satisfied.

analyzed: āditya saṃśrayāḥ santaḥ vaigandhya ādi deha karaṇa doṣa rahitāḥ ca
translated: Resorting to the sun, they are free from the faults of the body and sense organs such as foul smell.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: From this form they rise up.

analyzed: kim te nirudyamāḥ amṛtam upajīvanti na
translated: Do they, being inactive, enjoy the nectar? No.

analyzed: katham tarhi
translated: How then?

analyzed: etat eva rūpam abhilakṣya adhunā bhoga avasaraḥ na asmākam iti buddhvā abhisaṃviśanti udāsate
translated: With the thought, This is the time for us to enjoy the nectar, they enter into and retire into this very form, understanding that now is not the time for them to enjoy.

analyzed: yadā vai tasya amṛtasya bhoga avasaraḥ bhavet tadā etasmāt amṛtāt amṛta bhoga nimittam iti arthaḥ
translated: When there is the time for them to enjoy that nectar, then from that nectar, for the sake of enjoying the nectar, i.e., for the sake of enjoying the nectar that is in the sun.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti utsāhavantaḥ bhavanti iti arthaḥ
translated: From this form they rise up, meaning they become enthusiastic.

analyzed: na hi anutsāhavatām ananapatiṣṭhatām alasānām bhoga prāptiḥ loke dṛṣṭā
translated: For in the world, it is not seen that those who are not enthusiastic, who do not apply themselves, who are lazy, attain enjoyment.

original: sa ya etad evam amṛtaṃ veda vasūnām evaiko bhūtvāgninaiva mukhenaitad evāmṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etat evam amṛtam veda vasūnām eva ekaḥ bhūtvā agninā eva mukhena etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati
translated: He who thus knows this nectar, becoming one of the Vasus, by the mouth of Agni, being satisfied by seeing this very nectar,

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: he enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: From this form he rises up.

analyzed: sa yaḥ kaścid etat evam yathā udita mṛk madhukara tāpa rasa saṃrakṣaṇa mṛgveda vihita karma puṣpāt tasya
translated: He who knows this as described, the protection of the honey-making bees, the flower of the rites enjoined by the Ṛg Veda,

original: cā'dityasaṃśrayaṇaṃ rohita rūpatvaṃ cāmṛtasya prācīdiggataraśmināḍīsaṃsthatāṃ vasudevabhogyatāṃ
analyzed: ca āditya saṃśrayaṇam rohita rūpa tvam ca amṛtasya prācī diś gata raśmi nāḍī saṃstha tām vasudeva bhogya tām
translated: and its dependence on the sun, its red form, its existence in the eastern sun-rays, its being enjoyed by the Vasus,

original: tadvidaśca vasubhiḥ sahaikatāṃ gatvāgninā mukenopajīvanaṃ darśanamātreṇa tṛptiṃ svabhogāvasara
analyzed: tad vidaḥ ca vasubhiḥ saha ekatām gatvā agninā mukena upajīvanam darśana mātreṇa tṛptim sva bhoga avasara
translated: And those who know that, having become one with the Vasus, live on with Agni as their mouth, satisfied with mere seeing, their own enjoyment being the occasion

original: udyamanaṃ tatkālāpāye ca saṃveśanaṃ veda so 'pi vasuvatsarvaṃ tathaivānubhavati //
analyzed: udyamanam tad kāla apāye ca saṃveśanam veda saḥ u pi vasu vat sarvam tathā eva anubhavati
translated: and when that is removed, they enter into it. He also experiences all that as if it were the Vasus.

original: sa yāvad ādityaḥ purastād udetā paścād astam etā vasūnām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā //
analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ purastāt udetā paścāt astam etāḥ vasūnām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the east and sets in the west, for so long he has attained the lordship and self-sovereignty of the Vasus.

analyzed: kiyantam kālam vidvān tat amṛtam upajīvati iti ucyate sa vidvān yāvat ādityaḥ
translated: For how long a time does the knower live on that nectar? It is said: He, the knower, as long as the sun

analyzed: purastāt prācyām diśi udetā paścāt pratīcyām astam etā tāvat vasūnām bhoga kālaḥ tāvantam eva
translated: rises in the east and sets in the west, for so long is the time of enjoyment of the Vasus. For so long

original: kālaṃ vasūnāmādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryatā parito gantā bhavatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: kālam vasūnām ādhipatyam svārājyam paryatā paritas gantā bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: a time he has gone around, gone all around, the lordship and self-sovereignty of the Vasus.

original: na yathā candramaṇḍalasthaḥ kevalakarmī paratantro devānāmannabhūtaḥ /
analyzed: na yathā candra maṇḍala sthaḥ kevala karmī paratantraḥ devānām anna bhūtaḥ
translated: Not like one who performs mere rites, dependent on others, the food of the gods, dwelling in the lunar sphere.

analyzed: kim tarhi ayam ādhipatyam svarāj bhāvam ca adhigacchati
translated: What then? He attains lordship and self-sovereignty.

analyzed: iti chāndogya upaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya ṣaṣṭhaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth section in the third chapter of the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: atha yad dvitīyam amṛtaṃ tad rudrā upajīvantīndreṇa mukhena /
analyzed: atha yat dvitīyam amṛtam tat rudrāḥ upajīvanti indreṇa mukhena
translated: Now, that which is the second nectar, the Rudras live on that, with Indra as their mouth.

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti
translated: Having seen this very nectar, they are satisfied.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: They rise from this form.

analyzed: sa yaḥ etat evam amṛtam veda rudrāṇām eva ekaḥ bhūtvā indreṇa eva mukhena etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati  saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He who knows this very nectar thus, becoming one of the Rudras, with Indra as his mouth, being satisfied by seeing this very nectar,🔽he enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: He rises from this form.

original: athā yaddvitīyamamṛtaṃ tadrudrā upajīvantītyādi samānam //🔽sa yāvad ādityaḥ purastād udetā paścād astam etā dvis tāvad dakṣiṇata udetottarato 'stam etā rudrāṇām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā
analyzed: atha yat dvitīyam amṛtam tat rudrāḥ upajīvanti ityādi samānam  sa yāvat ādityaḥ purastāt udetā paścāt astam etāḥ dvis tāvat dakṣiṇatas udetā uttaratas stam etāḥ rudrāṇām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: Now, that which is the second nectar, the Rudras live on that, and so on, is the same.🔽As long as the sun rises in the east and sets in the west, twice as long it rises in the south and sets in the north. For that long he attains lordship over the Rudras, the state of self-sovereignty.

original: sa yāvadādityaḥ purastādudetā paścādastametā dvistāvattato dviguṇaṃ kālaṃ dakṣiṇata udetottarato 'stametā rudrāṇāṃ tāvadbhogakālaḥ
analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ purastāt udetā paścāt astam etā dvis tāvat tatas dviguṇam kālam dakṣiṇatas udetā uttaratas stam etā rudrāṇām tāvat bhoga kālaḥ
translated: As long as the sun rises in the east and sets in the west, twice as long it rises in the south and sets in the north. For that long is the time of enjoyment of the Rudras.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya saptamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus, in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad, the seventh section of the third chapter.

analyzed: atha yat tṛtīyam amṛtam tat ādityāḥ upajīvanti varuṇena mukhena
translated: Now, the gods who live on that third nectar are the Ādityas, with Varuṇa as their mouth.

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti
translated: They are satisfied just by seeing this nectar.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: They enter into that very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: They rise up from that form.

translated: One who knows this nectar in this way becomes one with the Ādityas, and with Varuṇa as his mouth, he is satisfied just by seeing this nectar.

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He enters into that very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: He rises up from that form.

translated: As long as the sun rises in the south and sets in the north, twice that long it rises in the west and sets in the east. To that extent he attains lordship over the Ādityas and sovereignty over heaven.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya aṣṭamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ

analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

translated: Seeing this very nectar, they are satisfied.

analyzed: te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: They rise up from this form.

analyzed: sa yaḥ etat evam amṛtam veda marutām eva ekaḥ bhūtvā somena eva mukhena etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He enters into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: He rises up from this form.

analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ paścāt udetā purastāt astam etāḥ dvis tāvat uttaratas udetā dakṣiṇatas stam etāḥ marutām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the west and sets in the east, twice as long it rises in the north and sets in the south, to that extent he attains lordship over the Maruts and self-sovereignty.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya navamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ

original: atha yat pañcamam amṛtaṃ tat sādhyā upajīvanti brahmaṇā mukhena /
analyzed: atha yat pañcamam amṛtam tat sādhyāḥ upajīvanti brahmaṇā mukhena
translated: Now, the fifth nectar, the Sādhyas live on that with Brahman as their mouth.

original: na vai devā aśnanti na pibanti /
analyzed: na vai devāḥ aśnanti na pibanti
translated: The gods do not eat or drink.

original: etad evāmṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti //🔽ta etad eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti /
analyzed: etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyanti  te etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśanti
translated: Seeing this very nectar, they are satisfied.🔽They enter into this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udyanti
translated: They rise up from this form.

original: sa ya etad evam amṛtaṃ veda sādhyānām evaiko bhūtvā brahmaṇaiva mukhenaitad evāmṛtaṃ dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati /
analyzed: sa yaḥ etat evam amṛtam veda sādhyānām eva ekaḥ bhūtvā brahmaṇā eva mukhena etat eva amṛtam dṛṣṭvā tṛpyati
translated: He who knows this nectar thus, becomes one of the Sadhyas themselves, and through Brahman as his mouth, he becomes satisfied by beholding this very nectar.

analyzed: saḥ etat eva rūpam abhisaṃviśati
translated: He enters this very form.

analyzed: etasmāt rūpāt udeti
translated: He rises from this form.

original: sa yāvad āditya uttarata udetā dakṣiṇato 'stam etā dvis tāvad ūrdhvam udetārvāg astam etā sādhyānām eva tāvad ādhipatyaṃ svārājyaṃ paryetā
analyzed: sa yāvat ādityaḥ uttaratas udetā dakṣiṇatas stam etāḥ dvis tāvat ūrdhvam udetā arvāk astam etā sādhyānām eva tāvat ādhipatyam svārājyam paryetā
translated: As long as the sun rises in the north and sets in the south, twice as long does it rise upwards and set downwards. To that extent he obtains the lordship of the Sadhyas, the sovereignty of heaven.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi tṛtīya adhyāyasya daśamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth section of the third chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

analyzed: tathā paścāt uttaratas ūrdhvam udetā viparyayeṇa astam etā
translated: Similarly, it rises in the west, north, and upwards, and sets in the opposite directions.

analyzed: pūrvasmāt pūrvasmāt dviguṇa uttarottareṇa kālena iti apaurāṇam darśanam
translated: The ancient view is that it rises twice as long in each subsequent direction, and sets twice as long in each subsequent direction.

analyzed: savituḥ caturdiśam indra yama varuṇa soma purīṣu udaya astamaya kālasya tulya tvam hi paurāṇikaiḥ uktam
translated: The Purāṇas state that the time of rising and setting of the sun is the same in the cities of Indra, Yama, Varuṇa, and Soma in the four directions.

analyzed: mānasottarasya mūrdhani meroḥ pradakṣiṇa āvṛtteḥ tulya tvāt iti
translated: This is because the circumference of Meru, the peak of Mount Mānasottara, is the same.

analyzed: atra uktaḥ parihāraḥ ācāryaiḥ
translated: The teachers have stated the following solution to this problem.

original: amarāvatyādīnāṃ purīṇāṃ dviguṇottarottareṇa kālenodvāsaḥ syāt /🔽udayaśca nāma savitustannivāsināṃ prāṇināṃ cakṣugocarāpattistadatyayaṣcastamanaṃ na paramārthata udayāstamane staḥ /
analyzed: amarāvatī ādīnām purīṇām dviguṇa uttarottareṇa kālena udvāsaḥ syāt  udayaḥ ca nāma savituḥ tad nivāsinām prāṇinām cakṣu gocara āpattiḥ tad atyayaḥ ca astamanam na paramārthataḥ udaya astamane staḥ
translated: The abandonment of the cities such as Amaravati occurs in twice the time, in increasing order.🔽Rising means the sun coming within the range of vision of the creatures living there, and setting means its disappearance. But rising and setting do not really exist.

original: tannivāsināṃ ca prāṇināmabhāve tānprati tenaiva mārgeṇa gacchannapi naivodetā nāstameteti cakṣurgocarāpattestadatyayasya cābhāvāt /
analyzed: tad nivāsinām ca prāṇinām abhāve tān prati tena eva mārgeṇa gacchan api nā eva udetā na astam eta iti cakṣuḥ gocara āpatteḥ tad atyayasya ca abhāvāt
translated: And even if the sun goes by that same path when the creatures living there are absent, it does not rise or set, because it does not come within the range of vision or disappear.

original: tathāmarāvatyāḥ sakāśāddviguṇaṃ kālaṃ saṃyamanī purī vasatyatastannivāsinaḥ prāṇinaḥ prati dakṣiṇata ivodetyuttarato 'stametītyucyate 'smadbuddhiṃ
analyzed: tathā amarāvatyāḥ sakāśāt dviguṇam kālam saṃyamanī purī vasati atas tad nivāsinaḥ prāṇinaḥ prati dakṣiṇatas iva udeti uttaratas stameti iti ucyate smad buddhim
translated: Similarly, the city of Samyamani exists twice the time as Amaravati. Therefore, for the creatures living there, it is said to rise in the south and set in the north,

analyzed: ca apekṣya
translated: with reference to our understanding.

analyzed: tathā uttarāsu api purīṣu yojanā
translated: The same applies to the northern cities as well.

analyzed: sarveṣām ca meruḥ uttaratas bhavati
translated: And Meru is always to the north of all of them.

original: yadāmarāvatyāṃ madhyāhnagataḥ savitā tadā saṃyamanyāmudyandṛśyate tatra madhyāhnagato vāruṇyāmudyandṛśyate /
analyzed: yadā amarāvatyām madhyāhna gataḥ savitā tadā saṃyamanyām udyan dṛśyate tatra madhyāhna gataḥ vāruṇyām udyan dṛśyate
translated: When the sun has reached midday in Amaravati, it is seen rising in Samyamani. At that time, it has reached midday in Varuni and is seen rising in the north.

analyzed: tathā uttarasyām
translated: Similarly in the north.

analyzed: pradakṣiṇa āvṛtteḥ tulya tvāt
translated: Because the clockwise motion is the same.

original: ilāvṛtavāsināṃ sarvataḥ parvataprākāranivāritādityaraśmīnāṃ savitordhva ivodetāvagistametā dṛśyate /
analyzed: ilāvṛta vāsinām sarvatas parvata prākāra nivārita āditya raśmīnām savitā ūrdhvaḥ iva udetā avagirtam etāḥ dṛśyate
translated: To the inhabitants of the Ilāvṛta continent, who are obstructed from the sun's rays by the mountain ramparts on all sides, the sun appears to rise upwards and set downwards.

analyzed: parvata ūrdhva chidra praveśāt savitṛ prakāśasya
