analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ
translated: They said:

analyzed: upakosala eṣā somya te smadvidyā ātma vidyā ca
translated: O Upamanyu, this, dear one, is your knowledge of the Self and our knowledge.

analyzed: ācāryaḥ tu te gatim vaktā iti
translated: But your teacher will tell you the goal.

analyzed: ājagāma ha asya ācāryaḥ
translated: His teacher came.

analyzed: tam ācāryaḥ bhyuvāda upakosalaḥ iti
translated: The teacher addressed him: Upamanyu!

original: te punaḥ sambhūyocurhepakosalaiṣā somya te tavāsmadvidyāgnividyetyarthaḥ /
analyzed: te punar sambhūya ūcuḥ hepa kosala eṣā somya te tava asmad vidyā agni vidyā iti arthaḥ
translated: They again said together: O Upamanyu, this, dear one, is your knowledge of the Self and our knowledge of Agni.

original: ātmavidyā pūrvoktā prāṇo brahma kaṃ brahma khaṃ brahmeti ca /
analyzed: ātma vidyā pūrva uktā prāṇaḥ brahma kam brahma kham brahma iti ca
translated: The previously mentioned knowledge of the Self is Prana is Brahman, Kam is Brahman, Kham is Brahman.

original: ācāryastu te gatiṃ vaktā vidyāphalaprāptaya ityuktvoparemuragnayaḥ /
analyzed: ācāryaḥ tu te gatim vaktā vidyā phala prāptaye iti uktvā uparemuḥ agnayaḥ
translated: The teacher, however, will tell you the way, as to how to attain the fruit of knowledge. Having said this, the fires ceased.

analyzed: ājagāma ha asya ācāryaḥ kālena
translated: In due course, his teacher came.

analyzed: tam ca śiṣyam ācāryaḥ bhyuvāda upakosalaḥ iti
translated: And the teacher addressed that disciple, saying, Upamanyu.

analyzed: bhagavaḥ iti ha pratiśuśrāva
translated: Sir, he replied.

analyzed: brahma vidaḥ iva somya mukham bhāti
translated: Your face shines, my dear, like one who knows Brahman.

analyzed: kaḥ nu tvā anuśaśāsa iti
translated: Who has instructed you?

original: ko nu mānuśiśyād bho itīhāpeva nihnute /
analyzed: kaḥ nu mā anuśiśyāt bho nihnute
translated: Who has instructed me, sir? he said, as if denying it here.

original: ime nūnam īdṛśā anyādṛśā itīhāgnīn abhyūde /
analyzed: ime nūnam īdṛśāḥ anyādṛśāḥ iti iha agnīn abhyūde
translated: These must be like this, unlike this, he said, addressing the fires here.

original: kiṃ nu somya kila te 'vocann iti //
analyzed: kim nu somya kila te vocan iti
translated: What indeed, my dear, did they tell you?

analyzed: idam iti ha pratijajñe
translated: This, he declared.

analyzed: lokān vāva kila somya te vocan
translated: They have indeed told you about the worlds, my dear.

original: ahaṃ tu te tad vakṣyāmi yathā puṣkarapalāśa āpo na śliṣyanta evam evaṃvidi pāpaṃ karma na śliṣyata iti /
analyzed: aham tu te tat vakṣyāmi yathā puṣkarapalāśe āpaḥ na śliṣyante evam evaṃvidi pāpam karma na śliṣyate iti
translated: But I will tell you that, just as water does not stick to a lotus leaf, so evil deeds do not stick to one who knows this.

analyzed: bravītu me bhagavān iti
translated: May the Blessed One tell me.

analyzed: tasmai ha uvāca
translated: To him he said:

analyzed: bhagavaḥ iti ha pratiśuśrāva
translated: Sir, he replied.

original: brahmavida iva somya te mukhaṃ prasannaṃ bhāti ko nu tvānuśaśāsetyuktaḥ pratyāha /
analyzed: brahma vidaḥ iva somya te mukham prasannam bhāti kaḥ nu tvā anuśaśāsa iti uktaḥ pratyāha
translated: Your face shines, my dear, like one who knows Brahman. Who has instructed you?

original: ko nu mānuśiṣyādanuśāsanaṃ kuryādbho bhagavaṃstvayi proṣita itīhāpeva nihnute 'panihnuta iveti vyavahitena sambandho na cāpanihnute na ca yatāvadagnibhiruktaṃ
analyzed: kaḥ nu mā anuśiṣyāt anuśāsanam kuryāt bho bhagavan tvayi proṣitaḥ iti nihnute iva iti vyavahitena sambandhaḥ na ca apanihnute na ca yatāvat agnibhiḥ uktam
translated: Who else, O revered Sir, would instruct and admonish you when I am away? Thus, as it were, he denies, he conceals, as it were. The connection is through the indirect object. And he does not deny, and he does not speak exactly as the fires said.

analyzed: bravīti iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The idea is that he speaks only partially.

original: kathamime 'gnayo mayā paricaritā uktavanto nūnaṃ yatastvāṃ dṛṣṭvā vepamānā ivedṛśā dṛśyante pūrvamanyādṛśāḥ santa itīhāgnīnabhyūde 'bhyuktavānkākvāgnīndarśayan
analyzed: katham ime gnayaḥ mayā paricaritāḥ uktavantaḥ nūnam yatas tvām dṛṣṭvā vepamānāḥ iva īdṛśāḥ dṛśyante pūrvam anyādṛśāḥ santaḥ iti iha agnīn abhyūde bhyuktavān kākvā agnīn darśayan
translated: How is it that these fires have been served by me and have spoken, for sure, since seeing you they appear to tremble, seen to be of such a kind, having been of another kind before? Thus he spoke to the fires, showing the fires with a question.

original: kiṃ nu somya kila te tubhyamavocannagnaya iti pṛṣṭa ityevamidamuktavanta ityevaṃ ha pratijajñe pratijñātavānpratīkamātraṃ kiñcinna sarvaṃ yathoktamagnibhiruktamavocat
analyzed: kim nu somya kila te tubhyam avocan agnaye iti pṛṣṭaḥ iti evam idam uktavantaḥ iti evam ha pratijajñe pratijñātavān pratīka mātram kiñcid na sarvam yathā uktam agnibhiḥ uktam avocat
translated: When asked, What indeed, O dear one, did the fires say to you? he replied, They said this, and thus he promised, he declared, only a part, not all as was said by the fires.

original: yata āhā'cāryo lokānvāva pṛthivyādīnhe somya kila te 'vocanna brahma sākalyena /
analyzed: yatas āha ācāryaḥ lokān vāva pṛthivī ādīn he somya kila te vocan na brahma sākalyena
translated: For he said, O dear one, the fires indeed said to you the worlds beginning with earth, but not Brahman in its entirety.

original: ahaṃ tu te tubhyaṃ tadbrahma yadicchasi tvaṃ śrotuṃ vakṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham tu te tubhyam tat brahma yat icchasi tvam śrotum vakṣyāmi
translated: But I, if you wish to hear, will tell you that Brahman.

original: śṛṇu tasya mayocyamānasya brahmaṇo jñānamāhātmyaṃ yathā puṣkarapalāśe padmapatra
analyzed: śṛṇu tasya mayā ucyamānasya brahmaṇaḥ jñāna māhātmyam yathā puṣkara palāśe padma patra
translated: Listen to the greatness of the knowledge of Brahman as I explain it, just as water does not stick to the leaf of a lotus.

original: āpo na śilaṣyanta evaṃ yatā vakṣyāmi brahmaivaṃvidi pāpaṃ karma na śilaṣyate na sambadhyata
analyzed: āpaḥ na śilaṣyante evam yatāḥ vakṣyāmi brahma evaṃvidi pāpam karma na śilaṣyate na sambadhyata
translated: Just as I will explain, for one who knows Brahman in this way, sin does not stick, does not attach.

original: ityevamuktavatyācārya āhopakosalo bravītu me bhagavāniti tasmai hovācā'cāryaḥ //
analyzed: iti evam uktavati ācāryaḥ āha upakosalaḥ bravītu me bhagavān iti tasmai ha uvāca ācāryaḥ
translated: Thus spoke the teacher. Upaskara of Kosala said, May the Blessed One tell me. The teacher said to him.

analyzed: iti chāndogya upaniṣadi caturtha adhyāyasya caturdaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fourteenth section in the fourth chapter of Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: ya eṣo 'kṣiṇi puruṣo dṛśyata eṣa ātmeti hovāca /
analyzed: yaḥ eṣaḥ u kṣiṇi puruṣaḥ dṛśyate eṣaḥ ātmā iti ha uvāca
translated: The person seen in the eye is the Self, he said.

analyzed: etat amṛtam abhayam etat brahma iti
translated: This is the immortal, the fearless, this is Brahman.

original: tad yady apy asmin sarpir vodakaṃ vā siñcati vartmanī eva gacchati //🔽ya eṣo 'kṣiṇi puruṣo dṛśyate nivṛttacakṣurbhirbrahmacaryādisādhanasampannaiḥ śāntairvivekibhirdṛṣṭerdraṣṭācakṣuṣaścakṣuḥityādiśrutyantarāt
analyzed: tat yadi api asmin sarpiḥ vā udakam vā siñcati vartmanī eva gacchati 🔽yaḥ eṣaḥ u kṣiṇi puruṣaḥ dṛśyate nivṛtta cakṣurbhiḥ brahmacarya ādi sādhana sampannaiḥ śāntaiḥ vivekibhiḥ dṛṣṭeḥ draṣṭā cakṣuṣaḥ cakṣuḥ ityādi śruti antarāt
translated: Even if clarified butter or water is poured into it, it flows along the eye-tracks.

original: nanvagnibhiruktaṃ vitathaṃ yata ācāryastu te gatiṃ vakteti gatimātrasya vaktetyavocanbhaviṣyadviṣayāparijñānaṃ cāgnīnam /
analyzed: nanu agnibhiḥ uktam vitatham yatas ācāryaḥ tu te gatim vaktā iti gati mātrasya vaktā iti avocan bhaviṣyat viṣaya aparijñānam ca āgnīnam
translated: But the fires said what was false, since they said, 'The teacher will declare to you the goal.' And the ignorance of the fires about the future was that they spoke only of the goal.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: sukha ākāśasya eva akṣiṇi dṛśyate iti draṣṭuḥ anuvādāt
translated: Because it is said that the blissful space is seen in the eye, it is a restatement of the seer.

analyzed: eṣaḥ ātmā prāṇinām iti ha uvāca evam uktavān etat yat eva ātma tattvam avocāma
translated: He said, 'This is the self of living beings.' Having said this, he spoke of the truth of the self.

original: etadamṛtamamaraṇadharmyavināśyata evābhayaṃ yasya hi vināśāśaṅkā tasya bhayopapattistadabhāvādabhayamata evaitadbrahma bṛhadanantamiti /
analyzed: etat amṛtam amaraṇa dharmya vināśyataḥ eva abhayam yasya hi vināśa āśaṅkā tasya bhaya upapattiḥ tad abhāvāt abhayam atas eva etat brahma bṛhat anantam iti
translated: This is the immortal, having the nature of not dying, indestructible itself, and fearless. For one who has the fear of destruction, there is the possibility of fear. Due to its absence, it is fearless. Therefore, this is Brahman, great and infinite.

original: kiñcāsya brahmaṇo 'kṣipuruṣasya māhātmyaṃ tattatra puruṣasya sthāne 'kṣiṇi yadyapyasminyarpirvodakaṃ
analyzed: kiñca asya brahmaṇaḥ kṣi puruṣasya māhātmyam tat tatra puruṣasya sthāne kṣiṇi yadi api asmin yarpiḥ vā udakam
translated: Moreover, the greatness of this Brahman, the person in the eye, is that in that place of the person in the eye, although water or

original: vā siñcati vartmanī eva gacchati pakṣmāveva gacchati na cakṣuṣā sambandhyate padmapatreṇevodakam /
analyzed: vā siñcati vartmanī eva gacchati pakṣmau eva gacchati na cakṣuṣā sambandhyate padma patreṇa iva udakam
translated: oil is poured on it, it goes only in the channels, goes only in the eyelashes, and does not come into contact with the eye, like water with a lotus leaf.

original: sthānasyāpyetanmāhātmyaṃ kiṃ punaḥ sthānino 'kṣipuruṣasya nirañjanatvaṃ vaktavyamityabhiprāyaḥ //
analyzed: sthānasya api etat māhātmyam kim punar kṣi puruṣasya nirañjana tvam vaktavyam iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: This is the greatness of the place. What need be said of the person in the eye, the occupant, being free from impurities? This is the intention.

original: etaṃ saṃyadvāma ity ācakṣate /🔽etaṃ hi sarvāṇi vāmāny abhisaṃyanti /
analyzed: etam saṃyat vāmaḥ iti ācakṣate  etam hi sarvāṇi vāmāni abhisaṃyanti
translated: This (person) they call the 'united desirable things'.🔽For all desirable things are united in him.

original: sarvāṇy enaṃ vāmāny abhisaṃyanti ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: sarvāṇi enam vāmāni abhisaṃyanti yaḥ evam veda
translated: All desirable things are united in him who knows thus.

analyzed: etam yathā uktam puruṣam saṃyat vāmaḥ iti ācakṣate
translated: This person described above they call the 'united desirable things'.

analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why?

original: yasmādetaṃ sarvāṇi vāmāni vananīyāni saṃbhajanīyāni śobhanānyabhisaṃyantyabhisaṅgacchantītyataḥ saṃyadvāmaḥ /
analyzed: yasmāt etam sarvāṇi vāmāni vananīyāni saṃbhajanīyāni śobhanāni abhisaṃyanti abhisaṅgacchanti iti atas saṃyat vāmaḥ
translated: Because all desirable things, all things to be enjoyed, all good things are united in him, are connected with him. Therefore he is the 'united desirable things'.

original: tathaivaṃvidamenaṃ sarvāṇi vāmānyabhisaṃyanti ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: tathā evaṃvidam enam sarvāṇi vāmāni abhisaṃyanti yaḥ evam veda
translated: In the same way, all desirable things are united in him who knows thus.

analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva vāmanīḥ
translated: He indeed is the 'leader of desirable things'.

analyzed: eṣa hi sarvāṇi vāmāni nayati
translated: For he leads all desirable things.

original: sarvāṇi vāmāni nayati ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: sarvāṇi vāmāni nayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: He leads all desirable things who knows thus.

original: eṣa u eva vāmanīryasmādeṣa hi sarvāṇi vāmāni puṇyakarmaphalāni puṇyānurūpaṃ prāṇibhyo nayati prāpayati vahati cā'tmadharmatvena
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva vāmanīḥ yasmāt eṣa hi sarvāṇi vāmāni puṇya karma phalāni puṇya anurūpam prāṇibhyaḥ nayati prāpayati vahati ca ātma dharma tvena
translated: He indeed is the 'leader of desirable things', because he leads all desirable things, the fruits of meritorious actions, to beings according to their merit, brings them, and carries them as his own attribute.

original: viduṣaḥ phalaṃsarvāṇi vāmāni nayati ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: viduṣaḥ phalam sarvāṇi vāmāni nayati yaḥ evam veda
translated: The reward for the knower is that he leads all desirable things, he who knows thus.

original: eṣa u eva bhāmanīḥ /🔽eṣa hi sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva bhāmanīḥ  eṣa hi sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti
translated: He indeed is the 'giver of light'.🔽For he shines in all worlds.

original: sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti yaḥ evam veda
translated: He shines in all worlds who knows thus.

original: eṣa u eva bhāmanīreṣa hi yasmātsarveṣu lokeṣvādityacandrāgnyādirūpairbhāti dīpyate /
analyzed: eṣaḥ u eva bhāmanīḥ eṣa hi yasmāt sarveṣu lokeṣu āditya candra agni ādi rūpaiḥ bhāti dīpyate
translated: He is also the light-bringer, for he shines, he illuminates, in all the worlds in the forms of the sun, moon, fire, etc.

original: tasya bhāsā sarvamidaṃ vibhātiiti śruterato bhāmāni nayatīti bhāmanīḥ /
analyzed: tasya bhāsā sarvam idam vibhāti iti śruteḥ atas bhāmāni nayati iti bhāmanīḥ
translated: Because of the Vedic text, By his light all this shines, he leads the lights, therefore he is the light-bringer.

original: ya evaṃ vedāsāvapi sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti //
analyzed: yaḥ evam veda asau api sarveṣu lokeṣu bhāti
translated: One who knows thus shines in all the worlds.

original: atha yad u caivāsmiñ chavyaṃ kurvanti yadi ca nārciṣam evābhisaṃbhavanti /
analyzed: atha yat u ca eva asmin chavyam kurvanti yadi ca na arciṣam eva abhisaṃbhavanti
translated: Now, whatever good act they perform in this world, and whatever evil, they all go to the light.

analyzed: arciṣaḥ haḥ
translated: From the light to the day.

analyzed: ahnaḥ āpūryamāṇapakṣam
translated: From the day to the waxing fortnight.

original: āpūryamāṇapakṣād yān ṣaḍ udaṅṅ eti māsāṃs tān /
analyzed: āpūryamāṇapakṣāt yān ṣaṭ udaṅ eti māsān tān
translated: From the waxing fortnight to those six months when the sun moves north.

analyzed: māsebhyaḥ saṃvatsaram  saṃvatsarāt ādityam  ādityāt candramasam
translated: From the months to the year.🔽From the year to the sun.🔽From the sun to the moon.

analyzed: candramasaḥ vidyutam
translated: From the moon to the lightning.

analyzed: tat puruṣaḥ mānavaḥ
translated: That is the immortal person.

analyzed: saḥ enān brahma gamayati
translated: He leads them to Brahman.

analyzed: eṣa deva pathaḥ brahma pathaḥ
translated: This is the path of the gods, the path of Brahman.

original: etena pratipadyamānā imaṃ mānavam āvartaṃ nāvartante nāvartante //
analyzed: etena pratipadyamānāḥ imam mānavam āvartam na āvartante na āvartante
translated: Those who proceed by this do not return to this human cycle of birth and death. They do not return.

analyzed: atha idānīm yathā ukta brahma vidaḥ gatiḥ ucyate
translated: Now, the path of one who knows Brahman as described is being stated.

original: yadyadi u caivāsminnevaṃvidi śavyaṃ śavakarma mṛte kurvanti yadi ca na kurvanti ṛtvijaḥ sarvathāpyevaṃvittena śavakarmaṇākṛtenāpi pratibaddho
analyzed: yat yadi u ca eva asmin evaṃvidi śavyam śava karma mṛte kurvanti yadi ca na kurvanti ṛtvijaḥ sarvathā api evaṃvittena śava karmaṇā a kṛtena api pratibaddhaḥ
translated: If the priests perform the funeral rites for him who knows this, whatever be the nature of the funeral rites, and if they do not perform them, in either case, the knower of Brahman is not obstructed by the performance or non-performance of the funeral rites.

analyzed: na
translated: He does not attain the abode of Brahman.

original: na ca kṛtena śavakarmaṇāsya kaścanābhyadhiko lokaḥ /
analyzed: na ca kṛtena śava karmaṇā asya kaścana abhyadhikaḥ lokaḥ
translated: Nor is there any higher world for him by the performance of the funeral rites.

original: na karmaṇā vardhate no kanīyāniti śrutyantarāt /
analyzed: na karmaṇā vardhate na u kanīyān iti śruti antarāt
translated: Because of another Vedic text: He does not grow by action, nor does he diminish (Ka. 1.2.24).

original: śavakarmaṇyanādaraṃ darśayanvidyāṃ stauti na punaḥ śavakarmaivaṃvido na kartavyamiti /
analyzed: śava karmaṇi anādaram darśayan vidyām stauti na punar śava karma evaṃvidaḥ na kartavyam iti
translated: By showing disregard for the funeral rites, he praises the knowledge, not that the funeral rites should not be performed for one who knows thus.

original: akriyamāṇe hi śavakarmaṇi karmaṇā phalārambhe pratibandhaḥ kaścidanumīyate 'nyatra /
analyzed: a kriyamāṇe hi śava karmaṇi karmaṇā phala ārambhe pratibandhaḥ kaścid anumīyate nyatra
translated: For if the funeral rites are not performed, some obstruction to the commencement of the fruits of action is inferred elsewhere.

original: yata iha vidyāphalārambhakāle śavakarma syādvā na veti vidyāvato 'pratibandhena phalārambhaṃ darśayati /
analyzed: yatas iha vidyā phala ārambha kāle śava karma syāt vā na vā iti vidyāvataḥ pratibandhena phala ārambham darśayati
translated: Because here, at the time of the commencement of the fruits of knowledge, whether the funeral rites are performed or not, it shows the commencement of the fruits without obstruction for one who knows.

analyzed: ye sukha ākāśam akṣi stham saṃyat vāmaḥ vāmanīḥ bhāmanīḥ iti evaṅguṇam upāsate prāṇa sahitām agni vidyām
translated: Those who meditate on the pleasant space in the eye, which has the qualities of being the same, charming, pleasing, and beautiful, along with the vital breaths, and the knowledge of Agni,

original: ca teṣāmanyatkarma bhavatu mā vā bhūtsarvathāpi te 'rciṣamevābhisambhavantyarcirabhimāninīṃ
analyzed: ca teṣām anyat karma bhavatu mā vā bhūt sarvathā api te rciṣam eva abhisambhavanti arciḥ abhimāninīm
translated: And let there be another work for them or not, in any case they attain only the light, the deity identified with the light.

original: devatāmabhisambhavanti pratipadyanta ityarthaḥ /🔽arciṣo 'rcirdevatāyā aharaharabhimāninīṃ devatāmahna āpūryamāṇapakṣaṃ śuklapakṣadevatāmāpūryamāṇapakṣādyānṣaṇmāsānudaṅṅuttarāṃ
analyzed: devatām abhisambhavanti pratipadyante iti arthaḥ  arciṣaḥ rciḥ devatāyāḥ aharahar abhimāninīm devatām ahnaḥ āpūryamāṇapakṣam śuklapakṣa devatām āpūryamāṇapakṣa ādyān ṣaṭ māsān udaṅ uttarām
translated: The meaning is that they reach, they attain, the deity identified with the light.

original: diśameti savitā tānmāsānuttarāyaṇadevatāṃ tebhyo māsebhyaḥ saṃvatsaraṃ saṃvatsaradevatāṃ
analyzed: diśam eti savitā tān māsān uttarāyaṇa devatām tebhyaḥ māsebhyaḥ saṃvatsaram saṃvatsara devatām
translated: From the light, from the deity of the light, they attain the deity identified with the day, the deity of the bright fortnight, which is the fortnight when the moon is waxing. From the fortnight when the moon is waxing, they attain the deity of the northern solstice, the six months during which the sun moves north. From those months, they attain the deity of the year, the year.

analyzed: tatas saṃvatsarāt ādidityam ādityāt candramasam candramasaḥ vidyutam tat tatrasthān tān puruṣaḥ
translated: From that year, they attain the sun, from the sun the moon, from the moon the lightning, and the person who is there.

original: kaścidbrahmalokādetyāmānavo mānavyāṃ sṛṣṭau bhavo mānavo na mānavo 'mānavaḥ sa puruṣa
analyzed: kaścid brahma lokāt etya a mānavaḥ mānavyām sṛṣṭau bhavaḥ mānavaḥ na mānavaḥ mānavaḥ sa puruṣa
translated: Some non-human person comes from the world of Brahman. One who exists in the human creation is human, one who is not human is non-human. That person

analyzed: enān brahma satya loka stham gamayati gantṛ gantavya gamayitṛ tva vyapadeśebhyaḥ
translated: leads them to Brahman, which is in the world of truth, because of the statements about the one who goes, the place to be gone to, and the one who leads.

analyzed: sat mātra brahma prāptau tad anupapatteḥ
translated: Because that is not possible in the attainment of Brahman which is mere existence.

original: brahmaiva sanbrahmāpyetīti hi tatra vaktuṃ nyāyyam /
analyzed: brahma eva san brahma apyeti iti hi tatra vaktum nyāyyam
translated: For it is proper to say there, Being Brahman only, one goes to Brahman.

analyzed: sarva bheda nirāsena sat mātra pratipattim vakṣyati
translated: He will speak of the realization of pure Being by the exclusion of all distinctions.

analyzed: na ca adṛṣṭaḥ mārgaḥ gamanāya upatiṣṭhate
translated: And a path that is not seen does not stand in the way of going.

analyzed: saḥ enam a viditaḥ na bhunakti iti śruti antarāt
translated: Because of another Vedic text: He who is unknown does not enjoy.

original: eṣa devapathaḥ devairarcirādibhiḥ gamayitṛtvenādhikṛtaiḥ upalakṣitaḥ panthā devapatha ucyate /
analyzed: eṣa deva pathaḥ devaiḥ arciḥ ādibhiḥ gamayitṛ tvena adhikṛtaiḥ upalakṣitaḥ panthāḥ deva pathaḥ ucyate
translated: This is the path of the gods, characterized by the gods such as light, who are qualified to lead by that. It is called the path of the gods.

original: brahma gantavyaṃ tena copalakṣita iti brahmapathaḥ /
analyzed: brahma gantavyam tena ca upalakṣitaḥ iti brahma pathaḥ
translated: Brahman is what is to be reached, and it is characterized by that, so it is the path of Brahman.

original: etena pratipadyamānā gacchanto brahmemaṃ mānavaṃ manusambandhinaṃ manoḥ sṛṣṭilakṣaṇamāvata
analyzed: etena pratipadyamānāḥ gacchantaḥ brahma imam mānavam manu sambandhinam manoḥ sṛṣṭi lakṣaṇam āvata
translated: Those who are proceeding by this, going, do not return to this human world characterized by Manu's creation.

original: nā'vartanta āvartante 'smiñjananamaraṇaprabandhacakrārūḍhā ghaṭīyantravatpunaḥ punarityārvatastaṃ na pratipadyante /
analyzed: na āvartante āvartante smin janana maraṇa prabandha cakra ārūḍhāḥ ghaṭīyantra vat punar punar iti ārvataḥ tam na pratipadyante
translated: They are repeatedly born and die, mounted on the wheel of the continuum of birth and death, like a waterwheel. They do not reach that.

original: nāvartante nā'vartante iti dviruktiḥ saphalāyā vidyāyāḥ parisamāptipradarśanārthā //
analyzed: na āvartante na āvartante iti dviruktiḥ saphalāyāḥ vidyāyāḥ parisamāpti pradarśana arthā
translated: The repetition of do not return, do not return is for the purpose of showing the completion of the fruitful knowledge.

analyzed: iti chāndogya upaniṣadi caturtha adhyāyasya pañcadaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the fifteenth section in the fourth chapter of the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: eṣa ha vai yajño yo 'yaṃ pavate /
analyzed: eṣa ha vai yajñaḥ yaḥ yam pavate
translated: This indeed is the sacrifice, which is this blowing (wind).

original: eṣa ha yann idaṃ sarvaṃ punāti /
analyzed: eṣa ha yan idam sarvam punāti
translated: This indeed purifies everything here.

original: yad eṣa yann idaṃ sarvaṃ punāti /
analyzed: yat eṣa yan idam sarvam punāti
translated: Because he purifies all this whatever there is.

analyzed: tasmāt eṣaḥ eva yajñaḥ
translated: Therefore, he alone is the sacrifice.

original: tasya manaś ca vāk ca vartanī //
analyzed: tasya manaḥ ca vāc ca vartanī
translated: His two wheels are mind and speech.

analyzed: rahasya prakaraṇe prasaṅgāt āraṇyaka tva sāmānyāt ca yajñe kṣate utpanne
translated: In the section on the secret teachings, due to the connection and the commonality of being in the forest, when a wound occurs in the sacrifice,

original: vyāhṛtayaḥ prāyaścittārthā vidhātavyāstadabhijñasya cartvijo brahmaṇo maunamityata
analyzed: vyāhṛtayaḥ prāyaścitta arthāḥ vidhātavyāḥ tad abhijñasya ca ṛtvijaḥ brahmaṇaḥ maunam iti atas
translated: the Vyāhṛtis should be prescribed for the purpose of expiation, and silence for the priest and the Brahman who knows them. Therefore,

original: idamārabhyateeṣa ha vā eṣa vāyuryo 'yaṃ pavate 'yaṃ yajñaḥ /
analyzed: idam ārabhyate eṣa ha vai eṣa vāyuḥ yaḥ yam pavate yam yajñaḥ
translated: this is begun: This very wind that blows is this sacrifice.

analyzed: ha vā iti prasiddha artha avadyotakau nipātau
translated: The words ha va indicate well-known meanings.

analyzed: vāyu pratiṣṭhaḥ hi yajñaḥ prasiddhaḥ śrutiṣu
translated: For it is well known in the scriptures that the sacrifice is based on the wind.

analyzed: svāhā vātedhāḥ
translated: Svāhā to the wind-bearer.

analyzed: ayam vai yajñaḥ yaḥ yam pavate ityādi śrutibhyaḥ
translated: This is the sacrifice that blows, etc.

analyzed: vātaḥ eva hi calana ātmava tvāt kriyā samavāyī
translated: For the wind alone, due to having the nature of motion, is connected with action.

original: vāta eva yajñasyā'rambhako vātaḥ pratiṣṭhāiti ca śravaṇāt /
analyzed: vātaḥ eva yajñasya ārambhakaḥ vātaḥ pratiṣṭhā iti ca śravaṇāt
translated: The wind alone is the instigator of the sacrifice, and it is heard that the wind is the foundation.

original: eṣa ha yangacchaṃścalannidaṃ sarvaṃ jagatpunāti pāvayati śodhayati /
analyzed: eṣa ha yan gacchan calan idam sarvam jagat punāti pāvayati śodhayati
translated: This indeed, while going and moving, purifies all this world, sanctifies and cleanses it.

analyzed: na hi acalataḥ śuddhiḥ asti
translated: For there is no purification for one who is not moving.

original: doṣanirasanaṃ calato hi dṛṣṭaṃ na sthirasya /
analyzed: doṣa nirasanam calataḥ hi dṛṣṭam na sthirasya
translated: For the removal of faults is seen in one who moves, not in one who is stable.

original: yadyasmācca yannaṣa idaṃ sarvaṃ punāti tasmādeṣa eva yajño yatpunātīti /
analyzed: yat yasmāt ca idam sarvam punāti tasmāt eṣaḥ eva yajñaḥ yat punāti iti
translated: Since this (Agni) purifies everything, therefore this very thing is a sacrifice, namely, purification.

original: tasyāsyaivaṃ viśiṣṭasya yajñasya vākca mantroccāraṇe vyāpṛtā /
analyzed: tasya asya evam viśiṣṭasya yajñasya vāc ca mantra uccāraṇe vyāpṛtā
translated: Of this sacrifice, which is thus distinguished, speech is engaged in the utterance of mantras,

analyzed: manaḥ ca yathā bhūta artha jñāne vyāpṛtam
translated: and the mind is engaged in the knowledge of things as they are.

original: te ete vāṅmanase vartanī mārgau yābhyāṃ yajñastāyamānaḥ pravartate te vartanī /
analyzed: te ete vāc manase vartanī mārgau yābhyām yajñaḥ tāyamānaḥ pravartate te vartanī
translated: These two, speech and mind, are the paths, the courses, by which the sacrifice, being performed, proceeds. They are the courses.

original: prāṇāpānaparicalanavatyā hivācaścittasya cottarottarakramo yadyajñaḥiti hi śrutyantaram /
analyzed: prāṇa apāna paricalanavatyāḥ hi vācaḥ cittasya ca uttarottara kramaḥ yat yajñaḥ iti hi śruti antaram
translated: For in another scriptural passage it is said that the sacrifice consists of the successive order of speech and mind, which are characterized by the movement of the exhaled and inhaled breath.

original: ato vāṅmanasābhyāṃ yajño vartata iti vāṅmanase vartanī ucyete yajñasya //
analyzed: atas vāc manasābhyām yajñaḥ vartate iti vāc manase vartanī ucyete yajñasya
translated: Therefore, the sacrifice proceeds by speech and mind. Thus, speech and mind are said to be the courses of the sacrifice.

analyzed: tayoḥ anyatarām manasā saṃskaroti brahmā
translated: The Brahman priest perfects one of these by the mind.

analyzed: vācā hotā adhvaryuḥ udgātā anyatarām
translated: The Hotṛ, Adhvaryu, and Udgātṛ priests perfect the other by speech.

original: sa yatropākṛte prātaranuvāke purā paridhānīyāyā brahmā vyavavadati //
analyzed: sa yatra upākṛte prātaranuvāke purā paridhānīyāyāḥ brahmā vyavavadati
translated: When, after the morning recitation has been begun, before the Paridhānīya verse, the Brahman priest speaks,

analyzed: anyatarām eva vartanīm saṃskaroti
translated: he perfects only one course.

analyzed: hīyate nyatarā
translated: The other is lost.

original: sa yathaikapād vrajan ratho vaikena cakreṇa vartamāno riṣyaty evam asya yajño riṣyati /
analyzed: sa yathā eka pād vrajan rathaḥ vā ekena cakreṇa vartamānaḥ riṣyati evam asya yajñaḥ riṣyati
translated: Just as one who walks on one foot or a chariot that moves on one wheel is injured, so is his sacrifice injured.

analyzed: yajñam riṣyantam yajamānaḥ nu riṣyati
translated: The sacrificer perishes after the sacrifice has perished.

analyzed: saḥ iṣṭvā pāpīyān bhavati
translated: Having performed the sacrifice, he becomes worse off.

analyzed: tayoḥ vartanyoḥ anyatarām vartanīm manasā viveka jñānavatā saṃskaroti
translated: Of those two paths, he prepares one path mentally, with the knowledge of discrimination.

analyzed: brahmā ṛtvij vācā vartanyā hotā adhvaryuḥ udgātā iti ete trayaḥ pi ṛtvijaḥ nyatarām vāc lakṣaṇām
translated: The Brahman priest, with the path of speech, the Hotṛ, the Adhvaryu, and the Udgātṛ - these three priests prepare one path characterized by speech.

analyzed: vartanīm vācā eva saṃskurvanti
translated: They refine that path of speech itself.

original: tatraivaṃ sati vāṅmanase vartanī saṃskārye yajñe /
analyzed: tatra evam sati vāc manase vartanī saṃskārye yajñe
translated: In that case, in the sacrifice, the paths of speech and mind are to be refined.

original: atha sa brahmā yatra yasminkāla upākṛte prārabdhe prātaranuvāke śasre purā pūrvaṃ🔽paridhānīyāyā ṛco brahmaitasminnantare kāle vyavavadati maunaṃ parityajati yadi tadānyatarāmeva
analyzed: atha sa brahmā yatra yasmin kāle upākṛte prārabdhe prātaranuvāke śasre purā pūrvam  paridhānīyāyāḥ ṛcaḥ brahmā etasmin antare kāle vyavavadati maunam parityajati yadi tadā anyatarām eva
translated: Then that Brahman, at that time when the Prātaranuvāka has been begun, before the Paridhānīya Ṛc,🔽if he speaks, if he breaks his silence, then he prepares only one path of speech.

original: vāagvartanīṃ saṃskaroti brahmaṇāsaṃskriyamāṇā manovartanī hīyate vinaśyati cchidrībhavatyanyatarā /
analyzed: vāak vartanīm saṃskaroti brahmaṇā a saṃskriyamāṇā manaḥ vartanī hīyate vinaśyati chidrībhavati anyatarā
translated: The path of mind, which is not being prepared by the Brahman, is lost, destroyed, becomes defective. One of the two is lost.

analyzed: sa yajñaḥ vāc vartanyā eva anyatarayā vartitum a śaknuvan riṣyati
translated: That sacrifice, being unable to proceed with only one path of speech, perishes.

analyzed: katham iva iti āha
translated: How is it so? He says:

analyzed: sa yathā eka pād puruṣaḥ brajan gacchan adhvānam riṣyati
translated: As a man on one foot, walking, goes along, is liable to stumble,

original: ratho vaikena cakreṇa vartamāno gacchanriṣyatyevamasya yajamānasya kubrahmaṇā yajño riṣyati vinaśyati /
analyzed: rathaḥ vā ekena cakreṇa vartamānaḥ gacchan riṣyati evam asya yajamānasya ku brahmaṇā yajñaḥ riṣyati vinaśyati
translated: so is this sacrificer's sacrifice liable to stumble, to perish, through bad Brahman-power,

analyzed: yajñam riṣyantam yajamānaḥ riṣyati
translated: and the sacrificer is liable to stumble when the sacrifice stumbles.

analyzed: yajña prāṇaḥ hi yajamānaḥ
translated: For the sacrificer is the life of the sacrifice.

analyzed: atas yuktaḥ yajña reṣe reṣaḥ tasya
translated: Therefore, it is proper that the sacrificer should stumble when the sacrifice stumbles.

original: sa taṃ yajñamiṣṭvā tādṛśaṃ pāpīyānpāpataro bhavati //
analyzed: sa tam yajñam iṣṭvā tādṛśam pāpīyān pāpataraḥ bhavati
translated: Having performed that sacrifice, he becomes worse, more sinful, than before.

original: atha yatra upākṛte prātaranuvāke na purā paridhānīyāyā brahmā vyavavadaty ubhe eva vartanī saṃskurvanti /
analyzed: atha yatra upākṛte prātaranuvāke na purā paridhānīyāyāḥ brahmā vyavavadati ubhe eva vartanī saṃskurvanti
translated: Now, when the morning recitation has been begun, and the Brahman does not speak before the final verse, they both prepare the paths.

analyzed: na hīyate nyatarā
translated: Neither is left out.

original: sa yathobhayapād vrajan ratho vobhābhyāṃ cakrābhyāṃ vartamānaḥ pratitiṣṭhaty evam asya yajñaḥ pratitiṣṭhati yajñaṃ pratitiṣṭhantaṃ yajamāno
analyzed: sa yathā ubhaya pād vrajan rathaḥ vā ubhābhyām cakrābhyām vartamānaḥ pratitiṣṭhati evam asya yajñaḥ pratitiṣṭhati yajñam pratitiṣṭhantam yajamānaḥ
translated: As one walking on both feet, or a chariot moving on both wheels, stands firm, so does his sacrifice stand firm. When the sacrifice stands firm, the sacrificer

analyzed: nu pratitiṣṭhati
translated: stands firm after it.

analyzed: saḥ iṣṭvā śreyān bhavati
translated: Having performed (the sacrifice), he becomes better.

original: atha punaryatra brahmā vidvānmaunaṃ parigṛhya vāgvisargamakurvanvartate
analyzed: atha punar yatra brahmā vidvān maunam parigṛhya vāgvisargam akurvan vartate
translated: Now, when the Brahman, being learned, observes silence, not uttering speech,

original: yāvatparidhānīyāyā na vyavavadati tathaiva sarvartvija ubhe eva vartanī saṃskurvanti
analyzed: yāvat paridhānīyāyāḥ na vyavavadati tathā eva sarva ṛtvijaḥ ubhe eva vartanī saṃskurvanti
translated: As long as the Parivaja is not recited, in the same way all the priests refine both paths.

analyzed: na hīyate nyatarā api
translated: Not even one is left out.

analyzed: kim iva iti āha
translated: What is it like? He says:

analyzed: pūrva ukta viparītau dṛṣṭāntau
translated: The two examples are the opposite of what was said before.

original: evamasya yajamānasya yajñaḥ svavartanībhyāṃ vartamānaḥ pratitiṣṭhati svenā'tmanāvinaśyanvartata ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: evam asya yajamānasya yajñaḥ sva vartanībhyām vartamānaḥ pratitiṣṭhati svena ātmanā a vinaśyan vartate iti arthaḥ
translated: Thus, the sacrifice of this sacrificer, proceeding by its own paths, stands firm. The meaning is that it continues without being destroyed by itself.

original: yajñaṃ pratitiṣṭhantaṃ yajamāno 'nupratitiṣṭhati sa yajamāna evaṃ maunavijñānavadbrahmopetaṃ yajñamiṣṭvā śreyānbhavati śreṣṭho bhavatītyarthaḥ
analyzed: yajñam pratitiṣṭhantam yajamānaḥ nupratitiṣṭhati sa yajamānaḥ evam mauna vijñānavat brahma upetam yajñam iṣṭvā śreyān bhavati śreṣṭhaḥ bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: The sacrificer stands firm following the sacrifice that stands firm. He, the sacrificer, having performed the sacrifice endowed with the knowledge of silence and Brahman, becomes better, becomes the best, is the meaning.

analyzed: iti chāndogya upaniṣadi caturtha adhyāyasya ṣoḍaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixteenth section in the fourth chapter of the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

analyzed: prajāpatiḥ lokān abhyatapat
translated: Prajāpati scorched the worlds.

analyzed: teṣām tapyamānānām rasān prāvṛhat
translated: From them, while being scorched, he extracted their essences.

analyzed: agnim pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Fire from the earth.

analyzed: vāyum antarikṣāt
translated: Wind from the atmosphere.

analyzed: ādityam divaḥ
translated: The sun from the sky.

original: atra brahmaṇo maunaṃ vihitaṃ tadreṣe brahmatvakarmaṇi cānyasmiṃśca
analyzed: atra brahmaṇaḥ maunam vihitam tad reṣe brahmatva karmaṇi ca anyasmin ca
translated: Here, the silence of Brahman is enjoined. That is for the purpose of the act of being Brahman and for something else.

original: hotrādikarmareṣe vyāhṛtihomaḥ prāyaścittamiti tadarthaṃ vyāhṛtayo vidhātavyā ityāhaprajāpatirlokānabhyatapallokānuddiśya
analyzed: hotṛ ādi karma reṣe vyāhṛti homaḥ prāyaścittam iti tad artham vyāhṛtayaḥ vidhātavyāḥ iti āha prajāpatiḥ lokān abhyatapat lokān uddiśya
translated: In the performance of the duties of the Hotṛ priest and others, the Vyāhṛti oblation is the expiation. For that purpose, the Vyāhṛtis should be enjoined. He says: Prajāpati tormented the worlds, with reference to the worlds.

analyzed: tatra sāra jighṛkṣayā dhyāna lakṣaṇam tapaḥ cacāra
translated: There, with the desire to extract the essence, he practiced meditation, which is characterized by austerity.

analyzed: teṣām tapyamānānām lokānām rasān sāra rūpān prāvṛhat uddhṛtavān jagrāha iti arthaḥ
translated: From those worlds that were being tormented, he extracted the essences, which are in the form of essence, he grasped, means he took.

analyzed: kān
translated: Which ones?

analyzed: agnim rasam pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Fire, the essence of earth.

analyzed: vāyum antarikṣāt
translated: Wind, from the atmosphere.

analyzed: ādityam divaḥ
translated: The sun, from heaven.

analyzed: saḥ etāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ abhyatapat
translated: He tormented those three deities.

analyzed: tāsām tapyamānānām rasān prāvṛhat
translated: From them, while being tormented, he extracted the essences.

analyzed: agneḥ ṛcaḥ
translated: From fire, the Ṛks.

analyzed: vāyoḥ yajūṃṣi
translated: From wind, the Yajus.

analyzed: sāmāni ādityāt
translated: From the sun, the Sāmans.

analyzed: punar api evam evam agni ādyāḥ saḥ etāḥ tisraḥ devatāḥ uddiśya abhyatapat
translated: Again, in the same way, Agni and others, he tormented those three deities, with reference to them.

analyzed: sāram rasam trayī vidyām jagrāha
translated: From them also, he grasped the essence, the essence of the three Vedas.

analyzed: saḥ etām trayīm vidyām abhyatapat
translated: He tormented that threefold knowledge.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tapyamānāyāḥ rasān prāvṛhat
translated: From it, while being tormented, he extracted the essences.

analyzed: bhūḥ iti ṛgbhyaḥ
translated: Bhūḥ, from the Ṛks.

analyzed: bhuvar iti yajurbhyaḥ
translated: Bhuvaḥ, from the Yajus.

analyzed: svar iti sāmabhyaḥ
translated: Svaḥ, from the Sāmans.

original: tad yady ṛkto riṣyed bhūḥ svāheti gārhapatye juhuyāt /
analyzed: tat yadi ṛktaḥ riṣyet bhūḥ svāhā iti gārhapatye juhuyāt
translated: If it should be spoiled by a Ṛk verse, one should offer into the Gārhapatya fire with the formula, Bhūḥ svāhā.

original: ṛcām eva tadrasenarcāṃ vīryeṇarcāṃ yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti //
analyzed: ṛcām eva tat rasena ṛcām vīryeṇa ṛcām yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: By the essence of the Ṛk verses, by the power of the Ṛk verses, he joins together the broken part of the sacrifice.

analyzed: saḥ etām punar abhyatapat trayīm vidyām
translated: He again heated that Triad of Learning.

analyzed: tasyāḥ tapyamānāyāḥ rasam bhūḥ iti vyāhṛtim ṛgbhyaḥ jagrāha
translated: From it, while being heated, it grasped the Vyāhṛti Bhūḥ as the essence of the Ṛk verses.

analyzed: bhuvar iti vyāhṛtim yajurbhyaḥ
translated: The Vyāhṛti Bhuvaḥ from the Yajus verses.

analyzed: svar iti vyāhṛtim sāmabhyaḥ
translated: The Vyāhṛti Svaḥ from the Sāman verses.

analyzed: atas eva loka deva veda rasāḥ mahāvyāhṛtayāḥ
translated: For this very reason, the Mahāvyāhṛtis are the essence of the worlds, gods, and Vedas.

original: atastattatra yajñe yadyṛkta ṛksambandhādṛṅnimittaṃ riṣyedyajñaḥ kṣataṃ prāpnuyādbhūḥ svāheti gārhapatye juhuyāt /
analyzed: atas tat tatra yajñe yadi ṛktaḥ ṛc sambandhāt ṛc nimittam riṣyet yajñaḥ kṣatam prāpnuyāt bhūḥ svāhā iti gārhapatye juhuyāt
translated: Therefore, in that sacrifice, if the sacrifice should be spoiled by a Ṛk verse, if the sacrifice should be damaged due to a connection with a Ṛk verse, one should offer into the Gārhapatya fire with the formula, Bhūḥ svāhā.

analyzed: sā tatra prāyaścittiḥ
translated: That is the expiation there.

analyzed: katham ṝcām eva tat iti kriyā viśeṣaṇam
translated: How? That is by the essence of the Ṛk verses, this qualifies the action.

original: rasenarcāṃ vīryeṇaujasarcāṃ yajñasya ṛksambandhino yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ vicchinnaṃ kṣatarūpamutpannaṃ sandadhāti pratisandhatte //
analyzed: rasena ṛcām vīryeṇa ojasā ṛcām yajñasya ṛk sambandhinaḥ yajñasya viriṣṭam vicchinnam kṣata rūpam utpannam sandadhāti pratisandhatte
translated: By the power, by the vigor of the Ṛk verses, he joins together, he restores, the broken part, the damaged part that has arisen, of the sacrifice connected with the Ṛk verses, of the Ṛk-related sacrifice.

original: atha yadi yajuṣṭo riṣyed bhuvaḥ svāheti dakṣiṇāgnau juhuyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi yajuṣṭaḥ riṣyet bhuvaḥ svāhā iti dakṣiṇāgnau juhuyāt
translated: If it should be spoiled by a Yajus verse, one should offer into the Dakṣiṇāgni fire with the formula, Bhuvaḥ svāhā.

original: yajuṣām eva tadrasena yajuṣāṃ vīryeṇa yajuṣāṃ yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti //
analyzed: yajuṣām eva tat rasena yajuṣām vīryeṇa yajuṣām yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: By the essence of the Yajus, by the vigour of the Yajus, he joins together the broken part of the sacrifice with the Yajus.

original: atha yadi sāmato riṣyet svaḥ svāhety āhavanīye juhuyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi sāmataḥ riṣyet svar svāhā iti āhavanīye juhuyāt
translated: If he should fail in the Saman, he should offer on the Ahavaniya with 'Svahā to Svah.'

original: sāmnām eva tadrasena sāmnāṃ vīryeṇa sāmnāṃ yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti //
analyzed: sāmnām eva tat rasena sāmnām vīryeṇa sāmnām yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: By the essence of the Saman, by the vigour of the Saman, he joins together the broken part of the sacrifice with the Saman.

original: atha yadi yajuṣṭo yajurnimittaṃ riṣyedbhuvaḥ svāheti dakṣiṇāgnau juhuyāt /
analyzed: atha yadi yajuṣṭaḥ yajuḥ nimittam riṣyet bhuvaḥ svāhā iti dakṣiṇāgnau juhuyāt
translated: If he should fail in the Yajus, in what is indicated by the Yajus, he should offer on the Dakshina fire with 'Bhuvaḥ svāhā.'

original: tathā sāmanimitte reṣe svaḥ svāhetyāhavanīye juhuyāt /
analyzed: tathā sāma nimitte reṣe svar svāhā iti āhavanīye juhuyāt
translated: Similarly, if he fails in what is indicated by the Saman, he should offer on the Ahavaniya with 'Svahā to Svah.'

original: tathā pūrvavadyajñaṃ sandadhāti /🔽brahmanimitte tu reṣe triṣvagniṣu /
analyzed: tathā pūrva vat yajñam sandadhāti  brahma nimitte tu reṣe triṣu agniṣu
translated: In the same way, he joins together the sacrifice as before.🔽But if he fails in what is indicated by the Brahman, in the three fires,

analyzed: tisṛbhiḥ vyāhṛtibhiḥ juhuyāt
translated: he should offer with the three Vyāhṛtis.

analyzed: trayyāḥ hi vidyāyāḥ sa reṣaḥ
translated: For that is the failure of the threefold knowledge.

original: atha kena brahmatvamityanayaiva trayyā vidyayāiti śruteḥ /
analyzed: atha kena brahmatvam iti anayā eva trayyā vidyayā iti śruteḥ
translated: Now, by what is Brahmanhood? By this very threefold knowledge, according to the Śruti.

analyzed: nyāya antaram vā mṛgyam brahmatva nimitte reṣe
translated: Or another method of reasoning should be sought for in the case of failure in what is indicated by Brahmanhood.

analyzed: tat yathā lavaṇena suvarṇam saṃdadhyāt
translated: As if he were to join gold with salt,

original: suvarṇena rajataṃ rajatena trapu trapuṇā sīsaṃ sīsena lohaṃ lohena dāru dāru carmaṇā //
analyzed: suvarṇena rajatam rajatena trapu trapuṇā sīsam sīsena loham lohena dāru dāru carmaṇā
translated: gold with silver, silver with tin, tin with lead, lead with iron, iron with wood, and wood with skin.

original: evam eṣāṃ lokānām āsāṃ devatānām asyās trayyā vidyāyā vīryeṇa yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ saṃdadhāti /
analyzed: evam eṣām lokānām āsām devatānām asyāḥ trayyāḥ vidyāyāḥ vīryeṇa yajñasya viriṣṭam saṃdadhāti
translated: In this way, by the power of these worlds, of these deities, of this threefold science, he joins together the broken parts of the sacrifice.

original: bheṣajakṛto ha vā eṣa yajño yatraivaṃvid brahmā bhavati //
analyzed: bheṣaja kṛtaḥ ha vai eṣa yajñaḥ yatra evaṃvid brahmā bhavati
translated: For this sacrifice is indeed healed, where there is a Brahman priest who knows thus.

analyzed: tat yathā lavaṇena suvarṇam sandadhyāt
translated: Just as one would join gold with gold,

analyzed: kṣāreṇa ṭaṅkaṇa ādinā khare
translated: iron with iron,

analyzed: mṛdu tva karam hi tat
translated: for that makes it soft.

analyzed: suvarṇena rajatam aśakya sandhānam sandadhyāt
translated: One would join silver, which cannot be joined, with gold.

original: rajatena tathā trapu trapuṇā sīsaṃ sīsena loha lohena dāru dāru carmaṇā carmabandhanena /
analyzed: rajatena tathā trapu trapuṇā sīsam sīsena loha lohena dāru dāru carmaṇā carma bandhanena
translated: In the same way, tin with silver, lead with tin, iron with lead, wood with iron, and leather with wood.

original: evameṣāṃ lokānāmāsāṃ devatānāmasyāsrayyā vidyāyā vīryeṇa rasākhyenaujasā yajñasya viriṣṭaṃ sandadhāti /
analyzed: evam eṣām lokānām āsām devatānām asya asrayyāḥ vidyāyāḥ vīryeṇa rasa ākhyena ojasā yajñasya viriṣṭam sandadhāti
translated: In the same way, by the power of these worlds, of these deities, of this threefold science, called the essence or vital force, he joins together the broken parts of the sacrifice.

analyzed: bheṣaja kṛtaḥ ha vai eṣa yajñaḥ
translated: For this sacrifice is indeed healed.

original: rogārta iva pumāṃścikitsakena suśikṣitenaiṣa yajño bhavati /
analyzed: roga ārtaḥ iva pumān cikitsakena su śikṣitena eṣa yajñaḥ bhavati
translated: Like a man afflicted with disease, this sacrifice is well-trained by a skilled physician.

analyzed: kaḥ sau
translated: Who is that?

analyzed: yatra yasmin yajñe evaṃvid yathā ukta vyāhṛti homa prāyaścitta vid brahmā ṛtvij bhavati sa yajñaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that this sacrifice is where there is a Brahman priest who knows thus, who knows the expiation of the Vyahṛti oblations as described.

original: eṣa ha vā udakpravaṇo yajño yatraivaṃvid brahmā bhavati /
analyzed: eṣa ha vai udak pravaṇaḥ yajñaḥ yatra evaṃvid brahmā bhavati
translated: This sacrifice, indeed, slopes towards the north, where there is a Brahman who is thus.

original: evaṃvidaṃ ha vā eṣā brahmāṇam anu gāthā /
analyzed: evaṃvidam ha vai eṣā brahmāṇam anu gāthā
translated: This verse, indeed, is addressed to the Brahman who is thus.

original: yato yata āvartate tat tad gacchati //
analyzed: yatas yatas āvartate tat tat gacchati
translated: From whatever direction the sacrifice turns, to that direction it goes.

original: kiñcaiṣa ha vā udakpravaṇa udaṅnimno dakṣiṇocchrāyo yajño bhavati /
analyzed: kiñca eṣa ha vai udak pravaṇaḥ udak nimnaḥ dakṣiṇa ucchrāyaḥ yajñaḥ bhavati
translated: And this, indeed, is the sacrifice which slopes towards the north, which slopes towards the north, which rises towards the south.

analyzed: uttara mārga pratipatti hetuḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is the cause of attaining the northern path.

original: yatraivaṃvidbrahmā bhavatyevaṃvidaṃ ha vai brahmāṇamṛtvijaṃ pratyeṣānugāthā brahmaṇaḥ stutiparā /
analyzed: yatra evaṃvid brahmā bhavati evaṃvidam ha vai brahmāṇam ṛtvijam prati eṣā anugāthā brahmaṇaḥ stuti parā
