analyzed: te darśana varjita tvāt dhūmam dhūma abhimāninīm devatām abhisambhavanti pratipadyante
translated: They, being devoid of knowledge, attain the deity of smoke, the deity identified with smoke.

original: tayātivāhitā dhūmādrātriṃ rātridevatāṃ rātredevatāṃ rātreraparapakṣadevatāmeva kṛṣṇapakṣābhimāninīmaparapakṣādyānṣaṇmāsāndakṣiṇā dakṣiṇāṃ daśameti
analyzed: tayā ativāhitā dhūmāt rātrim rātri devatām rātre devatām rātreḥ aparapakṣa devatām eva kṛṣṇapakṣa abhimāninīm aparapakṣāt yān ṣaṭ māsān dakṣiṇā dakṣiṇām daśamā iti
translated: Carried by that, from smoke they go to night, the deity of night, the deity of the night, the deity of the dark fortnight, the deity identified with the dark fortnight. From the dark fortnight, for six months, they go to the south,

analyzed: savitā  tān māsān dakṣiṇāyana ṣaṣ māsa abhimāninīḥ devatāḥ pratipadyante iti arthaḥ
translated: the sun.🔽The meaning is that they attain the deities identified with the six months of the southern solstice.

original: saṅghacāriṇyo hi ṣaṇmāsadevatā iti māsāniti bahuvacanaprayogastāsu naite karmiṇaḥ
analyzed: saṅgha cāriṇyaḥ hi ṣaṣ māsa devatāḥ iti māsān iti bahuvacana prayogaḥ tāsu na ete karmiṇaḥ
translated: For the deities of the six months move in a group. Therefore, the plural māsa is used for them. These performers of rituals

analyzed: prakṛtāḥ saṃvatsaram saṃvatsarasya hi ekasya avayava bhūte dakṣiṇa uttarāyaṇe tatra arciḥ ādi mārga pravṛttānām udagayana māsebhyaḥ
translated: The topic under discussion is the year, for the northern and southern courses are parts of the year. There, for those engaged in the path beginning with light in the northern course, the months are the days.

original: 'vayavinaḥ saṃvatsarasya prāptiruktā /🔽ata ihāpi tadavayavabhūtānāṃ dakṣiṇāyanamāsānāṃ praptiṃ śrutvā tadavayavinaḥ saṃvatsarasyāpi
analyzed: vayavinaḥ saṃvatsarasya prāptiḥ uktā  atas iha api tad avayava bhūtānām dakṣiṇāyana māsānām praptim śrutvā tad avayavinaḥ saṃvatsarasya api
translated: The topic under discussion is the year, for the northern and southern solstices are parts of the year, and it has been said that those who proceed on the path beginning with light reach the year, which is the whole, in more than six months.

analyzed: pūrva vat praptiḥ āpannā iti atas tad prāptiḥ pratiṣidhyate na ete saṃvatsaram abhiprāpnuvanti iti
translated: Therefore, having heard the attainment of the months, which are parts of that, the attainment of the year, which is the whole, is also implied, as before. Thus, the attainment of that is being denied: They do not reach the year.

analyzed: māsebhyaḥ pitṛ lokam
translated: From the months to the world of the ancestors.

analyzed: pitṛ lokāt ākāśam
translated: From the world of the ancestors to space.

analyzed: ākāsāt candramasam
translated: From space to the moon.

analyzed: eṣa somaḥ rājā  tat devānām annam
translated: This is King Soma.🔽That is the food of the gods.

analyzed: tam devāḥ bhakṣayanti
translated: The gods eat that.

analyzed: māsebhyaḥ pitṛ lokam pitṛ lokāt ākāśam ākāśāt candramasam
translated: From the months to the world of the ancestors, from the world of the ancestors to space, from space to the moon.

original: ko 'sau yastaiḥ prāpyate candramā ya eṣa dṛśyate 'ntarikṣe somo rājā brāhmaṇānāṃ /
analyzed: kaḥ sau yaḥ taiḥ prāpyate candramāḥ yaḥ eṣa dṛśyate ntarikṣe somaḥ rājā brāhmaṇānām
translated: What is that which is reached by them, the moon that is seen in the sky, King Soma of the Brahmins.

original: tadannaṃ devānāṃ taṃ candramasamannaṃ devā indrādayo bhakṣayanti /
analyzed: tat annam devānām tam candramasam annam devāḥ indra ādayaḥ bhakṣayanti
translated: That is the food of the gods, and the gods, Indra and others, eat that moon-food.

original: ataste dhūmādinā gatvā candrabhūtāḥ karmiṇo devairbhakṣyante /
analyzed: atas te dhūma ādinā gatvā candra bhūtāḥ karmiṇaḥ devaiḥ bhakṣyante
translated: Therefore, the performers of actions, having gone by smoke etc. and become the moon, are eaten by the gods.

analyzed: nanu anarthāya iṣṭa ādi karaṇam yadi anna bhūtāḥ devaiḥ bhakṣyeran
translated: If they were to be eaten by the gods without becoming food, the performance of sacrifices etc. would be useless.

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

analyzed: annam iti upakaraṇa mātrasya vivakṣita tvāt
translated: Because only a mere instrument is intended by the word food.

analyzed: na hi te kavala utkṣepeṇa devaiḥ bhakṣyante
translated: They are not eaten by the gods by throwing morsels into their mouths.

original: kiṃ tarhyupakaraṇamātraṃ devānāṃ bhavanti te strīpaśubhṛtyādivat /
analyzed: kim tarhi upakaraṇa mātram devānām bhavanti te strī paśu bhṛtya ādi vat
translated: Rather, they become mere instruments for the gods, like women, cattle, servants, etc.

original: dṛṣṭaścānnaśabda upakaraṇeṣustriyo 'nnaṃ paśavo 'nnaṃ viśāṃ viśo 'nnaṃ rājñām ityādi /
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ ca anna śabdaḥ upakaraṇa iṣu striyaḥ nnam paśavaḥ nnam viśām viśaḥ nnam rājñām ityādi
translated: And the word food is seen to refer to instruments in such passages as women are food, cattle are food, the Vaisyas are food for the kings, etc.

original: na ca teṣāṃ stryādīnāṃ puruṣopabhogyatve 'pyupabhogo nāsti /
analyzed: na ca teṣām strī ādīnām puruṣa upabhogya tve pi upabhogaḥ na asti
translated: And even though those women and others are to be enjoyed by men, they are not without enjoyment themselves.

original: tasmātkarmiṇo devānāmupabhogyā api santaḥ sukhino devaiḥ krīḍanti /
analyzed: tasmāt karmiṇaḥ devānām upabhogyāḥ api santaḥ sukhinaḥ devaiḥ krīḍanti
translated: Therefore, the performers of actions, though they are to be enjoyed by the gods, are happy and play with the gods.

original: śarīraṃ ca teṣāṃ sukhopabhogayogyaṃ candramaṇḍala āpyamārabhyate /
analyzed: śarīram ca teṣām sukha upabhoga yogyam candra maṇḍale āpyam ārabhyate
translated: And their body, fit for the enjoyment of happiness, is produced from the water obtained in the lunar sphere.

original: taduktaṃ purastācchraddhāśabdā āpo dyulokāgnau hutāḥ somo rājā sambhavatīti /
analyzed: tat uktam purastāt śraddhā śabdāḥ āpaḥ dyu loka agnau hutāḥ somaḥ rājā sambhavati iti
translated: This has been stated earlier: The waters called faith, offered into the fire of the heavenly world, become King Soma.

original: tā āpaḥ karmasamavāyinya itaraiśca bhūtairanugatā dyulokaṃ prāpya candratvamāpannāḥ śarīrādyārambhikā iṣṭādyupāsakānāṃ bhavanti /
analyzed: tāḥ āpaḥ karma samavāyinyaḥ itaraiḥ ca bhūtaiḥ anugatāḥ dyu lokam prāpya candra tvam āpannāḥ śarīra ādi ārambhikāḥ iṣṭa ādi upāsakānām bhavanti
translated: Those waters, which are associated with the ritual and are followed by the other elements, reach the heavenly world and attain the state of the moon, and become the material cause of the body for those who worship through sacrifices and other means.

original: antyāyāṃ ca śarīrāhutāvagnau hutāyāmagninā dahyamāne śarīre tadutthā āpo dhūmena
analyzed: antyāyām ca śarīra āhutau agnau hutāyām agninā dahyamāne śarīre tad utthāḥ āpaḥ dhūmena
translated: And in the final oblation of the body, when the body is being burned by the fire, those waters arise along with the smoke,

original: sahordhvaṃ yajamānamāveṣṭya candramaṇḍalaṃ prāpya kuśamṛttikāsthānīyā bāhyaśarīrārambhikā bhavanti /
analyzed: saha ūrdhvam yajamānam āveṣṭya candra maṇḍalam prāpya kuśa mṛttikā sthānīyāḥ bāhya śarīra ārambhikāḥ bhavanti
translated: envelop the sacrificer above, reach the lunar sphere, and become the material cause of the external body, like the kuśa grass and clay.

analyzed: tad ārabdhena ca śarīreṇa iṣṭa ādi phalam upabhuñjānāḥ āsate
translated: And they remain there, enjoying the fruits of sacrifices and other acts through the body produced from that.

original: tasmin yavātsaṃpātam uṣitvāthaitam evādhvānaṃ punar nivartante /
analyzed: tasmin yavātsaṃpātam uṣitvā atha etam eva adhvānam punar nivartante
translated: Having dwelt there until the exhaustion of the barley, they then return along the same path.

analyzed: ākāśam
translated: From the sky.

analyzed: ākāśāt vāyum  vāyuḥ bhūtvā dhūmaḥ bhavati
translated: From the sky to the wind.🔽Having become wind, it becomes smoke.

analyzed: dhūmaḥ bhūtvā abhram bhavati
translated: Having become smoke, it becomes a cloud.

original: yāvattadupabhoganimittasya karmaṇaḥ kṣayaḥ sampatanti yeneti sampātaḥ karmaṇaḥ kṣayo yāvatsampātaṃ yāvatkarmaṇaḥ kṣaya ityarthaḥ
analyzed: yāvat tad upabhoga nimittasya karmaṇaḥ kṣayaḥ sampatanti yena iti sampātaḥ karmaṇaḥ kṣayaḥ yāvat sampātam yāvat karmaṇaḥ kṣayaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: As long as the exhaustion of the karma that is the cause of that enjoyment, they descend. Sampāta means the exhaustion of karma. Yāvat sampātam means as long as the exhaustion of karma.

analyzed: tāvat tasmin candra maṇḍale uṣitvā atha anantaram etam eva vakṣyamāṇam adhvānam mārgam punar nivartnate
translated: Then, having stayed in that lunar sphere, they subsequently return to this very path that will be mentioned.

original: punarnivartanta iti prayogātpūrvamapyasakṛccandramaṇḍalaṃ gatā nivṛttāścā'sanniti gamyate /
analyzed: punar nivartante iti prayogāt pūrvam api asakṛt candra maṇḍalam gatāḥ nivṛttāḥ ca āsan iti gamyate
translated: From the usage of return, it is understood that they have gone to the lunar sphere and returned many times before as well.

analyzed: tasmāt iha loke iṣṭa ādi karma upacitya candram gacchanti
translated: Therefore, here in this world, having accumulated the karma of desired actions, they go to the moon.

analyzed: tad kṣaye ca āvartante
translated: And when that [karma] is exhausted, they return.

analyzed: kṣaṇa mātram api tatra sthātum na labhyate
translated: They do not obtain to stay there even for a moment.

analyzed: sthiti nimitta karma kṣayāt
translated: Because the karma that is the cause of abiding is exhausted.

analyzed: sneha kṣayāt iva pradīpasya
translated: Like the exhaustion of oil in a lamp.

original: tatra kiṃ yena karmaṇā candramaṇḍalamārūḍhastasya sarvasya kṣaye tasmādavarohaṇaṃ kiṃ vā sāvaśeṣa iti /
analyzed: tatra kim yena karmaṇā candra maṇḍalam ārūḍhaḥ tasya sarvasya kṣaye tasmāt avarohaṇam kim vā sa avaśeṣaḥ iti
translated: There, is it that all of the karma by which one has ascended to the lunar sphere is exhausted, and one descends from there? Or is it with a remainder?

analyzed: kim tatas
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: yadi sarvasyaiva kṣayaḥ karmaṇaścandramaṇḍalasthasyaiva mokṣaḥ prāpnoti /
analyzed: yadi sarvasya eva kṣayaḥ karmaṇaḥ candra maṇḍala sthasya eva mokṣaḥ prāpnoti
translated: If all of the karma of one who is in the lunar sphere is exhausted, then liberation would occur right there.

analyzed: tiṣṭhatu tāvat tatra eva mokṣaḥ syāt na vā iti
translated: Let us leave aside for now whether liberation would occur there or not.

analyzed: tatas āgatasya iha śarīra upabhoga ādi na sambhavati
translated: For one who has come from there, the experience of a body and so on is not possible here.

analyzed: tatas śeṣeṇa ityādi smṛti virodhaḥ ca syāt
translated: And there would be a contradiction with the smrti that says by the remainder of that and so on.

analyzed: nanu iṣṭāpūrta datta vyatirekeṇa api manuṣya loke śarīra upabhoga nimittāni karmāṇi anekāni sambhavanti
translated: But apart from the rites for the dead and the rites for the gods, there are many other actions in the human world that are the cause of experiencing the body.

analyzed: na ca teṣām candra maṇḍale upabhogaḥ
translated: And they do not experience those [fruits] in the lunar realm.

analyzed: atas kṣīṇāni tāni
translated: Therefore, those [fruits] are not exhausted.

analyzed: yad nimitam candra maṇḍalam ārūḍhaḥ tāni eva kṣīṇāni iti avirodhaḥ
translated: And the cause for which one ascends to the lunar realm, those [fruits] are exhausted. There is no contradiction.

analyzed: śeṣa śabdaḥ ca sarveṣām karma tva sāmānyāt aviruddhaḥ
translated: And the word remainder is not contradictory, because all [fruits] are the same in being actions.

original: ata eva ca tatraiva mokṣaḥ syāditi doṣābhāvaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva ca tatra eva mokṣaḥ syāt iti doṣa abhāvaḥ
translated: And for this very reason, there is no fault in saying that liberation would be [attained] right there [in the lunar realm].

analyzed: viruddha aneka yoni upabhoga phalānām ca karmaṇām ekaikasya jantoḥ ārambhaka tva sambhavāt
translated: And because it is possible for the actions that have the fruits of experiencing many different wombs, which are mutually contradictory, to be the cause of the origination of each individual being.

analyzed: na ca ekasmin janmani sarva karmaṇām kṣayaḥ upapadyate
translated: And the exhaustion of all actions in one birth is not reasonable.

analyzed: brahmahatyā ādeḥ ca ekaikasya karmaṇaḥ neka janma ārambhaka tva smaraṇāt  sthāvara ādi prāptānām ca atyanta mūḍhānām utkarmaṣa hetoḥ karmaṇaḥ ārambhaka tva asambhavāt
translated: And because it is remembered that each action such as killing a Brahmin is the cause of the origination of many births.🔽And because it is not possible for the actions that are the cause of the origination of the extremely dull-witted who have attained the state of plants, etc., to be the cause of origination.

analyzed: garbha bhūtānām ca sraṃsamānānām karma asambhave saṃsāra anupapattiḥ
translated: And if actions are not possible for those who are falling away while in the womb, transmigration is not reasonable.

analyzed: tasmāt na ekasmin janmani sarveṣām karmaṇām upabhogaḥ
translated: Therefore, in one birth, all actions are not experienced.

original: yattu kaiściducyate sarvakarmaśriyopamardena prāyaṇe karmaṇāṃ janmārambhakatvam /
analyzed: yat tu kaiścid ucyate sarva karma śriyā upamardena prāyaṇe karmaṇām janma ārambhaka tvam
translated: But what is said by some, that at the end, all actions become the cause of birth by destroying the merit and demerit of all actions,

original: tatra kānicitkarmāṇyanārambhakatvenaiva tiṣṭhanti kānicijjanmā'rabhanta iti nopapadyate /
analyzed: tatra kānicid karmāṇi anārambhaka tvena eva tiṣṭhanti kānicid janma ārabhante iti na upapadyate
translated: that some actions remain without becoming the cause of birth, and some do become the cause of birth, is not reasonable.

analyzed: maraṇasya sarva karma abhivyañjaka tvāt sva gocara abhivyañjaka pradīpa vat iti
translated: Because death manifests all actions, like a lamp manifesting its own objects.

analyzed: tat asat
translated: That is not so.

analyzed: sarvasya sarva ātmaka tva abhyupagamāt
translated: Because the existence of everything in all forms is accepted.

original: na hi sarvasya sarvātmakatve deśakālanimittāvaruddhatvātsarvātmanopamardaḥ kasyacitkvacidabhivyaktirvā sarvātmanopapadyate /
analyzed: na hi sarvasya sarva ātmaka tve deśa kāla nimitta avaruddha tvāt sarva ātmanā upamardaḥ kasyacid kvacid abhivyaktiḥ vā sarva ātmanā upapadyate
translated: For when everything exists in all forms, restricted by place, time and cause, the destruction of all forms of anything, or the manifestation of any form of everything, is not possible.

analyzed: tathā karmaṇām api sa āśrayāṇām bhavet
translated: In the same way, it would be for actions also, which have a basis.

analyzed: yathā ca pūrva anubhūta manuṣya mayūra markaṭa ādi janma abhisaṃskṛtāḥ viruddha aneka vāsanāḥ markaṭa tva prāpakena
translated: And just as the mutually contradictory latent impressions created by the experiences of human, peacock, monkey and other births in a previous life are not destroyed by the action that brings about monkey birth,

analyzed: karmaṇā markaṭa janma ārabhamāṇena nā upamṛdyante tathā karmāṇi api anya janma prāpti nimittāni
translated: when it begins the monkey birth, in the same way, the actions that are the cause of attaining another birth are not destroyed by the action that brings about this birth.

analyzed: na upamṛdyante iti yuktam
translated: It is not proper to say that they are destroyed.

original: yadi hi sarvāḥ pūrvajanmānubhavavāsanā upamṛdyeranmarkaṭajanmanimittena karmaṇā markaṭajanmanyārabdhe
analyzed: yadi hi sarvāḥ pūrva janma anubhava vāsanāḥ upamṛdyeran markaṭa janma nimittena karmaṇā markaṭa janmani ārabdhe
translated: For if all the impressions of experiences in previous births were destroyed, when the birth as a monkey is begun by the karma that is the cause for the birth as a monkey,

original: markaṭasya jātamātrasya mātuḥ śākhāyāḥ śākhāntaragamane māturudarasaṃlagnatvādikauśalaṃ na prāpnoti /
analyzed: markaṭasya jāta mātrasya mātuḥ śākhāyāḥ śākhā antara gamane mātuḥ udara saṃlagna tva ādi kauśalam na prāpnoti
translated: the skill of the newborn monkey in clinging to its mother's belly while moving from branch to branch would not be obtained,

analyzed: iha janmani an abhyasta tvāt
translated: because it has not been practiced in this birth.

analyzed: na ca atīta anantara janmani markaṭa tvam eva āsīt tasya iti śakyam vaktum
translated: And it cannot be said that in the immediately preceding birth it was only a monkey.

original: taṃ vidyākarmaṇī samanvārabhete pūrvaprajñā caiti śruteḥ /
analyzed: tam vidyā karmaṇī samanvārabhete pūrva prajñā ca eti śruteḥ
translated: Because of the Vedic text: Knowledge and action accompany him, and also his former wisdom.

analyzed: tasmāt vāsanāvat na aśeṣa karma upamardaḥ iti śeṣa karma sambhavaḥ
translated: Therefore, like impressions, not all karma is destroyed. Thus there is the possibility of remaining karma.

original: yata evaṃ tasmāccheṣeṇopabhuktātkarmaṇaḥ saṃsāra upapadyata iti na kaścidvirodhaḥ /
analyzed: yatas evam tasmāt śeṣeṇa upabhuktāt karmaṇaḥ saṃsāraḥ upapadyate iti na kaścid virodhaḥ
translated: Since it is so, therefore there is no contradiction in saying that rebirth in the world occurs from the remaining karma that has been partially experienced.

analyzed: kā sā avadhvā yam prati nivartante iti ucyate
translated: What is that path in relation to which it is said that they return?

analyzed: yathetam yathāgatam nivartante
translated: They return by the same path by which they came.

original: nanu māsebhyaḥ pitṛlokaṃ pitṛlokādākāśamākāśāccandramasamiti gamanakrama ukto na tathā nivṛttiḥ /
analyzed: nanu māsebhyaḥ pitṛ lokam pitṛ lokāt ākāśam ākāśāt candramasam iti gamana kramaḥ uktaḥ na tathā nivṛttiḥ
translated: But the order of going is stated as from the months to the world of the ancestors, from the world of the ancestors to space, and from space to the moon. The return is not like that.

analyzed: kim tarhi akāśāt vāyum ityādi
translated: Then what? From space to wind, and so on.

analyzed: katham yathetam iti ucyate
translated: How is it said to be according to this?

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: ākāśaprāptestulyatvātpṛthivīprāpteśca na cātra yathetameveti niyamo 'nevaṃvidhamapi nivartante punarnivartante iti tu niyamaḥ /
analyzed: ākāśa prāpteḥ tulya tvāt pṛthivī prāpteḥ ca na ca atra yathetam eva iti niyamaḥ na ivaṃvidham api nivartante punar nivartante iti tu niyamaḥ
translated: Because of the equality of reaching space and reaching earth. And here there is no restriction of according to that, but the restriction is they do not return in such a way, they return again.

analyzed: atas upalakṣaṇa artham etat yathetam iti
translated: Therefore, this according to this is for the purpose of illustration.

analyzed: atas bhautikam ākāśam tāvat pratipadyante
translated: Therefore, they first attain the elemental space.

original: yāsteṣāṃ candramaṇḍale śarīrārambhikā āpa āsaṃstāsteṣāṃ tatropabhoganimittānāṃ karmaṇāṃ kṣaye vilīyante /
analyzed: yāḥ teṣām candra maṇḍale śarīra ārambhikāḥ āpaḥ āsan tāḥ teṣām tatra upabhoga nimittānām karmaṇām kṣaye vilīyante
translated: The water that was the cause for the formation of their bodies in the moon-world, when the karma that produced that enjoyment is exhausted, dissolves.

analyzed: ghṛta saṃsthānam iva agni saṃyoge
translated: Like the form of ghee in contact with fire.

original: tā vilīnā antarikṣasthā ākāśabhūtā iva sūkṣmā bhavanti tā antarikṣādvāyurbhavanti /
analyzed: tāḥ vilīnāḥ antarikṣa sthāḥ ākāśa bhūtāḥ iva sūkṣmāḥ bhavanti tāḥ antarikṣāt vāyuḥ bhavanti
translated: Those dissolved, remaining in the atmosphere, become subtle like space-elements. Those from the atmosphere become wind.

original: vāyupratiṣṭhā vāyubhūtā itaścāmutaścohyamānāstābhiḥ saha kṣīṇakarmā vāyubhūto bhavati /
analyzed: vāyu pratiṣṭhāḥ vāyu bhūtāḥ itas ca amutas ca uhyamānāḥ tābhiḥ saha kṣīṇa karmā vāyu bhūtaḥ bhavati
translated: Established in the wind, becoming wind-elements, being carried this way and that, with those, one whose karma is exhausted becomes a wind-element.

analyzed: vāyuḥ bhūtvā tābhiḥ saha eva dhūmaḥ bhavati
translated: Having become wind, together with those, one becomes smoke.

analyzed: dhūmaḥ bhūtvā abhram abbharaṇa mātra rūpaḥ bhavati
translated: Having become smoke, one becomes a mere mass of clouds.

analyzed: abhram bhūtvā meghaḥ bhavati
translated: Having become a cloud, one becomes a rain cloud.

analyzed: meghaḥ bhūtvā pravarṣati
translated: Having become a cloud, it rains.

original: ta iha vrīhiyavā oṣadhivanaspatayas tilamāsā iti jāyante 'to vai khalu durniṣprapataram /
analyzed: te iha vrīhi yavāḥ oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ tila māsāḥ iti jāyante vai khalu durniṣprapataram
translated: From that, here, rice, barley, herbs, trees, sesamum, beans, and so on are born. Indeed, from that, it is difficult to escape.

original: yo yo hy annam atti yo retaḥ siñcati tad bhūya eva bhavati //
analyzed: yaḥ yaḥ hi annam atti yaḥ retaḥ siñcati tat bhūyaḥ eva bhavati
translated: For whatever food one eats, whatever semen one emits, that becomes more and more.

original: abhraṃ bhūtvā tataḥ secanasamartho megho bhavati megho bhūtvonnateṣu pradeśeṣvatha pravarṣati /
analyzed: abhram bhūtvā tatas secana samarthaḥ meghaḥ bhavati meghaḥ bhūtvā unnateṣu pradeśeṣu atha pravarṣati
translated: Having become a cloud, then it becomes a cloud capable of watering, having become a cloud, it rains in elevated regions.

analyzed: varṣa dhārā rūpeṇa śeṣa karmā patati iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that the remaining karma falls in the form of rain drops.

original: ta iha vrīhiyavā oṣadhivanaspatayastilamāṣā ityevaṃprakārā jāyante /
analyzed: te iha vrīhi yavāḥ oṣadhi vanaspatayaḥ tila māṣāḥ iti evaṃprakārāḥ jāyante
translated: From that, here, rice, barley, herbs, trees, sesamum, beans, and so on of this kind are born.

analyzed: kṣīṇa karmaṇām aneka tvāt bahuvacana nirdeśaḥ
translated: The plural is used because the beings whose karma is exhausted are many.

analyzed: megha ādiṣu pūrveṣu eka rūpa tvāt ekavacana nirdeśaḥ
translated: In the previous ones such as the cloud, the singular is used because they have one form.

analyzed: yasmāt giri taṭa durga nadī samudra araṇya maru deśa ādi sanniveśa sahasrāṇi varṣa dhārābhiḥ patitānām
translated: Because thousands of arrangements of mountains, cliffs, inaccessible places, rivers, oceans, forests, deserts, countries, and so on are struck by rain drops.

analyzed: atas tasmāt hetoḥ vai khalu dus niṣprapataram dus niṣkramaṇam dus niḥsaraṇam
translated: Therefore, for that reason, indeed, it is difficult to escape, difficult to get out, difficult to get away from.

original: yato giritaṭādudakasrotasohyamānā nadīḥ prāpnuvanti tataḥ samudraṃ tato makārādibhirbhakṣyante /
analyzed: yatas giri taṭāt udaka srotasā uhyamānāḥ nadīḥ prāpnuvanti tatas samudram tatas makāra ādibhiḥ bhakṣyante
translated: Because rivers, being carried down from mountain slopes, reach the ocean, where they are eaten by sharks and other creatures.

analyzed: te pi anyena
translated: Those [rivers] are also eaten by others.

original: tatraiva ca saha makareṇa samudre vilīnāḥ samudrāmbhobhirjaladharairākṛṣṭāḥ punarvarṣadhārābhirmarudeśe śilātaṭe vāgamye patitāstiṣṭhanti kadācidvyālamagādipītā
analyzed: tatra eva ca saha makareṇa samudre vilīnāḥ samudra ambhobhiḥ jaladharaiḥ ākṛṣṭāḥ punar varṣa dhārābhiḥ maru deśe śilā taṭe vā agamye patitāḥ tiṣṭhanti kadācid vyāla maga ādi pītā
translated: And right there in the ocean, along with the sharks, they dissolve into the ocean waters, drawn up by the clouds and again fall as rain in the form of torrents on rocky mountain slopes in desert regions, where they remain, sometimes drunk by snakes, mice, and other creatures.

analyzed: bhakṣitāḥ ca anyaiḥ
translated: And they are eaten by others.

analyzed: te pi anyaiḥ iti evaṃprakārāḥ parivarteran
translated: They would thus revolve in this way.

analyzed: kadācid abhakṣyeṣu sthāvareṣu jātāḥ tatra eva śuṣyeran
translated: Sometimes born as inedible plants, they would dry up right there.

original: bhakṣyeṣvapi sthāvareṣu jātānāṃ retaḥsigdehasambandho durlabha eva bahutvātsthāvarāṇāmityato durniṣkramaṇatvam /
analyzed: bhakṣyeṣu api sthāvareṣu jātānām retaḥ sic deha sambandhaḥ durlabhaḥ eva bahu tvāt sthāvarāṇām iti atas durniṣkramaṇa tvam
translated: For those born as edible plants, it is difficult to come into contact with semen and blood, because of the vast number of plants. Thus, it is difficult to escape from that state.

analyzed: athavā atas smāt vrīhi yava ādi bhāvāt durniṣprapataram durnirgamataram
translated: Or, it is more difficult to escape from that state of being rice, barley, and so on.

analyzed: durniṣprapataram iti takāraḥ ekaḥ luptaḥ draṣṭavyaḥ
translated: The word difficult to escape should be seen as having one ta letter omitted.

analyzed: vrīhi yava ādi bhāvaḥ durniṣprapataḥ tasmāt api durniṣprapatāt retaḥ sic deha sambandhaḥ durniṣprapatataraḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: The state of being rice, barley, etc. is difficult to escape from. Therefore, the connection with the body of semen and ovum is even more difficult to escape from. This is the meaning.

original: yasmādūrdhvaretobhirbālaiḥ puṃstvarahitaiḥ sthavirairvā bhakṣitā antarāle śīryante /
analyzed: yasmāt ūrdhvaretobhiḥ bālaiḥ puṃstva rahitaiḥ sthaviraiḥ vā bhakṣitāḥ antarāle śīryante
translated: Because they are eaten by those who emit semen upwards, by children devoid of manhood, or by the aged, they perish in between.

analyzed: aneka tvāt anna ādānām
translated: Because of the multiplicity of eaters of food.

original: kadācitkākatālīyavṛttyā retaḥsigbhirbhakṣyante yadā tadā retaḥ sigbhāvaṃ gatānāṃ karmaṇo vṛttilābhaḥ /
analyzed: kadācid kākatālīya vṛttyā retaḥ sigbhiḥ bhakṣyante yadā tadā retaḥ sigbhāvam gatānām karmaṇaḥ vṛtti lābhaḥ
translated: Sometimes, by the accidental occurrence of things, they are eaten by semen and ovum. When that happens, for those who have become semen and ovum, the action obtains its opportunity.

original: katham /🔽yo yo hyannamattyanuśayibhiḥ saṃśliṣṭaṃ retaḥ siñcatyṛtukāle yoṣiti tadbhūya eva tadākṛtireva bhavati /
analyzed: katham  yaḥ yaḥ hi annam atti anuśayibhiḥ saṃśliṣṭam retaḥ siñcati ṛtu kāle yoṣiti tat bhūyaḥ eva tad ākṛtiḥ eva bhavati
translated: How is that?🔽For whoever eats food mixed with the anuśayins, and emits semen at the time of menstruation in a woman, he becomes just that form again, in abundance.

original: tadavayavākṛtibhūyastvaṃ bhūya ityucyate retorūpeṇa yoṣito garbhaśaye 'ntaḥ praviṣṭo 'nuśayī /
analyzed: tad avayava ākṛti bhūyastvam bhūyaḥ iti ucyate retaḥ rūpeṇa yoṣitaḥ garbha śaye praviṣṭaḥ nuśayī
translated: The abundance of the form of its parts is called in abundance. The anuśayi enters inside the womb of the woman in the form of semen.

analyzed: retasaḥ retaḥ sic ākṛti bhāvita tvāt
translated: Because the semen is transformed into the form of semen and ovum.

analyzed: sarvebhyaḥ ṅgebhyaḥ tejaḥ saṃbhūtam iti hi śruti antarāt
translated: Because it is said in another śruti that heat is produced from all the parts.

analyzed: atas retaḥsic ākṛtiḥ eva bhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that he becomes just the form of semen and ovum.

analyzed: tathā hi
translated: Indeed, it is so.

original: puruṣātpuruṣo jāyate gorgavākṛtireva na jātyantarākṛtistasmādyuktaṃ tadbhūya eva bhavatīti /
analyzed: puruṣāt puruṣaḥ jāyate goḥ go ākṛtiḥ eva na jāti antara ākṛtiḥ tasmāt yuktam tat bhūyas eva bhavati iti
translated: From man a man is born, from a cow a cow, and not an animal of a different species. Therefore it is proper to say that it becomes more and more.

original: ye tvanye 'nuśayibhyaścandramaṇḍalamanāruhyehaiva pāpakarmabhirghoraivrīhiyavādibhāvaṃ pratipadyante punarmanuṣyādibhāvaṃ teṣāṃ nānuśayināmiva
analyzed: ye tu anye nuśayibhyaḥ candra maṇḍalam an āruhya iha eva pāpa karmabhiḥ ghoraiḥ vrīhi yava ādi bhāvam pratipadyante punar manuṣya ādi bhāvam teṣām na anuśayinām iva
translated: But others, who, not being destined to the moon, take birth here itself in the form of rice, barley, etc., due to terrible sinful deeds, and again in the form of humans, etc., for them it is not

analyzed: durniṣprataram
translated: difficult to cross over, like those destined to the moon.

analyzed: kasmāt
translated: Why is that?

original: karmaṇā hi tairvrīhiyavādideha upātta iti tadupabhoganimittakṣaye vrīhyādistambadehavināśe🔽yathākarmārjitaṃ dehāntaraṃ navaṃ navaṃ jalūkāvatsaṃkramante savijñānā evasavijñāno
analyzed: karmaṇā hi taiḥ vrīhi yava ādi dehaḥ upāttaḥ iti tad upabhoga nimitta kṣaye vrīhi ādi stamba deha vināśe  yathā karma arjitam deha antaram navam navam jalūkā vat saṃkramante sa vijñānāḥ eva sa vijñānaḥ
translated: For they have taken up the body of rice, barley, etc. by their deeds. When the cause of enjoying that is exhausted, and the body of rice, etc., is destroyed,

analyzed: bhavati sa vijñānam eva anvavakrāmati iti śruti antarāt
translated: they enter a new body befitting their deeds, like a leech, with consciousness. Because of another Vedic text: He becomes conscious, and with consciousness he enters.

original: yadyapyusaṃhṛtakaraṇāḥ santo dehāntaraṃ gacchanti tathāpi svapnavaddehāntaraprāptinimittakarmodbhāvitavāsanājñānena savijñānā eva dehāntaraṃ
analyzed: yadi api usaṃhṛta karaṇāḥ santaḥ deha antaram gacchanti tathā api svapna vat deha antara prāpti nimitta karma udbhāvita vāsanā jñānena sa vijñānāḥ eva deha antaram
translated: Even though they go to another body with their organs withdrawn, still, like in a dream, with the knowledge of latent impressions manifested by the deeds that are the cause of attaining another body, they go to another body

analyzed: gacchanti
translated: with consciousness.

analyzed: śruti prāmāṇyāt
translated: Because of the authoritativeness of the Vedas.

original: tathārcirādinā dhūmādinā ca gamanaṃ svapta ivodbhūtavijñānena /
analyzed: tathā arciḥ ādinā dhūma ādinā ca gamanam svapte iva udbhūta vijñānena
translated: Similarly, the going by the light, etc., and by the smoke, etc., is like the going in a dream by the consciousness that has arisen.

analyzed: labdha vṛtti karma nimitta tvāt gamanasya
translated: Because the going is caused by the actions that have obtained operation.

original: na tathānuśayināṃ vrīhyādibhāvena jātānāṃ savijñānameva retaḥsigyoṣiddehasambandha upapadyate /
analyzed: na tathā anuśayinām vrīhi ādi bhāvena jātānām sa vijñānam eva retaḥ sic yoṣit deha sambandhaḥ upapadyate
translated: For those who transmigrate, who are born in the form of rice, etc., the connection with the body of the male and female semen and ovum is not possible with consciousness.

original: na hi vrīhyādilavanakaṇḍanapeṣaṇādau ca savijñānānāṃ sthitirasti /
analyzed: na hi vrīhi ādi lavana kaṇḍana peṣaṇa ādau ca sa vijñānānām sthitiḥ asti
translated: For there is no existence with consciousness in the threshing, cutting, grinding, etc. of rice, etc.

analyzed: nanu candra maṇḍalāt api avarohatām deha antara gamanasya tulya tvāt jalūkā vat sa vijñāna tā eva yuktā
translated: But for those who descend from the lunar sphere, the going to another body is the same, so it is proper that it should be with consciousness, like a leech.

original: tathā sati ghoro narakānubhava iṣṭāpūrtādikāriṇāṃ candramaṇḍalādārabhya prāpto yāvadbrāhmaṇādijanma /
analyzed: tathā sati ghoraḥ naraka anubhavaḥ iṣṭāpūrta ādi kāriṇām candra maṇḍalāt ārabhya prāptaḥ yāvat brāhmaṇa ādi janma
translated: If that were so, the terrible experience of hell and the experience of the results of good deeds, etc., beginning from the lunar sphere up to the birth of a Brahmin, etc., would be obtained.

analyzed: tathā ca sati anarthāya eva iṣṭāpūrta ādi upāsanam vihitam syāt
translated: And if that were so, the performance of good deeds, etc. would be only for harm.

analyzed: śruteḥ ca a prāmāṇyam prāptam vaidikānām karmaṇām anartha anubandhi tvāt
translated: And the Vedas would become invalid, because the Vedic rites are connected with harm.

analyzed: na vṛkṣa ārohaṇa patana vat viśeṣa sambhavāt
translated: No, because a distinction is possible, like climbing and falling from a tree.

original: dehāddehāntaraṃ pratipitsoḥ karmaṇo labdhavṛttitvākarmaṇodbhāvitena vijñānena savijñānatvaṃ yuktam /
analyzed: dehāt deha antaram pratipitsoḥ karmaṇaḥ labdha vṛtti tva a karmaṇā udbhāvitena vijñānena sa vijñāna tvam yuktam
translated: It is proper that the soul, desiring to go from one body to another, should have consciousness along with the action whose operation has been obtained, as it is manifested by consciousness.

analyzed: vṛkṣa agram ārohataḥ iva phalam jighṛkṣoḥ
translated: Just as one who desires to grasp the fruit should climb to the top of a tree.

analyzed: tathā arciḥ ādinā gacchatām sa vijñāna tvam bhavet
translated: Similarly, those who go by the path of light would have consciousness.

analyzed: dhūma ādinā ca candra maṇḍalam ārurukṣatām
translated: And those who desire to ascend to the lunar sphere by smoke, etc.

original: na tathā candramaṇḍalādavarurukṣatāṃ vṛkṣāgrādiva patatāṃ sacetanatvam /
analyzed: na tathā candra maṇḍalāt avarurukṣatām vṛkṣa agrāt iva patatām sa cetana tvam
translated: But not so those who descend from the lunar sphere, like those who fall from the top of a tree, would have consciousness.

analyzed: yathā ca mudgara ādi abhihatānām tad abhighāta vedanā nimitta saṃmūrchita pratibaddha karaṇānām
translated: And just as those who are struck by hammers, etc., whose organs are obstructed by fainting caused by the sensation of that blow,

original: svadehenaiva deśāddeśāntaraṃ nīyamānānāṃ vijñānaśūnyatā dṛṣṭā tathā candramaṇḍalānmānuṣādidehāntaraṃ
analyzed: sva dehena eva deśāt deśa antaram nīyamānānām vijñāna śūnyatā dṛṣṭā tathā candra maṇḍalāt mānuṣa ādi deha antaram
translated: are seen to be devoid of consciousness even with their own bodies being carried from one place to another, so those who desire to descend from the lunar sphere to another body like a human body,

analyzed: pratyavarurukṣatām svarga bhoga nimitta karma kṣayāt mṛdita ap dehānām pratibaddha karaṇānām
translated: whose watery bodies are crushed due to the exhaustion of the actions that cause heavenly enjoyments, whose organs are obstructed,

analyzed: atas te parityakta deha bīja bhūtābhiḥ adbhiḥ mūrchitāḥ iva ākāśa ādi krameṇa imām avaruhya karma nimitta jāti sthāvara dehaiḥ saṃśliṣyante pratibaddha karaṇa tayā anudbhūta vijñānā  eva
translated: Therefore, they, whose seed-like water of the body has not been abandoned, are as if stunned, descend in the order of space etc. to this (earth), and are connected with the immobile bodies of birth caused by karma, with their senses restrained, with consciousness not manifest.

analyzed: tathā lavana kaṇḍana peṣaṇa saṃskāra bhakṣaṇa rasa ādi pariṇāma retaḥ seka kāleṣu mūrchita vat eva
translated: Even so, in the states of cutting, chopping, grinding, cooking, eating, tasting etc., they are as if stunned.

analyzed: deha antara ārambhakasya karmaṇaḥ labdha vṛtti tvāt
translated: Because the karma that causes the beginning of another body has not obtained operation.

original: dehabījabhūtāpsambandhāparityāgenaiva sarvāsvavasthāsu vartanta iti jalūkāvaccetanāvattvaṃ na virudhyate /
analyzed: deha bīja bhūta ap sambandha a parityāgena eva sarvāsu avasthāsu vartante iti jalūkā vat cetanāvat tvam na virudhyate
translated: They exist in all states only by not abandoning the connection with the water that is the seed of the body. Thus, the fact that they possess consciousness is not contradicted, like a leech.

analyzed: antarāle tu avijñānam mūrchita vat eva iti adoṣaḥ
translated: But in the interval, the lack of consciousness is like being stunned. Thus, there is no fault.

original: na ca vaidikānāṃ karmaṇāṃ hiṃsāyuktatvenobhayahetutvaṃ śakyamanumātum /
analyzed: na ca vaidikānām karmaṇām hiṃsā yukta tvena ubhaya hetu tvam śakyam anumātum
translated: And it is not possible to infer that the Vedic rites are the cause of both (good and bad) because they are associated with violence.

analyzed: hiṃsāyāḥ śāstra codita tvāt
translated: Because violence is enjoined by the scriptures.

original: ahiṃsansarvabhūtānyanyatra tīrthebhyaḥiti śruteḥ śāstracoditāyā hiṃsāyā nādharmahetutvamabhyupagamyate /
analyzed: a hiṃsan sarva bhūtāni anyatra tīrthebhyaḥ iti śruteḥ śāstra coditāyāḥ hiṃsāyāḥ na adharma hetu tvam abhyupagamyate
translated: The violence enjoined by the scriptures is not accepted as the cause of sin, because of the Vedic text: Not harming any beings, except at the sacred fords.

original: abhyupagate 'pyadharmahetutve mantrairviṣādivattadapanayopapatterna duḥkhakāryārambhakatvopapattirvaidikānāṃ karmaṇāṃ mantreṇeva viṣabhakṣaṇasyeti
analyzed: abhyupagate pi adharma hetu tve mantraiḥ viṣa ādi vat tad apanaya upapatteḥ na duḥkha kārya ārambhaka tva upapattiḥ vaidikānām karmaṇām mantreṇa iva viṣa bhakṣaṇasya iti
translated: Even if it is admitted that they are the cause of sin, the removal of that (sin) is possible by means of Mantras, just as in the case of poison, so the Vedic rites cannot be the cause of misery, just as the eating of poison with a Mantra cannot be the cause of misery.

original: tad ya iha ramaṇīyacaraṇā abhyāśo ha yat te ramaṇīyāṃ yonim āpadyeran brāhmaṇayoniṃ vā kṣatriyayoniṃ vā vaiśyayoniṃ vā /
analyzed: tat ye iha ramaṇīya caraṇāḥ abhyāśaḥ ha yat te ramaṇīyām yonim āpadyeran brāhmaṇa yonim vā kṣatriya yonim vā vaiśya yonim vā
translated: Those who have led a pure life here, they will quickly attain a pure birth, either as a Brahmin, a Kshatriya, or a Vaishya.

original: atha ya iha kapūyacaraṇā abhyāśo ha yat te kapūyāṃ yonim āpadyerañ śvayonim vā sūkarayoniṃ vā caṇḍālayoniṃ vā //
analyzed: atha ye iha kapūya caraṇāḥ abhyāśaḥ ha yat te kapūyām yonim āpadyeram śva yonim vā sūkara yonim vā caṇḍāla yonim vā
translated: And those who have led a wicked life here, they will quickly attain a wicked birth, either as a dog, a pig, or an outcaste.

original: tattatra teṣvanuśayināṃ ya iha loke ramaṇīyaṃ śobhanaṃ caraṇaṃ śīlaṃ
analyzed: tat tatra teṣu anuśayinām yaḥ iha loke ramaṇīyam śobhanam caraṇam śīlam
translated: There, among those who have residual tendencies, those who have led a pure life here in this world, whose conduct is

original: yeṣāṃ te ramaṇīyacaraṇāḥ ramaṇīyacaraṇenopalakṣitaḥ śobhano 'nuśayaḥ puṇyaṃ karma
analyzed: yeṣām te ramaṇīya caraṇāḥ ramaṇīya caraṇena upalakṣitaḥ śobhanaḥ nuśayaḥ puṇyam karma
translated: those who have a pure life, by a pure life they are characterized as having a good residual tendency, a meritorious deed.

analyzed: yeṣām te ramaṇīya caraṇāḥ ucyante
translated: Those are said to have a pure life.

analyzed: kraurya anṛta māyā varjitānām hi śakyaḥ upalakṣayitum śubha anuśaya sadbhāvaḥ
translated: For those who are free from cruelty, untruth, and deceit, the existence of a good residual tendency can be observed.

original: tenānuśayena puṇyena karmaṇā candramaṇḍale bhuktaśeṣeṇābhyāśo ha kṣiprameva /
analyzed: tena anuśayena puṇyena karmaṇā candra maṇḍale bhukta śeṣeṇa abhyāśaḥ ha kṣipram eva
translated: By that latent tendency, merit, and action, the remainder of what was eaten in the moon's orb, by that, indeed, quickly, swiftly.

original: yaditi kriyāviśeṣaṇaṃ te ramaṇīyāṃ krauryādivarjitāṃ yonimāpadyeranprāpnuyurbrāhmaṇayoniṃ vā kṣattriyayoniṃ vā vaiśyayoniṃ vā svakarmānurūpeṇa🔽atha punarye tadviparītāḥ kapūyacaraṇopalakṣitakarmāṇo 'śubhānuśayā abhyāśo ha yatte
analyzed: yat iti kriyā viśeṣaṇam te ramaṇīyām kraurya ādi varjitām yonim āpadyeran prāpnuyuḥ brāhmaṇa yonim vā kṣattriya yonim vā vaiśya yonim vā sva karma anurūpeṇa  atha punar ye tad viparītāḥ kapūya caraṇa upalakṣita karmāṇaḥ śubha anuśayāḥ abhyāśaḥ ha yat te
translated: By that residual impression, merit, and action, they will quickly attain a delightful womb, free from cruelty and so on, either the womb of a Brahmin, the womb of a Kshatriya, or the womb of a Vaishya, in accordance with their own duties.

original: kapūyāṃ yathākarma yonimāpadyerankapūyāmeva dharmasambandhavarjitāṃ jugupsitāṃ yonimāpadyeran
analyzed: kapūyām yathākarma yonim āpadyeran kapūyām eva dharma sambandha varjitām jugupsitām yonim āpadyeran
translated: Now, on the other hand, those who are contrary to that, characterized by impure conduct and evil residual impressions, they will quickly attain a womb in accordance with their actions. They will attain a womb that is impure, devoid of the connection with Dharma, and despicable.

analyzed: śva yonim vā sūkara yonim vā sva karma anurūpeṇa eva
translated: Either the womb of a dog or the womb of a pig, in accordance with their own actions.

original: ye tu ramaṇīyacaraṇā dvijātayaste svakarmasthāścediṣṭādikāriṇaste dhūmādigatyā gacchantyāgacchanti ca punaḥ punarghaṭīyantravat /
analyzed: ye tu ramaṇīya caraṇāḥ dvijātayaḥ te sva karma sthāḥ ced iṣṭa ādi kāriṇaḥ te dhūma ādi gatyā gacchanti āgacchanti ca punar punar ghaṭīyantra vat
translated: But those who are of delightful conduct and are twice-born, and who abide in their own duties if they perform desired rites and so on, they go and come again and again like a waterwheel, by the path of smoke and so on.

analyzed: vidyām ced prāpnuyuḥ tadā arciḥ ādinā gacchanti
translated: If they attain knowledge, then they go by the path of light and so on.

original: athaitayoḥ pathor na katareṇacana tānīmāni kṣudrāṇy asakṛdāvartīni bhūtāni bhavanti jāyasva mriyasveti /
analyzed: atha etayoḥ pathoḥ na katareṇa cana tāni imāni kṣudrāṇi asakṛdāvartīni bhūtāni bhavanti jāyasva mriyasva iti
translated: Now, by neither of these paths do these small creatures, which repeatedly return, come to be. 'Be born and die.'

analyzed: etat tṛtīyam sthānam
translated: This is the third state.

analyzed: tena asau lokaḥ na saṃpūryate
translated: By that, that world is not filled.

analyzed: tasmāt jugupseta
translated: Therefore, one should be disgusted with it.

analyzed: tat eṣa ślokaḥ
translated: This is the verse on that:

original: yadā tu na vidyāsevino nāpīṣṭādikarma sevante tadāthaitayoḥ pathoryathoktayorarcirdhūmādilakṣaṇayorna
analyzed: yadā tu na vidyā sevinaḥ na api iṣṭa ādi karma sevante tadā atha etayoḥ pathoḥ yathā uktayoḥ arciḥ dhūma ādi lakṣaṇayoḥ na
translated: But when they do not serve the knowledge-seekers, nor do they serve the desired rites, then by neither of these paths as described, characterized by light, smoke, etc.,

original: katareṇānyatareṇacanāpi yanti tānīmāni bhūtāni kṣūdrāṇi daṃśamasakakīṭādīnyasakṛdāvartīni bhavanti /
analyzed: katareṇa anyatareṇa cana api yanti tāni imāni bhūtāni kṣūdrāṇi daṃśa masaka kīṭa ādīni asakṛt āvartīni bhavanti
translated: do they go by either one. These small creatures, mosquitoes, flies, insects, etc., repeatedly return.

analyzed: atas ubhaya mārga paribhraṣṭāḥ hi asakṛt jāyante mriyante ca iti arthaḥ
translated: Therefore, they fall from both paths. The meaning is that they are repeatedly born and die.

analyzed: teṣām janana maraṇa santateḥ anukaraṇam idam ucyate  jāyasva mriyasva iti īśvara nimitta ceṣṭā ucyate
translated: This is said to be an imitation of the continuity of their birth and death.🔽'Be born and die' is said to be the activity caused by God.

analyzed: janana maraṇa lakṣaṇena eva kāla yāpanā bhavati
translated: The passing of time occurs only through birth and death.

original: na tu kriyāsu bhogeṣu vā kālo 'stītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: na tu kriyāsu bhogeṣu vā kālaḥ sti iti arthaḥ
translated: The meaning is that there is no time in actions or enjoyments.

original: etatkṣudrajantulakṣaṇaṃ tṛtīyaṃ pūrvoktau panthānāvapekṣya sthānaṃ saṃsaratām /
analyzed: etat kṣudrajantu lakṣaṇam tṛtīyam pūrva uktau panthānau apekṣya sthānam saṃsaratām
translated: This is the third characteristic of small beings, a place for those wandering in samsara, in relation to the two paths mentioned earlier.

original: yenaivaṃ dakṣiṇamārgagā api punarāgacchantyanadhikṛtānāṃ jñānakarmaṇoragamanameva dakṣiṇena patheti /
analyzed: yena evam dakṣiṇa mārga gāḥ api punar āgacchanti anadhikṛtānām jñāna karmaṇoḥ agamanam eva dakṣiṇena pathā iti
translated: By this, even those who follow the southern path return again. For those not entitled to knowledge and action, going by the southern path is itself non-going.

analyzed: tena asau lokaḥ na saṃpūryate
translated: Therefore, that world is not filled.

original: pañcamastu praśnaḥ pañcāgnividyayā vyākhyātaḥ /🔽prathamo dakṣiṇottaramārgābhyāmapākṛto dakṣiṇottarayoḥ pathorvyāvartanāpi mṛtānāmagnau prakṣepaḥ samānastato vyāvartanānye 'rcirādinā yantyanye
analyzed: pañcamaḥ tu praśnaḥ pañcāgni vidyayā vyākhyātaḥ  prathamaḥ dakṣiṇa uttara mārgābhyām apākṛtaḥ dakṣiṇa uttarayoḥ pathoḥ vyāvartanā api mṛtānām agnau prakṣepaḥ samānaḥ tatas vyāvartanā anye rciḥ ādinā yanti anye
translated: The fifth question has been explained by the knowledge of the five fires.

analyzed: dhūma ādinā
translated: The first has been refuted by the southern and northern paths. The turning back on the southern and northern paths, and the throwing of the dead into the fire, are the same. Therefore, others go by the path of light, others by the path of smoke.

analyzed: punar uttara dakṣiṇāyane ṣaṭ māsān prapnuvantaḥ saṃyujya punar vyāvartante
translated: Again, they attain the six months of the northern and southern transits, unite, and turn back again.

analyzed: anye saṃvatsaram anye māsebhyaḥ pitṛ lokam iti vyākhyātā
translated: Others for a year, others for the months, to the world of the ancestors, thus it has been explained.

analyzed: punarāvṛttiḥ api kṣīṇa anuśayānām candra maṇḍalāt ākāśa ādi krameṇa uktā
translated: The return also of those whose defilements are exhausted, by the path of the lunar orb, space, and so on, has been explained.

original: amuṣya lokasyāpūraṇaṃ svaśabdenaivoktamtenāsau loko na saṃpūryata iti /
analyzed: amuṣya lokasya āpūraṇam sva śabdena eva uktam tena asau lokaḥ na saṃpūryate iti
translated: The non-filling of that world has been stated by its own words: Therefore, that world is not filled.

analyzed: yasmāt evam kaṣṭā saṃsāra gatiḥ tasmāt jugupseta
translated: Since the course of worldly existence is so painful, therefore one should feel disgust for it.

original: yasmācca janmamaraṇajanitavedanānubhavakṛtakṣaṇāḥ kṣudrajantavo dhvānte ca ghore🔽dustare praveśitāḥ sāgara ivāgādhe 'plave nirāśāścottaraṇaṃ prati tasmāccaivaṃvidhāṃ
analyzed: yasmāt ca janma maraṇa janita vedanā anubhava kṛtakṣaṇāḥ kṣudra jantavaḥ dhvānte ca ghore  dustare praveśitāḥ sāgare iva agādhe plave nirāśāḥ ca uttaraṇam prati tasmāt ca evaṃvidhām
translated: And since small creatures, experiencing the pain born of birth and death, are plunged into a terrible darkness,🔽difficult to cross, like a fathomless ocean without a raft, and are hopeless of crossing it, therefore one should feel disgust for such

original: saṃsāragatiṃ jugupseta bībhatseta ghṛṇī bhavenmā bhūdevaṃvidhe saṃsāramahodadhau ghore pāta iti /
analyzed: saṃsāra gatim jugupseta bībhatseta ghṛṇī bhavet mā bhūt evaṃvidhe saṃsāra mahā udadhau ghore pātaḥ iti
translated: a course of worldly existence, should be disgusted with it, should be compassionate, thinking May I not fall into such a terrible great ocean of worldly existence.

analyzed: tat etasmin arthe eṣa ślokaḥ pañcāgni vidyā stutataye
translated: This verse is for the praise of the knowledge of the five fires in this sense.

analyzed: stenaḥ hiraṇyasya surām piban ca
translated: The thief of gold, the drinker of liquor,

analyzed: guroḥ talpam āvasan brahma hā ca
translated: the one who lies with his guru's wife, and the killer of a brahmin -

original: ete patanti catvāraḥ pañcamaś cācaraṃs tair iti //
analyzed: ete patanti catvāraḥ pañcamaḥ ca ācaran taiḥ iti
translated: these four fall, and the fifth by associating with them.

analyzed: stenaḥ hiraṇyasya brāhmaṇa suvarṇasya hartā
translated: The thief of gold is the one who steals the gold of a brahmin.

analyzed: surām piban brāhmaṇaḥ san
translated: The drinker of liquor is a brahmin who drinks liquor.

analyzed: guroḥ ca talpam dārān āvasan
translated: The one who lies with his guru's wife is the one who has intercourse with his guru's wife.

original: brahmahā brāhmaṇasya hantā cetyete patanti catvāraḥ /
analyzed: brahma hā brāhmaṇasya hantā ca iti ete patanti catvāraḥ
translated: The killer of a brahmin is the one who kills a brahmin. These four fall.

analyzed: pañcamaḥ ca taiḥ saha ācaran iti
translated: And the fifth falls by associating with them.

original: atha ha ya etān evaṃ pañcāgnīn veda na saha tair apy ācaran pāpmanā lipyate /
analyzed: atha ha yaḥ etān evam pañca agnīn veda na saha taiḥ api ācaran pāpmanā lipyate
translated: Now, he who knows these five fires thus, even though he acts with them, does not become tainted by sin.

original: śuddhaḥ pūtaḥ puṇyaloko bhavati ya evaṃ veda ya evaṃ veda //
analyzed: śuddhaḥ pūtaḥ puṇya lokaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda yaḥ evam veda
translated: He becomes pure, cleansed, and of meritorious world, he who knows this, he who knows this.

original: atha ha punaryo yathoktānpañcāgnīnveda sa tairapyācaranmahāpātakibhiḥ saha na pāpmanā lipyate śuddha eva /🔽tena pañcāgnidarśanena pāvito yasmātpūtaḥ puṇyo lokaḥ prājāpatyādiryasya so 'yaṃ puṇyaloko bhavati ya evaṃ veda yathoktaṃ samastaṃ pañcabhiḥ
analyzed: atha ha punar yaḥ yathā uktān pañca agnīn veda sa taiḥ api ācaran mahāpātakibhiḥ saha na pāpmanā lipyate śuddhaḥ eva  tena pañcāgni darśanena pāvitaḥ yasmāt pūtaḥ puṇyaḥ lokaḥ prājāpatya ādiḥ yasya saḥ yam puṇya lokaḥ bhavati yaḥ evam veda yathoktam samastam pañcabhiḥ
translated: Now, he who knows the five fires as described, even though he acts with them, the great sinners, does not become tainted by sin, but remains pure.

analyzed: praśnaiḥ pṛṣṭam artha jātam veda
translated: By that knowledge of the five fires, he becomes purified, and therefore he becomes of meritorious world, of the world of Prajapati and others. He who knows this, who knows the entire subject matter asked in the five questions,

analyzed: dviruktiḥ samasta praśna nirṇaya pradarśana arthā
translated: The repetition is for the purpose of showing the complete solution to the questions.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi pañcama adhyāyasya daśamaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the tenth section of the fifth chapter in the Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: prācīnaśāla aupamanyavaḥ satyayajñaḥ pauluṣir indradyumno bhāllaveyo janaḥ śārkarākṣyo buḍila āśvatarāśvis te haite mahāśālā mahāśrotriyāḥ
analyzed: prācīnaśālaḥ aupamanyavaḥ satyayajñaḥ pauluṣiḥ indradyumnaḥ bhāllaveyaḥ janaḥ śārkarākṣyaḥ buḍilaḥ āśvatarāśviḥ te ha ete mahā śālāḥ mahā śrotriyāḥ
translated: Prācīnaśāla, the son of Aupamanyava, Satyayajña, the son of Pauli, Indradyumna, the son of Bhāllaveya, Jana, the son of Śārkārākṣya, and Būḍila, the son of Āśvatarāśva, these great scholars, great students of the Vedas,

analyzed: sametya mīmāṃsām cakruḥ
translated: having come together, held a discussion.

analyzed: kaḥ naḥ ātmā kim brahma iti
translated: What is the Self? What is Brahman?

original: dakṣiṇena pathā gacchatāmannabhāva utkastaddevānāmannaṃ taṃ devā bhakṣayantīti /
analyzed: dakṣiṇena pathā gacchatām anna bhāvaḥ utkaḥ tat devānām annam tam devāḥ bhakṣayanti iti
translated: For those who go by the southern path, food is said to be exhausted. That is the food of the gods, which the gods eat.

analyzed: kṣudra jantu lakṣaṇā ca kaṣṭā saṃsāra gatiḥ uktā
translated: And the miserable course of worldly existence characterized by small creatures is said to be difficult.

analyzed: tad ubhaya doṣa parijirhīrṣayā vaiśvānara āttṛ bhāva pratipatti artham uttaraḥ granthaḥ ārabhyate
translated: With the desire to avoid both those faults, the subsequent text is begun for the purpose of realizing the state of being the food of Vaisvānara.

analyzed: atsi annam paśyasi priyam ityādi liṅgāt
translated: Because of indications such as You see the food to be eaten, the beloved one and so on.

original: ākhyāyikā tu sukhāvabodhārthā vidyāsampradānanyāyāpradarśanārthā caprācīnaśāla iti nāmata upamanyorapatyamaupamanyavaḥ /
analyzed: ākhyāyikā tu sukha avabodha arthā vidyā sampradāna nyāya a pradarśana arthā ca prācīnaśālaḥ iti nāmataḥ upamanyoḥ apatyam aupamanyavaḥ
translated: But the story is for the sake of easy understanding and for the purpose of showing the method of giving the knowledge. One who is the son of Upamanyu, named Prācīnaśāli, is the descendant of Upamanyu.

analyzed: satyayajñaḥ nāmataḥ puluṣasya apatyam pauluṣiḥ
translated: The son of Puluṣa, named Satyayajña, is the descendant of Puluṣa.

analyzed: tathā indradyumnaḥ nāmataḥ bhallaveḥ apatyam bhāllaviḥ tasya apatyam bhāllaveyaḥ
translated: Similarly, the descendant of Bhāllaveya, named Indradyumna, is the son of Bhāllaveya.

analyzed: janaḥ iti nāmataḥ śarkarākṣasya apatyam śārkarākṣyaḥ
translated: The son of Śarkarākṣa, named Jana, is the descendant of Śarkarākṣa.

analyzed: buḍilaḥ śvatarāśvasya apatyam āśvatarāśviḥ
translated: The son of Aśvatarāśva, named Budhila, is the descendant of Aśvatarāśva.

original: pañcāpi te haite mahāśālā mahāgṛhasthā vistīrṇābhiḥ śālābhiryuktāḥ sampannā ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: pañca api te ha ete mahā śālāḥ mahā gṛha sthāḥ vistīrṇābhiḥ śālābhiḥ yuktāḥ sampannāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: All these five were great householders, endowed with extensive houses, i.e. prosperous.

analyzed: mahāśrotriyāḥ śruta adhyayana vṛtta sampannāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: They were great Vedic scholars, i.e. endowed with learning, study and conduct.

original: ta evaṃbhūtāḥ santaḥ sametya saṃbhūya kvacinmīmāṃsā vicāraṇāṃ cakruḥ kṛtavanta ityarthaḥ /
analyzed: te evaṃbhūtāḥ santaḥ sametya saṃbhūya kvacid mīmāṃsāḥ vicāraṇām cakruḥ kṛtavantaḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: Having become such, they assembled together, and somewhere they held a discussion, i.e. they had a debate.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

analyzed: kaḥ no smākam ātmā kim brahma iti ātma brahma śabdayoḥ itaretara viśeṣaṇa viśeṣya tvam
translated: What is our Self? What is Brahman? The words Self and Brahman are in a mutual relationship of qualifier and qualified.

analyzed: brahma iti adhyātma paricchinnam ātmānam nivartayati ātmā iti ca ātma vyatiriktasya āditya ādi brahmaṇaḥ upāsya tvam nivartayati
translated: The word Brahman excludes the Self that is limited to the internal body, and the word Self excludes Brahman other than the Self, such as the sun etc., as objects of meditation.

original: abhedenā'tmaiva brahma brahmaivā'tmetyevaṃ sarvātmā vaiśvānaro brahma sa ātmetyetatsiddhaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: abhedena ātmā eva brahma brahma eva ātmā iti evam sarva ātmā vaiśvānaraḥ brahma saḥ ātmā iti etat siddham bhavati
translated: Thus, the Self itself is Brahman, Brahman itself is the Self. In this way, the all-pervading Vaiśvānara is Brahman, and that is the Self. This becomes established.

analyzed: mūrdhā te vyapatiṣyat andhaḥ bhaviṣyat ityādi liṅgāt
translated: Because of indications such as Your head would have fallen off, you would have become blind etc.

analyzed: te ha saṃpādayām cakruḥ
translated: They agreed.

original: uddālako vai bhagavanto 'yam āruṇiḥ saṃpratīmam ātmānaṃ vaiśvānaram adhyeti /
analyzed: uddālakaḥ vai bhagavantaḥ yam āruṇiḥ saṃprati imam ātmānam vaiśvānaram adhyeti
translated: O revered ones, this Uddālaka Āruṇi is now studying this very Self as Vaiśvānara.

analyzed: tam hantā abhyāgacchāma iti
translated: We shall go to him and say, He shall kill us.

analyzed: tam ha abhyājagmuḥ
translated: They went to him.

original: te ha mīmāṃsanto 'pi niścayamalabhamānāḥ sampādayāñcakruḥ sampāditavantaḥ ātmana upadeṣṭāram /
analyzed: te ha mīmāṃsantaḥ pi niścayam alabhamānāḥ sampādayāñcakruḥ sampāditavantaḥ ātmanaḥ upadeṣṭāram
translated: They, reflecting, not obtaining certainty, made an agreement, they made an agreement, to have a teacher for themselves.

original: uddālako vai prasiddho nāmato bhagavantaḥ pūjāvanto 'yamāruṇiraruṇasyāpatyaṃ samprati samyagimamātmānaṃ vaiśvānaramasmadabhipretamadhyeti /
analyzed: uddālakaḥ vai prasiddhaḥ nāmataḥ bhagavantaḥ pūjāvantaḥ yama aruṇiḥ aruṇasya apatyam samprati samyak imam ātmānam vaiśvānaram asmad abhipretam adhyeti
translated: Uddālaka, well-known by name, O venerable ones, this Āruṇi, the son of Aruṇa, is now properly approaching this Self, Vaiśvānara, which we desire.

analyzed: tam hanta idānīm abhyāgacchāma iti evam niścityam tam ha abhyājagmuḥ gatavantaḥ tam āruṇim
translated: Having thus resolved, We shall now go to him and say, 'He shall kill us,' they went to that Āruṇi.

analyzed: sa ha saṃpādayāṃ cakāra
translated: He, having made an agreement,

analyzed: prakṣyanti mām ime mahā śālāḥ mahā śrotriyāḥ
translated: These great householders, great Vedic scholars, will ask me.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ na sarvam iva pratipatsye
translated: I will not be able to answer them all.

analyzed: hanta aham anyam abhyanuśāsāni iti
translated: Well then, I will instruct another.

original: sa ha tāndṛṣṭvaiva teṣāmāgamanaprayojanaṃ buddhvā sampādayāñcakāra /
analyzed: sa ha tān dṛṣṭvā eva teṣām āgamana prayojanam buddhvā sampādayāñcakāra
translated: He, having seen them, having understood the purpose of their coming, made an agreement.

analyzed: katham
translated: How?

original: prakṣyanti māṃ vaiśvānaramime mahāśālā mahāśrotriyāstebhyo 'haṃ na sarvamiva pṛṣṭaṃ pratipatsye vaktuṃ notsahe /
analyzed: prakṣyanti mām vaiśvānaram ime mahā śālāḥ mahā śrotriyāḥ tebhyaḥ ham na sarvam iva pṛṣṭam pratipatsye vaktum na utsahe
translated: These great householders, great Vedic scholars, will ask me about Vaiśvānara. I will not be able to answer all that is asked. I am not able to speak.

analyzed: atas hanta aham idānīm anyam eṣām abhyanuśāsāni vakṣyāmi upadeṣṭāram iti
translated: Therefore, I shall now appoint another teacher for them, and tell them (about the Self).

analyzed: tān ha uvāca
translated: He said to them:

original: aśvapatir vai bhagavanto 'yaṃ kaikeyaḥ saṃpratīmam ātmānaṃ vaiśvānaram adhyeti /
analyzed: aśvapatiḥ vai bhagavantaḥ yam kaikeyaḥ saṃprati imam ātmānam vaiśvānaram adhyeti
translated: 'O revered Sirs, this Asvapati Kaikeya is now studying this Self as Vaiśvānara.

analyzed: tam hantā abhyāgacchāma iti
translated: Let us go to him.'

analyzed: tam ha abhyājagmuḥ
translated: They went to him.

analyzed: evam sampādya tān ha uvāca
translated: Having thus prepared them, he said to them:

original: aśvapatirvai nāmato bhagavanto 'yaṃ kekayasyāpatyaṃ kaikeyaḥ samprati samyagimamātmānaṃ vaiśvānaramadhyetītyādi samānam //
analyzed: aśvapatiḥ vai nāmataḥ bhagavantaḥ yam kekayasya apatyam kaikeyaḥ samprati samyak imam ātmānam vaiśvānaram adhyeti ityādi samānam
translated: 'O revered Sirs, this one named Asvapati, the son of Kaikeya, is now studying this Self as Vaiśvānara properly.' The rest is the same as before.

original: tebhyo ha prāptebhyaḥ pṛthag arhāṇi kārayāṃ cakāra /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ha prāptebhyaḥ pṛthak arhāṇi kārayāṃ cakāra
translated: For them who had come, he had separate honors performed.

analyzed: sa ha prātar saṃjihānaḥ uvāca
translated: In the morning, when he had risen, he said:

original: na me steno janapade na kadaryo na madyapaḥ /
analyzed: na me stenaḥ janapade na kadaryaḥ na madyapaḥ
translated: 'In my country there is no thief, no miser, no drunkard,

original: nānāhitāgnir nāvidvān na svairī svairiṇī kutaḥ /
analyzed: na anāhitāgniḥ na a vidvān na svairī svairiṇī kutas
translated: no one who has not installed the sacred fires, no one who is not learned, no adulterer, how can there be an adulteress?

analyzed: yakṣyamāṇaḥ vai bhagavantaḥ ham asmi
translated: O revered Sirs, I am about to perform a sacrifice.

original: yāvad ekaikasmā ṛtvije dhanaṃ dāsyāmi tāvad bhagavadbhyo dāsyāmi /
analyzed: yāvat ekaikasmai ṛtvije dhanam dāsyāmi tāvat bhagavadbhyaḥ dāsyāmi
translated: I will give as much wealth to each officiating priest as I will give to the revered ones.

analyzed: vasantu bhagavantaḥ iti
translated: Let the revered ones stay.'

analyzed: te ha ūcuḥ
translated: They said:

original: yena haivārthena puruṣaś caret taṃ haiva vadet /
analyzed: yena ha eva arthena puruṣaḥ caret tam ha eva vadet
translated: One should speak of that very purpose for which a person would act.

analyzed: ātmānam eva imam vaiśvānaram saṃprati adhyeṣi
translated: You are now instructing about this very self, Vaiśvānara.

analyzed: tam eva naḥ brūhi iti
translated: Please tell us about that very one.

analyzed: tān ha uvāca
translated: He said to them,

analyzed: prātar vaḥ prativaktāsmi iti
translated: I will reply to you in the morning.

analyzed: te ha samidh pāṇayaḥ pūrvāhṇe praticakramire
translated: They went around in the morning with fuel in their hands.

analyzed: tān ha an upanīya eva etat uvāca
translated: He spoke to them even before they had completed their studies.

original: tebhyo ha rājā prāptebhyaḥ pṛthakpṛthagarhāṇyarhaṇāni purohitairbhṛtyaiśca kārayāñcakāra kāritavān /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ ha rājā prāptebhyaḥ pṛthak pṛthak arhāṇi arhaṇāni purohitaiḥ bhṛtyaiḥ ca kārayāñcakāra kāritavān
translated: To those kings who had arrived, he had separate honors performed by his priests and servants.

original: sa hānyedyū rājā prātaḥ sañjihāna uvāca vinayenopagamyaitaddhanaṃ matta upādaddhvamiti /
analyzed: sa ha anyedyus rājā prātar sañjihānaḥ uvāca vinayena upagamya etat dhanam mattaḥ upādaddhvam iti
translated: That king, having risen in the morning, said with humility, Take this wealth from me.

original: taiḥ pratyākhyāto mayi doṣaṃ paśyanti nūnaṃ yato na pratigṛhṇanti matto dhanamiti manvāna ātmanaḥ sadvṛttatāṃ pratipipādayiṣannāha /
analyzed: taiḥ pratyākhyātaḥ mayi doṣam paśyanti nūnam yatas na pratigṛhṇanti mattaḥ dhanam iti manvānaḥ ātmanaḥ sat vṛtta tām pratipipādayiṣan āha
translated: Being refused by them, thinking, They certainly see fault in me, since they do not accept wealth from me, wishing to proclaim his own good conduct, he said,

original: na me mama janapade stenaḥ parasvahartā vidyate /
analyzed: na me mama janapade stenaḥ para sva hartā vidyate
translated: In my country there is no thief who takes another's property.

analyzed: na kadaryaḥ dātā sati vibhave
translated: There is no miser who does not give when he has the means.

analyzed: na madyapaḥ dvijottamaḥ san
translated: There is no best twice-born who drinks alcohol.

analyzed: na anāhitāgniḥ śataguḥ
translated: There is no one who has not installed the sacred fires, who is worth a hundred.

analyzed: na a vidvān adhikāra anurūpam
translated: One who is not learned is not entitled to perform the rites.

analyzed: na svairī para dāreṣu gantā
translated: One who is not a libertine does not go to other's wives.

original: ata eva svairiṇī kuto duṣṭacāriṇī na sambhavatītyarthaḥ /
analyzed: atas eva svairiṇī kutas duṣṭa cāriṇī na sambhavati iti arthaḥ
translated: For this very reason, how can a libertine be a woman of bad conduct? This is the meaning.

original: taiśca na vayaṃ dhanenārdhina ityukta āhaalpaṃ matvaite dhanaṃ na gṛhṇantīti /
analyzed: taiḥ ca na vayam dhanena ardhinaḥ iti uktaḥ āha alpam matvā ete dhanam na gṛhṇanti iti
translated: And it is said that we are not seeking wealth from them. He says that they do not accept the wealth thinking it is little.

analyzed: yakṣyamāṇaḥ vai katibhiḥ ahobhiḥ aham he bhagavantaḥ smi
translated: O Venerable Ones, I am going to perform a sacrifice in a few days.

original: tadarthaṃ kḷptaṃ dhanaṃ mayā yāvadekaikasmai yathoktamṛtvije dhanaṃ dāsyāmi tāvatpratyekaṃ bhagavadbhyo 'pi dāsyāmi /
analyzed: tad artham kḷptam dhanam mayā yāvat ekaikasmai yathā uktam ṛtvije dhanam dāsyāmi tāvat pratyekam bhagavadbhyaḥ api dāsyāmi
translated: For that purpose, I have set aside wealth, as much as I will give to each priest as mentioned, I will also give to each of you Venerable Ones.

original: vasantu bhagavantaḥ paśyantu ca mama yāgamityuktāste hocuḥ /🔽yena haivārthena prayojanena yaṃ prati caredgacchetpuruṣastaṃ haivārthaṃ vadet /
analyzed: vasantu bhagavantaḥ paśyantu ca mama yāgam iti uktāḥ te ha ūcuḥ  yena ha eva arthena prayojanena yam prati caret gacchet puruṣaḥ tam ha eva artham vadet
translated: Let the Venerable Ones stay and witness my sacrifice. Having been told this, they said:🔽One should speak of that very purpose for which and towards whom a person would go.

analyzed: idam eva prayojanam āgamanasya iti ayam nyāyaḥ satām  vayam vaiśvānara jñāna arthinaḥ
translated: This is the rule of the virtuous that this is the purpose of coming.🔽We are seeking the knowledge of the Vaiśvānara Self.

analyzed: ātmānam eva imam vaiśvānaram saṃprati adhyeṣi samyak jānāsi
translated: You are now properly teaching and knowing this very Vaiśvānara Self.

analyzed: atas tam eva naḥ smabhyam brūhi iti uktaḥ tān ha uvāca
translated: Therefore, tell us that very Self. Having been told this, he said to them:

original: prātarvo yuṣmabhyaṃ prativaktāsmi prativākyaṃ dātāsmītyuktāste ha rājño 'bhiprāyajñāḥ samitpāṇayaḥ samidbhārahastā aparedyuḥ pūrvāhne rājānaṃ
analyzed: prātar vaḥ yuṣmabhyam prativaktāsmi prativākyam dātāsmi iti uktāḥ te ha rājñaḥ bhiprāya jñāḥ samidh pāṇayaḥ samidh bhāra hastāḥ aparedyus pūrvāhne rājānam
translated: Having been told, In the morning I will reply, I will give a reply to you all, they, knowing the king's intention, with bundles of sacred fuel in their hands, on the next day, in the forenoon,

analyzed: praticakramire gatavantaḥ
translated: returned to the king.

original: yata evaṃ mahāśālā mahāśrotriyā brāhmaṇāḥ santo mahāśālatvādyabhimānaṃ hitvā samidbhārahastā jātito hīnaṃ rājānaṃ vidyārthino vinayenopajagmuḥ
analyzed: yatas evam mahā śālāḥ mahā śrotriyāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ santaḥ mahāśāla tva ādi abhimānam hitvā samidh bhāra hastāḥ jātitaḥ hīnam rājānam vidyā arthinaḥ vinayena upajagmuḥ
translated: Since those Brahmins, being great householders and great Vedic scholars, abandoning their pride due to being great householders, with bundles of sacred fuel in their hands, approached the king who was of lower caste, as seekers of knowledge with humility,

analyzed: tathā anyaiḥ vidyā upāditsubhiḥ bhavitavyam
translated: others who desire to acquire knowledge should act likewise.

analyzed: tebhyaḥ ca adāt vidyām an upanīya eva upanayanam a kṛtvā eva tān
translated: And he gave them knowledge without initiating them, without performing the initiation ceremony.

analyzed: yathā yogyebhyaḥ vidyām adāt tathā anyena api vidyā dātavyā iti ākhyāyikā arthaḥ
translated: Just as he gave knowledge to those who were fit, so knowledge should be given by others. This is the meaning of the story.

analyzed: etat vaiśvānara vijñānam uvāca iti vakṣyamāṇena sambandhaḥ
translated: This is the connection with what is going to be said, He spoke this knowledge of Vaisvanara.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi pañcama adhyāyasya ekādaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the eleventh section of the fifth chapter in Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

original: aupamanyava kaṃ tvam ātmānam upāssa iti /
analyzed: aupamanyava kam tvam ātmānam upāsse iti
translated: O Apamānya, whom do you meditate upon as the Self?

original: divam eva bhagavo rājann iti hovāca /
analyzed: divam eva bhagavaḥ rājan iti ha uvāca
translated: The heaven itself, O revered king, he said.

original: eṣa vai sutejā ātmā vaiśvānaro yaṃ tvam ātmānam upāsse /
analyzed: eṣa vai su tejāḥ ātmā vaiśvānaraḥ yam tvam ātmānam upāsse
translated: This very resplendent Self, Vaiśvānara, whom you worship as the Self,

original: tasmāt tava sutaṃ prasutam āsutaṃ kule dṛśyate //
analyzed: tasmāt tava sutam prasutam āsutam kule dṛśyate
translated: therefore, in your family, is seen the pressed, the well-pressed, the unpressed Soma.

original: sa kathamuvācetyāhaaupamanyava he kamātmānaṃ vaiśvānaraṃ tvamupāḥsa iti papraccha /
analyzed: sa katham uvāca iti āha aupamanyava he kam ātmānam vaiśvānaram tvam upāḥse iti papraccha
translated: He said this. How? He said: O Aupamanyava, whom do you worship as the Vaiśvānara Self? He asked.

analyzed: nanu ayam apanyāyaḥ ācāryaḥ san śiṣyam pṛcchati iti
translated: Is this not improper, that the teacher should ask the student?

analyzed: na eṣa doṣaḥ
translated: This is not a fault.

original: yadvettha tena mopasīda tatasta ūrdhvaṃ vakṣyāmīti nyāyadarśanāt /
analyzed: yat vettha tena mā upasīda tatas te ūrdhvam vakṣyāmi iti nyāya darśanāt
translated: Because of the principle that one should approach with what one knows, then I will speak further.

original: anyatrāpyācāryasya apratibhānavati śiṣye pratibhotpādanārthaḥ praśno dṛṣṭo 'jātaśatroḥkvaiṣa tadābhūtkuta etadāgād iti /
analyzed: anyatra api ācāryasya apratibhānavati śiṣye pratibhā utpādana arthaḥ praśnaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ jātaśatroḥ kva eṣa tadā abhūt kutas etat āgāt iti
translated: The question by the teacher to the student who lacks eloquence, in order to generate eloquence, is seen elsewhere also, as in the case of Ajātaśatru: Where was it then? Where did it come from?

original: divameva dyulokameva vaiśvānaramupāse bhagavo rājanniti hovāca /🔽eṣa vai sutejāḥ śobhanaṃ tejo yasya so 'yaṃ sutejā iti prasiddho vaiśvānara ātmā'tmano
analyzed: divam eva dyu lokam eva vaiśvānaram upāse bhagavaḥ rājan iti ha uvāca  eṣa vai su tejāḥ śobhanam tejaḥ yasya saḥ yam su tejāḥ iti prasiddhaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ ātmā ātmanaḥ
translated: He said: I worship Vaiśvānara as the world of heaven itself, O revered king.🔽This Vaiśvānara Self, who has splendid radiance, is well-known as Sutejas.🔽Since you worship that Self, which is a part of the Self, therefore,

analyzed: vayava bhūta tvāt yam tvam ātmānam ātma eka deśam upāḥse tasmāt su tejasaḥ vaiśevānarasya upāsanāt tava
translated: from the worship of Sutejas, Vaiśvānara,

original: sutamabhiṣutaṃ somarūpaṃ karmaṇi prasutaṃ prakarṣeṇa ca sutamāsutaṃ cāhargaṇādiṣu
analyzed: sutam abhiṣutam soma rūpam karmaṇi prasutam prakarṣeṇa ca sutam āsutam ca ahargaṇa ādiṣu
translated: The pressed Soma, the Soma-form, the Soma that has been pressed for the performance, and the Soma that is to be pressed, in the course of the day, etc.

analyzed: tava kule dṛśyate tīva karmiṇaḥ tvad kulīnāḥ iti arthaḥ
translated: This act is seen to be very much in your family, i.e., those who belong to your family.

analyzed: atsi annam paśyasi priyam
translated: You eat food and see what is dear.

original: atty annaṃ paśyati priyam bhavaty asya brahmavarcasaṃ kule ye etam evam ātmānaṃ vaiśvānaram upāste /
analyzed: atti annam paśyati priyam bhavati asya brahmavarcasam kule ye etam evam ātmānam vaiśvānaram upāste
translated: One who eats food and sees what is dear, to him there is prosperity in his family, and the splendour of Brahman, for those who worship this very Self as Vaisvanara.

original: mūdhā tv eṣa ātmana iti hovāca /
analyzed: tu eṣaḥ ātmanaḥ iti ha uvāca
translated: But this is the head of your Self, he said.

original: mūrdhā te vyapatiṣyad yan māṃ nāgamiṣya iti //
analyzed: mūrdhā te vyapatiṣyat yat mām na agamiṣyaḥ iti
translated: Your head would have fallen off if you had not come to me.

original: atsyannaṃ dīptāgniḥ sanpaśyasi ca putrapautrādi priyamiṣṭam /
analyzed: atsi annam dīpta agniḥ san paśyasi ca putra pautra ādi priyam iṣṭam
translated: One who has a blazing fire eats food and sees what is dear, such as a son, grandson, etc.

original: anyo 'pyattyannaṃ paśyati ca priyaṃ bhavatyasya sutaṃ prasutamāsutamityādikarmitvaṃ /
analyzed: anyaḥ pyatti annam paśyati ca priyam bhavati asya sutam prasutam āsutam iti ādi karmitvam
translated: Another eats food and sees what is dear, and to him there is the state of being an active performer, such as having pressed Soma, having pressed Soma well, having pressed Soma in the course of the day, etc.

original: brahmavarcasaṃ kule yaḥ kaścidetaṃ yathoktamevaṃ vaiśvānaramupāste /
analyzed: brahmavarcasam kule yaḥ kaścid etam yathā uktam evam vaiśvānaram upāste
translated: The splendour of Brahman in the family, whoever worships this very Vaisvanara as described.

original: mūrdhā tvātmano vaiśvānarasyaiṣa na samasto vaiśvānaraḥ /
analyzed: mūrdhā tu ātmanaḥ vaiśvānarasya eṣa na samastaḥ vaiśvānaraḥ
translated: But this is the head of your Self, of Vaisvanara. This is not the complete Vaisvanara.

original: ataḥ samastabuddhyā vaiśvānarasyopāsanānmūrdhā śiraste viparītagrāhimo vyapatiṣyadvipatitamabhaviṣyat /
analyzed: atas samasta buddhyā vaiśvānarasya upāsanāt mūrdhā śiraḥ te viparīta grāhimaḥ vyapatiṣyat vipatitam abhaviṣyat
translated: Therefore, by the worship of Vaiśvānara with the entire understanding, your head, the head, would have fallen, would have fallen,

analyzed: yat yadi mām na āgamiṣyaḥ na āgataḥ bhaviṣyaḥ
translated: if you had not come to me, if you had not come.

analyzed: sādhu akārṣīḥ yat mām āgataḥ si iti abhiprāyaḥ
translated: The meaning is that it is good that you have come to me.

analyzed: iti chāndogyopaniṣadi pañcama adhyāyasya dvādaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: Thus ends the twelfth section in the fifth chapter of Chāndogya Upaniṣad.

analyzed: atha ha uvāca satyayajñam pauluṣim
translated: Then he said to Satyayajña Pauluṣi:

original: prācīnayogya kaṃ tvam ātmānam upāssa iti /
analyzed: prācīnayogya kam tvam ātmānam upāsse iti
translated: O Prācīnayogya, which Self do you worship?

original: ādityam eva bhagavo rājann iti hovāca /
analyzed: ādityam eva bhagavaḥ rājan iti ha uvāca
translated: The sun, O revered king, he said.

original: eṣa vai viśvarūpa ātmā vaiśvānaro yaṃ tvam ātmānam upāste /
analyzed: eṣa vai viśvarūpaḥ ātmā vaiśvānaraḥ yam tvam ātmānam upāste
translated: This is the all-formed Self, Vaiśvānara, whom you worship as the Self.

original: tasmāt tava bahu viśvarūpaṃ kule dṛśyate //
analyzed: tasmāt tava bahu viśva rūpam kule dṛśyate
translated: Therefore, in your family, many all-formed things are seen.

original: atha hovāca satyayajñaṃ pauluṣiṃ he prācīnayogya kaṃ tvamātmānamupāsta ityādityameva bhagavo rājanniti hovāca /
analyzed: atha ha uvāca satyayajñam pauluṣim he prācīnayogya kam tvam ātmānam upāste iti ādityam eva bhagavaḥ rājan iti ha uvāca
translated: Then he said to Satyayajña Pauluṣi, O Prācīnayogya, which Self do you worship? He said, The sun, O revered king.

analyzed: śukla nīla ādi rūpa tvāt viśva rūpa tvam ādityasya sarva rūpa tvāt vā
translated: The sun has all forms, or because it has the form of white, blue, etc.

original: sarvāṇi rūpāṇi hi tvāṣṭrāṇi yato 'to vā viśvarūpa ādityastadupāsanāttava bahu viśvarūpamihāmutrārthamupakaraṇaṃ dṛśyate kule //
analyzed: sarvāṇi rūpāṇi hi tvāṣṭrāṇi vā viśva rūpaḥ ādityaḥ tad upāsanāt tava bahu viśva rūpam iha amutra artham upakaraṇam dṛśyate kule
translated: Since all forms are indeed created by Tvaṣṭṛ, therefore the Āditya is called Viśvarūpa. By worshipping him, many forms of means for the purpose of this world and the next are seen in the family.

analyzed: śvatarī rathaḥ dāsī niṣkaḥ
translated: The chariot yoked with two mules, the necklace of female slaves.

analyzed: atsi annam paśyasi priyam
translated: You will eat food, you will see what is dear.

original: atty annaṃ paśyati priyaṃ bhavaty asya brahmavarcasaṃ kule ya etam evam ātmānaṃ vaiśvānaram upāste /
analyzed: atti annam paśyati priyam bhavati asya brahmavarcasam kule yaḥ etam evam ātmānam vaiśvānaram upāste
translated: One who worships this Ātman as Vaiśvānara eats food, sees what is dear, and his family obtains Brahmic glory.

original: cakṣuṣ ṭv etad ātmana iti hovāca /
analyzed: cakṣuḥ tu etat ātmanaḥ iti ha uvāca
translated: He said, This is indeed the eye of the Ātman.

analyzed: andhaḥ bhaviṣyaḥ yat mām na agamiṣyaḥ iti
translated: You would have been blind if you had not come to me.

original: kiñca tvāmanu pravṛtto 'śvatarībhyāṃ yukto ratho 'śvatarīratho dāsīniṣko dāsībhiryukto niṣko hāro dāsīniṣkaḥ /
analyzed: kiñca tvām anu pravṛttaḥ śvatarībhyām yuktaḥ rathaḥ śvatarī rathaḥ dāsī niṣkaḥ dāsībhiḥ yuktaḥ niṣkaḥ hāraḥ dāsī niṣkaḥ
translated: Moreover, the chariot yoked with two mules, the necklace of female slaves. The necklace is a string of pearls. The necklace of female slaves.

analyzed: atsi annam ityādi samānam
translated: You will eat food, etc. is the same as before.

analyzed: cakṣuḥ vaiśvānarasya tu savitā
translated: The eye of Vaiśvānara is Savitṛ.

original: tasya samastabuddhyopāsanādandho 'bhaviṣyaścakṣurhīno 'bhavi ṣyo yanmāṃ nā'gamiṣya iti pūrvavat //🔽iti cchāndogyopaniṣadi pañcamādhyāyasya trayodaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
analyzed: tasya samasta buddhyā upāsanāt andhaḥ bhaviṣyaḥ cakṣuḥ hīnaḥ bhaviṣyaḥ yat mām na agamiṣyaḥ iti pūrvavat 🔽iti chāndogyopaniṣadi pañcama adhyāyasya trayodaśaḥ khaṇḍaḥ
translated: By worshipping him with the complete intellect, he would have been blind, would have been deprived of sight, if he had not come to me. As before.

analyzed: atha ha uvāca indradyumnam bhāllaveyam
translated: Then he said to Indradyumna Bhallāviya,

original: vaiyāghrapadya kaṃ tvam ātmānam upāssa iti /
analyzed: vaiyāghrapadya kam tvam ātmānam upāsse iti
translated: O son of Vyaghrapada, which Self do you meditate upon?

original: vāyum eva bhagavo rājann iti hovāca /
analyzed: vāyum eva bhagavaḥ rājan iti ha uvāca
translated: The wind, O revered king, said he.

original: eṣa vai pṛthagvartmātmā vaiśvānaro yaṃ tvam ātmānam upāsse /
analyzed: eṣa vai pṛthak vartmā ātmā vaiśvānaraḥ yam tvam ātmānam upāsse
translated: Verily, that Self which you meditate upon is the Vaiśvānara Self with separate paths.

original: tasmāt tvāṃ pṛthag balaya āyanti pṛthag rathaśreṇayo 'nuyanti //
analyzed: tasmāt tvām pṛthak balayaḥ āyanti pṛthak ratha śreṇayaḥ nuyanti
translated: Therefore, separate forces come to you, separate rows of chariots follow you.

original: atha hovācendradyumnaṃ bhāllaveyaṃ vaiyāghrapadya kaṃ tvamātmānamupāḥsa ityādi samānam /
analyzed: atha ha uvāca indradyumnam bhāllaveyam vaiyāghrapadya kam tvam ātmānam upāḥse ityādi samānam
translated: Then he said to Indradyumna Bhallāviya, O son of Vyaghrapada, which Self do you meditate upon? and so on, the same as before.

original: pṛthagvartmā nānā vartmāni yasya vāyorāvahodvahādibhirbhedairvartamānasya so 'yaṃ pṛthagvartmā vāyuḥ /
analyzed: pṛthak vartmā nānā vartmāni yasya vāyoḥ āvaha udvaha ādibhiḥ bhedaiḥ vartamānasya saḥ yam pṛthak vartmā vāyuḥ
translated: The one with separate paths is the wind whose paths are separate, existing through the distinctions of inhalation, exhalation, etc. That is this Vaiśvānara wind with separate paths.

original: tasmātpṛthagvartmātmano vaiśvānarasyopāsanātpṛthaṅnānādikkāstvāṃ balayo vasrānnādilakṣaṇā balaya āyantyāgacchanti /
analyzed: tasmāt pṛthak vartma ātmanaḥ vaiśvānarasya upāsanāt pṛthak nānā dikkāḥ tvām balayaḥ vasra anna ādi lakṣaṇāḥ balayaḥ āyanti āgacchanti
translated: Therefore, due to meditating upon the Vaiśvānara Self with separate paths, separate forces, consisting of clothes, food, etc., come to you, approach you.

analyzed: pṛthak ratha śreṇayaḥ ratha paṅktayaḥ pi tvām anuyanti
translated: Separate rows of chariots, lines of chariots, also follow you.

analyzed: atsi annam paśyasi priyam
translated: You eat food, you see what is dear.

original: atty annaṃ paśyati priyaṃ bhavaty asya brahmavarcasaṃ kule ya etam evam ātmānaṃ vaiśvānaram upāste /
analyzed: atti annam paśyati priyam bhavati asya brahmavarcasam kule yaḥ etam evam ātmānam vaiśvānaram upāste
